M9RPYTUZm7FrsARzij-Nfw.text: We love coming here for Sunday brunch. Great food and a very friendly and knowledgeable staff.

NXzKX4whajJUDhfEWhxMXA.text: Good stuff, came here to celebrate my cousin taking the boards. We caught the end of happy hour - Half priced bottles of champagne, dollar oysters, and also a deal on crawfish boil. Good stuff, would definitely recommend their happy hour... Mon - Fri 4:30 - 6:30.

Fivw-Aiu-CLQNzdnZbSzDA.text: By far the best oysters I have ever had in Pittsburgh!!! The ambiance was looking lovely with traditional New Orleans music who could want more! French 75's are the way to my heart. We will definitely be returning regulars.

4gnUEh4hs2Wdfj3QMf_X2A.text: Food was excellent! Brought back memories of a fantastic trip to New Orleans. Oysters, gumbo, red beans and rice, fried chicken, pimento cheese--we would order all again. Service was knowledgeable, attentive and fun. We will be back!

5XJ4iQmd1Jqi-cIlNX37IA.text: My husband and I made reservations a week in advance and were looking forward to Muddy Waters. We arrived and were seated promptly at a tall top table across from the bar. While the restaurant is narrow, we weren't bothered by the size. We did notice the table to be slightly wobbly.   After receiving oysters to start, the small table was pretty full. My husband accidentally knocked his 3/4 full cocktail off the table. The hostess noticed and grabbed an extra napkin. She walked away - we assumed she was getting more napkins - but she didn't come back to us the rest of the evening. When a restaurant is considered $$$, it seems like someone in the staff would help clean a spilled drink and at least offer to get a new one. Neither happened. (We don't mind the expense of a new drink, mainly frustrated with lack of help cleaning)  The service was subpar. Our waiter checked in very periodically. I ordered a cocktail at first with plans to switch to wine and never ordered a glass, as the waiter did not come back in time.   We decided we will not be back. Not impressed with the pricing or lack of service. I will be the first to say the gumbo was great and oysters were good.

qjFVxynjq8j3ge4rSCnBMw.text: What a unique atmosphere! My boyfriend and I loved everything about our experience. The cocktails were outstanding! I tried the 'It's about thyme' & 'I wish I was in Dixie' and they did not disappoint. I ordered the crab cluster and although crab legs do involve a little bit of work, this was a welcomed challenge after my first taste of crabmeat! Also- TRY THE LOBSTER ROLL!! Delicious! And the service was great!

djNfP8oyU0qpZI9S2Yavfg.text: This was the best and most interesting menu I've seen in awhile.  Not often that I want to try just about everything on the menu!  Drinks were tasty and reasonably priced, atmosphere is nice,  staff was all friendly and on point and the food was hot and flavorful!  We had the foie gras deviled eggs, fried green tomatoes and pork rinds,  we couldn't pick a favorite they were all delicious!  Then we had a halibut special with these amazing blue grits and a bowl of gumbo that had so much depth to it.  We can't wait to go back and try more!

OlFEyb1rpJibrm8qnDja7w.text: new favorite restaurant in pittsburgh.  menu is unique to pittsburgh and im so glad cause no where else can you get new orleans style chargrilled oysters!!  great flavors and service!  get there early or make reservations.

0vL9876rXdKQMQjv4NjDNg.text: So good each time we've been there! Service is always great and the raw bar is the best we've had in Pittsburgh.

pBux5ZaoulH6KT_YIwRQ8A.text: Service was great. The food is Homemade the oysters are amazing. Good cocktail and beer selection. That's all you need to know.

6yLey7bv0O87SmIZupo-vw.text: Excellent service! I'm not a seafood fan so I had the steak and fries and they were delicious!

uZi_83CNTtwUMVFwBnUyNw.text: I love the food, atmosphere and staff here! Such a unique place that is an asset to Pittsburgh's charm. I highly recommend this place for something different that will become a craving and staple. There is one bartender I always hope is not there because she is awful but the rest of the staff is amazing!

JMypNmoJAzwE9nNGmYX0Aw.text: This place is great! Stopped here when visiting my mother in Shady Side. Oysters were great & they have an awesome happy hour! $1 east coast oysters & $2 west. Drinks are fantastic & they have a wonderful top shelf selection! I will most definitely be back! The bartenders, servers, & chucker were super cool & fun as well!

dWAModlE9qbUkPy542Qy1Q.text: Everything we had was delicious - especially the truffle hush puppies. Really good happy hour - especially if you like oysters. We had both east coast and west coast oysters. East were larger than west, and the west were a bit sweeter. Both were yummy. Excited to have a good raw bar in the burgh!

P3kbvfIyGa9uFlTFrvTcJw.text: I love that Zagat finally put the Pittsburgh food scene on the map (long overdue) and Muddy is in the best neighborhood in the burgh... East end.   My old stomping grounds and this used to be an Ethiopian joint that I actually liked.  This place is ok... And I mean that.   Nothing wrong at all.  Oysters are good but it is an oyster bar so they should be.   No horsy or cocktail and this was a minus for me.   Food is creole type but frankly not as good as Nola's in the Square.  I had the shrimp po boy... And New Orleans staple.  It was ok.  We had some cocktails... They were ok.   You getting my drift here.  Nothing wrong with this place and worth a shot but also nothing to make it stand out.  For record... Wait staff was good!

100CFPAzZzNMf9zILmXnaw.text: Amazing! This place has been on our list for awhile and it definitely over delivered. The food was even better than described on the menu. Great food. Great drinks. Fun and casual atmosphere and very nice staff. We'll definitely be back!

KwnKJocb8m77NOj5TD4wuQ.text: Loved this place, Our server was Rob and they are lucky to have him. Friendly, patient and knows his drinks, he gave us great detailed service and a drink recipe to boot! For drinks my sister and I ordered the French 75 and the Sippin summer porch or something like that...sorry I had a few and cant remember, but it had fresh watermelon juice and rum and lime and St Germain in it and was the perfect summer drink, refreshing and not too sweet. For dinner we split the Seafood Gumbo and the Shrimp and Grits. The Gumbo was good until I tried the shrimp and grits and that was all I wanted to eat. Yes you have to peel the shrimp but this dish had such great flavors that it was worth getting youre hands a little messy, BTW they give you hand towelettes. The Grits are buttery and creamy and the andouille sausage was smoky and just a nice texture, there was some kind of brown Cajun gravy on top of the grits as well as some pickled coleslaw, I think. You cannot lose with this dish, it is rich and packed with great flavors and textures. I would like to go back to try other dishes, as everything they were bringing out of the kitchen looked great, For dessert we had the Beignets with a thick dark chocolate bourbon infused sauce. My sister went nuts for this but although I liked them, I would like to try something else the next time we go back. I am glad Pgh has upped theyre game with this unique resteraunt with great food and service.

YsPndba1ydUGGTVCMPzSJA.text: Chargrilled oysters were awesome. Been here a bunch of times and got lobster rolls and they were always great, we got two last night and they were dry and full of large shells. First time I've not liked something from muddy waters

nJRPU29hnyjogssp6sl1-g.text: Loved our experience here!  We left a crappy dozen oysters behind us at Eleven and ended up at spot with better ambiance, better oysters, and better people.  Really fantastic oysters and a great team both behind the bar and on the floor.  We picked a crappy bottle of bubbles but that's on us.  The non-oyster food options looked amazing too.  We'll definitely be back.

PWZ_cDKhcy-cKSvfpNmdPA.text: The food is really great!! Happy hour is a highlight!! You definitely need to try the banana French toast, it is AMAZING!!! One of the few best brunches in Pittsburgh!

DdDpN01a3vFm5hCivtVe2w.text: I actually don't think a review could grasp how awesome this place is. I've tried a lot of restaurants since moving here a few months ago and this one blows every one out of the water. This is definitely my new favorite restaurant and I will be back sometime this week (haha)!!   This restaurant takes you away from the Pittsburgh city life and gives you a comfortable southern vibe with the awesome ambiance and live music along with the best raw bar EVER! The service was awesome and the drinks and food couldn't have been better. We went here for my roommates 23rd bday and spent good times with good food and champagne.   We ordered the pimento dip, hush puppies, and foie Gras deviled eggs for appetizers. Usually you don't see deviled eggs on a menu but when I tell you these are the best deviled eggs you'll ever eat, take my word. A..ma...zing!!!!! For our entrees we ordered mac and cheese, alligator po boy, and lobster roll. Zero complaints, well done!

photos.caption: Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lobster Roll
Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Alligator Po Boy
Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mac n Cheese

xPbW3F4MwDKph2BI3J80_Q.text: We had Oysters couple of times during the lunch time. They have a lot os options of Oysters and I tasted some of them. Honestly I didn't find so much difference between them is terms of taste so normally I order the oyster of the day because is cheaper specially if you big fan of oysters, you wanna get a lot of them-lol! I like their oyster sauce and they are always fresh (and it has to be, no?!). During the week they have a lunch menu which is health, good and cheap but portion maybe is small if you eat a lot.

qbmtlxg5w60AHh-fSPfh3A.text: I've been lucky enough to visit Muddy Waters Oyster Bar a few times.  I drive past it daily - and was - SO excited when I saw them remodeling and then saw "OYSTER BAR" in the name.  YES!  Finally!  I've tried so many things on the menu - Oysters (of course), Fried Green Tomatoes, Oysters Rockefeller, Deviled Eggs, hushpuppies, salmon "corndogs", beignets and so much other yumminess.  Every time I visit - it seems like it gets better and better.  I've been lucky enough to do the "chefs Platter" - where you try 2 of every oyster available.  I've found that I am an "east coast" oyster fan more so than a west coast.  The next time I visited - knowing this - we were lucky to be there for happy hour.  While you can try east coast ($1) and west coast ($2) you must order 6/type.  So - naturally we got 6 of each.    They have a great drink selection as well.  I ordered the "I mississippi you" just cause i liked the name - turns out it was a GREAT drink too!  Has jalapeno in it - and was spicy perfection!  I recommend heading to Muddy Waters if you are a oyster fan.  They have quite a bit on the menu if you aren't - but it's an oyster bar!  That's what they are known for! Definitely a fantastic happy hour location!

photos.caption: Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. You can&#39;t go wrong with their deviled eggs and happy hour oysters!
Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

yyWm06JEIEJ4WqAQMhV12Q.text: My husband and I came here on one of those really warm Fridays in back in February (hello global warming) and this place was packed! So, happy I planned a head and got a reservation. Would definitely recommend a reservation as this is a small space.   Since it was the Friday before Fat Tuesday we went all in with oysters, lobster roll, and their special that night a cajun crawfish boil. My husband, who has been to New Orleans said it was the most authentic food he's had in Pittsburgh. And, while I've never been to the Big Easy, I will say the oysters were the freshest I've ever had this far in-land.  Yeah Muddy Waters is the real deal, but definitely make a reservation. Also, our waiter was super nice and an excellent server.   Oh, this is not a place for small kids. There's no changing table in the bathroom, a new mom I'm always on the lookout for changing tables.

photos.caption: Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Crawfish boil!!!!

c0MZzljGa92nm3c-hjwRlA.text: $1 east coast oysters and $2 west coast. (Last time I checked).  The west coast ones are totally worth it.   The shrimp and grits have these big head-on shrimps. Big surprise.   We also had the seafood gumbo, but we are not too familiar with this dish so we are not going to judge.   Overall it was a good time and certainly will be back again.

Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

jtxDny_b8daOgIsjmqV_Eg.text: The food is delicious, the atmosphere is great and her s jazz some nights, the staff is always very respectful and helpful.

GzU_L3deO01UyPWhsRFC2w.text: I had high hopes for this place, I'm not a big oyster fan but will try anything.    Everything I ate here seemed like it was cooked in.... how do I say this.... "Muddy Waters."  I went to New Orleans and I like seafood and saw some cool food on the menu. I tried a grilled oyster with butter and crumbs. It was cooked right melted in my mouth like butter but the flavor was not what I like.  I ordered the alligator gumbo to be daring and the flavoring was off and not what I  like.  I ordered the Louisiana lobster and crayfish roll. It tasted fishy and not to my liking.  I think everything was made well and my service was good but the flavorings were not to my liking even though I think it's supposed to taste that way.... just not for me I guess.

dsFYJDyEPkAlv5zEskrCOQ.text: This place is awesome: 1) Great service and top shelf staff. Not just friendly but knowledgeable, professional and clearly vested in what they're doing. 2) Great drinks, excellent beer list 3) Phenomenal classic NO / southern food with a not too heretical contemporary twist. So f'ing good. The oysters are bomb, great selection, super fresh, reasonable prices. The wedge salad with smoked blue cheese is off the hook it's not even funny. The alligator and sausage gumbo, forget about it, you're done, put a fork in ya. The po boys looked amazing, huge and the cajun fries are real deal. Killer happy hour (I missed it by a few but they priced my first beer and app at HR price without even mentioning it), with a late night HR as well. I could go on and on, could eat here every night, there's something for everyone. Don't be shy, don't be a foo, check it out!

61uovKI_C64V1AWAX7aeoQ.text: This is probably some of the best food that I have had in Pittsburgh. The Chef is definitely cooking up Cajun calssics the right way.   We did a complete sample of the menu minue dessert. The cocktail I order was absolutely delicious. It was the horse and donkey and like the server said it was sweet and smokey. We indulged in a sample of the various oysters and they were so fresh. Definitely want to go back and try more.  As for as our course order we ordered, a cup of gumbo. The gator and sausage was so tasty, the soup itself was very flavorful and was perfect with the rice. The fried green tomatoes and sauce was amazing. The tomatoes are slices were perfect and the sauce they serve it with was yummy.  We split a whole fried fish which was snapper. The presentation alone was great. But the fish was fried to perfection and it was served over cheddar grits and greens. As a person who knows good grits and greens these were made to perfection. I would come back just to eat a bowl of greens.  Overall muddy waters is doing a fantastic job. I recommend this place for any occasion.

yZtRxjmCJkqOs32St6ot5g.text: Anyone that complains about the price of 22 bucks for a good lobster needs to stick to McDonald's.  Right size great taste and great oysters to wash it down with. Other than sucky parking, this place is great

hIOAQRg3BZdvqkDwmvdO7A.text: Omg!! I had the best cocktail apps and dinner here ... This place u can take your date meet up with friends...oooooo and there happy hour 1/2 off drinks and oysters  The staff are super nice helpful and they know the menu from A - Z  So check this place out my yelpers

JmEvHAM0MY6nD7UbWEvBMg.text: As many of you know, I'm sure, birthday celebrations can escalate quickly. Well, that is what happened one fateful night in February, and come sunrise, we needed sustenance - and FAST! Enter Muddy Waters.  I have never liked raw oysters - something about the texture does not agree with my palette. I was outvoted, and to the oyster bar we went. We walked in and were seated right away (which, for a rough morning, was satisfying to say the least). We had instant access to the Bloody Mary bar, which was fantastic and offered many options to create a drink that could serve as a meal.  The table ordered a dozen oysters, and I went ahead and dove in. While I didn't have an awful experience, I wouldn't eat an oyster again - still not for me. However, everyone in my group LOVED them - so much that they ordered more.  Now, for the meal. I'm convinced my shrimp po boy was sent from heaven to reassure me that there are still great things in the world. I also received enough food to feed me later on in the day, and I am typically a plate-cleaner. Great value for the price!  I will definitely be back to enjoy another po boy soon - though I should really try something new, it will be tough not to order the same thing (it was so good!)

-lN1XJKg-igzptiZwo2H8w.text: Super FRESH oysters verified by shellfish allergy personnel. Lobster roll is delicious.

cMKxGweE-pacEr1OC91wBA.text: I love seafood and this is one of my favorite places to eat! My friends and I love their happy hour. Great prices on wine and oysters and everything is always delicious.  The brunch is amazing as well, get the beignets (basically fresh little donuts) and the shrimp and grits! Yum!

THhAEF4Y_osdi8Goa4rNDw.text: I'll start first with the drinks. They were phenomenal! I got an old fashion and my girlfriend got "about fig'n thyme". Really different and tasty! I would definitely get a drink from their list when visiting. If you're a whiskey drinker, they have a great selection.  We started out with hush puppies. Great remoulade that it comes with. That was the best thing we ate at Muddy Waters. I got the shrimp and oyster po boy. The shrimp was sub par, and there were few oysters on it. It wasn't bad, but it just wasn't great. My girlfriend got the lobster roll. By the time our food got to us, the bread was soggy from all the butter that they put on it. The lobster and crawfish itself were good, but the fact that the bread was unenjoyable, really puts a dent in that rating.  I will be back to try oysters, jambalaya, and gumbo, along with some other drinks. But the sandwiches were not top notch for me. I would still give it a try! Be sure to book reservation in advance.

nDbnra_O_GCkr1JZCAWkWQ.text: I really like this place. Nothing astonishing, food is quite good and the cocktails are made well. Nice, casual ambiance. I will say that their foie gras deviled eggs are TO DIE FOR. And I don't even like deviled eggs. Those alone are worth checking the place out.

hYv7GfZWq-qRT01smX0GhA.text: SO GOOD. We made a reservation through yelp for brunch. The entire experience from walking in the door to walking out was fantastic. It was fun to pay a little homage to nola without going too overboard. We have the beignets, oysters, bananas foster French toast, and birds nest, and they were all generous portions and tasted delicious. We've been struggling to find restaurants in Pittsburgh that we thoroughly enjoy, but this one tops the list for sure. We will definitely be back

LWr9_Gk9Mne-RA2BRE9VPA.text: Best oysters for a landlocked state! Great customer service and super clean restaurant!

eOepSKeBrCqDPbuANDLL_A.text: Started off with sweet potato corn bread...amazing. Had the Don Wayne cocktail....amazing. We got oyster shooters....amazing. For brunch I got the Shrimp Bahn Mi....amazing. My wife got the lobster roll...amazing. The fries...amazing.   Overall, awesome spot. Great atmosphere, great music. Having been to New Orleans a few times, this definitely makes you feel like your there.  Will definitely be back!

MpmqrLSdr4B27O-snFN36w.text: Did I hear $1 oyster happy hour? Yes, it's True! So I had to stop in, even if it was just for the oysters. And that's exactly what we did. It's actually $1 for East Coast and $2 for West Coast from 4:30pm-6:30pm. Can't get much better than that! Note: you must order a minimum of six.   Upon entering the restaurant, you'll feel like you've transported to Louisiana. The music really sets the tone but so does the rustic feel of the decor. It was rustic, yet modern. The size is a bit small with a long bar to the left as soon as you walk in and a small dining area of tables in the back. You can even watch them shuck the oysters at the bar if you so choose, given those seats are available.   The service was quick. I mean, we did only just get the raw oysters. But the waiter was patient and attentive. We ordered 12 East Coast oysters and they were great. I particularly liked the unique sauce they served with it. It was like a peppery vinegar of some sort that complemented the oysters quite well; although I still preferred just lemon. They also bring out a basket with hot sauce and crackers to go along with the oysters. However, they didn't bring out cocktail sauce so that's something you have to ask for if that's a condiment you enjoy with your oysters.   Oysters are my absolute favorite and I'm so glad to see an oyster bar pop up in Pittsburgh. I will definitely be back for not only more oysters, but to try out other items from the menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. $1 East Coast oysters at happy hour: 4:30pm-6:30pm! ($2 West Coast)

wDnuzDN52gZkoUWhJg9I-w.text: Although my visiting friends and I could not get back for another meal, I want to acknowledge the owner Diana for apologizing for the lengthy wait for a reserved table and offered to make everything right for us. I greatly appreciate her commitment to her customers and am sure they've learned how to ensure their tremendous success does not inconvenience customers. Thank you so much, Muddy Waters!

B4tDYGM3WAVenHPtub_2Tg.text: We just had brunch here. It was amazing. We ordered the lobster Benedict and pina pancake special. It was the best lobster Benedict I have had. I also ordered the Bloody Mary bar and tried the ghost pepper hot sauce. Big mistake.  It was ridiculously spicy. Our server Cameron noticed, and warned me. When I tasted it, I agreed. Cameron brought me another Bloody Mary on the house. We will definitely be back. I can't wait to try the oysters. :)

GqkGc0ltgwrNoOSbWTr8Nw.text: I am in love with this place.  My friend and I came in Saturday evening and sat at the cute bar area that's first come, first served.  We ordered the East-West Coast chef's tasting oysters. These change regularly (daily?) and we were excited to try all of them. The oysters tasted fresh and delicious, and the sparkling wine we got paired beautifully with them. My favorites were the Pickering Pass, James River, and Wellfleet, but we generally enjoyed all of them.  We also split a cup of the chicken and sausage gumbo. The gumbo tasted so rich and smoky. People often talk about depth of flavor, and this gumbo had it. The sausage and the spice were quite nice also. I felt like the chicken could be a bit.. more moist(?), but overall, I loved this gumbo.  I also tried their deviled eggs. It definitely tasted smoky as described and was pretty delicious. A little more pickling in all the other ingredients than maybe I would have liked, but I still loved it.  Muddy Waters seems trendy in a good way; the service is friendly, already knowledgeable (surprising given how new this place is!), and attentive; the food seems great and there are soooo many other items I want to try (shrimp and grits!! lobster roll!!! mac & cheese!!!).  I have a feeling that I'm going to be a regular here. :D

2oV-hIjTWzArACxSVEBG_Q.text: It was ok. Parking was a problem. The oysters were supposedly outstanding but I cannot eat oysters so I went there for my guests. My Cajun shrimp were mushy, nasty old shrimp and they should never have been served. I will not go back.

PdDqAbAzWBXZ6UuYwlVb4A.text: Had a great time this past Sunday. We were sat right away for our 11am reservation. I ordered a French 75 while my friends got the Bloody Mary bar. Everyone was pleased. For brunch, I decided on the fried oyster po boy which was amazing I could eat 3 in one sitting. Everyone at my table also enjoyed their meals (French toast, chicken and biscuits, and lobster Benedict) and we will definitely be back.   If I could make one super small critique, it would be that our food could've been a tad bit hotter, but since everything was perfect 5 stars it is. Good show old man. Good show.

i-j4BedQXtcv4-qfPQWAzA.text: I really like the food here. Oysters are fresh (the ones I've had any way), and they actually have fresh crawfish on Sundays.   Minus one star because the raw clams tasted questionable.   Minus another start because the crawfish were too spicy for me to eat. All burn and little flavor. The corn was delicious, but even that I had to stop every so often to give the taste buds a break.    Everything else was amazing.  Would recommend the skillet cornbread and lobster roll.

pIy-TW-QbINVS6l3hB1mwQ.text: Always a great experience! Best oysters in the city. The staff are very friendly and accommodating.

RgPyLnm7yk8Bsm0Yss2whw.text: Went here for the restaurant week special, will definitely be back. bartenders were friendly and one explained one of the specialty cocktails she was making. food was delicious and server was also friendly and funny. all around a good experience.

j-w4B_oBDyg1LHMAxvPEwQ.text: Absolutely the best seafood I've had in Pittsburgh. Will definitely come again for the gator sandwich and charcoal grilled oysters.

hrTgqEtjJXdhoiMrwLGIrQ.text: This review is for their brunch and what a lovely brunch it was. There was an issue with our reservation when we arrived as we updated it with more people but the restaurant never got the update. I guess this was done through Facebook so I am not faulting the restaurant. Also they sent out 2 plates of beignets for our table to make up for it.  For starters they have many drink options including an amazing bloody Mary bar.  I don't like tomato juice but  was ready to order a bloody Mary just  for the awesome toppings from bacon to homemade pickles of every sort.  They have plenty of other fruity cocktails but they are a bit pricy.  The brunch menu has a lot to choose from. I don't eat seafood so I was a bit worried but they have a few entrees sans seafood including French toast. I went with the traditional eggs, toast, meat breakfast.  I choose scrambled eggs with bacon and a biscuit instead of toast. They also serve this with a  side of fruit and grits.  So glad I went with the biscuit as it was fantastic-served warm with butter.  Grits can be hit or miss and these were a hit-so cheesy and just the right consistency.  Our  server was great for the large party of 8 we had. My only issue was it is so small inside and loud.   They have a nice bar and I think that is where I would pick to sit next time.

haj7z1KOCmd_sEN0ErzdrQ.text: East End resident.  Been going here since it first opened.   The Good:  The food here is excellent.  Not just the quality of the food but the imaginative menu selections.   My favorites are the Fried Green Tomatoes and the Lobster Roll.  The raw bar fare is always superb and fresh - always get the East-West oyster tasting and I'm never disappointed.   The cocktails are creative and delicious and they have a good selection of wines and craft beers.   The Bad:   Drink service is horrible.   Table service is not much better.   I suspect that this is due more to poor management than to the skills of the employees.    It seems that there is poor communication between kitchen and waitstaff and between waiters and bartenders.  Food is often brought out of sync with drinks.  Maybe they need more staff in the front of the house.     I would advise anyone going here to order a bottle of something when you order your cocktails because otherwise you are likely to find yourself for long stretches with food in front of you and nothing to drink.

sRoIVp9T61Ow2cSQfjBmjw.text: The service was really good, our waitress did a great job explaining the oysters they had on special. Great for happy hour- $1 east coast oysters, $2 west coast. I loved the poboy, and the beignets were yummy.

c8gc2G3abQ7iUGJM0uHfvg.text: Had a great birthday dinner of oysters and fried fish.  The best part were the drinks and desert. Don't miss the black bottom pecan pie!

photos.caption: Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

O9pdI8TNnD1Md6g-A4OWpA.text: We came here on a Saturday, with reservations. We were sat right away. The server was very helpful in explaining the menu and had a vast knowledge of each item. We ended up sharing a seafood tower which, we weren't sure would be enough but it was! It was just the perfect amount without making us too full that we opted for dessert (usually we pass, but it was also my birthday). Each oyster was described to us, all tasting very fresh and distinct from the others based on geographic location. We had the bourbon pecan ice cream for dessert which was house made and amazing. I can't wait to go back!

ikAvjj0kmz9tr30HZ7oHxg.text: We ate here for my husband's birthday. He loves oysters! The oysters were great! Nice variety. We also ordered 2 entrees. The blackened salmon and BBQ shrimp and grits. Both were awesome and the presentation was amazing! Highly recommend you try this place!

PpkStIz_1ruCzdpeYkG55w.text: Cocktails were delicious and food was even better. We had red beans and rice and corn bread and both were fantastic. However, the lack of happy hour discounts on drinks and slow service were unfortunate for such an amazing place to eat!!

2yEkW8sfytd8PF6zIK3K4w.text: Fantastic service and the lobster roll was on point! The oysters were also top notch!

Jan7uYEVsWwNagbO0YoSaQ.text: Finally made it to muddy waters.  Service was excellent and the oysters were spot on.  Definitely recommend the cornbread, along with the "I Mississippi  You" drink.  Will need to come back for happy hour and brunch!

photos.caption: Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Hush puppies and a dozen chefs choice oysters

dsckDJelRuERRfDVIZftkw.text: Excellent po boy shrimp and friendly staff with laid. Ack cool oyster bar.  Quality better than good restaurant in Fort Lauderdale.  We will be back.

i48hr43bnZtigjX_mbD44w.text: My husband and I LOVE seafood and have been eyeing  this place up for awhile. We finally went last night, and it did not disappoint! The restaurant is small and has a hip, industrial feel to it. We were seated at a small pub table next to the bar and started off with a couple of drinks. My husband got the Sazerac, which was kind of like a New Orleans take on a Manhattan. He loved it.    Everything on the menu sounded so good, we had a very difficult time choosing what to order!  We decided to order a bunch of small plates so that we could try a variety of things. My personal favorite was the grilled oysters.  We normally eat our oysters raw, but grilling them gave them such a wonderful smokey flavor -- soo good for something different! We also both really enjoyed the pastrami salmon crudo; it was a really unique combination of flavors. In a good way. Skillet cornbread and fried green tomatoes were also excellent. As was the service! We did not have to wait long for our food, and our server was on the ball. My only complaint is the price -- I do think it was a little overpriced for the amount of food you were given. But, its totally worth the splurge for a fun date night or special night out!

pY5wVIIGCGyVV6c2Q9qT3Q.text: Came here for oysters on my birthday and they did not disappoint! Drinks are delicious and the food was amazing. The interior space was intimate feeling but lively. Highly recommend the "raw bar".

photos.caption: Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. east and west coast oyster sampler

ruZJwm2ZDz9_gnqsVEP8fw.text: I went here because they have a great selection of West coast oysters which are my favorite. We tried the oysters rose'  and a dozen of the west coast oysters mixed.  The oysters are wonderful but expensive. I would go back but only for a special occasion.

photos.caption: Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Dozen west coast oysters.
Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Oysters Rose&#39;

Up6b55ZXYZWqCh1Y0Cy-Fw.text: Best brunch I've had in a long time, hands down!   We arrived at 12:30 PM on Saturday, giving us 30 minutes to take advantage of the happy hour specials-YES, happy hour specials on a Saturday!   We started with the Cajun Oyster Shooter-SPICY ($4 for HH) and a dozen of the featured west and east coat oysters (East coast were $1.50 each and West coast were $2 for HH). From the regular brunch menu we ordered the Fried Green Tomato appetizer which consisted of 5 large slices of tomato with a delicious pimento cheese spread, a great portion for sharing. For our entree we decided to split the lobster/craw fish roll and although I didn't want the fries at first I am so glad we did. The roll had so much lobster and craw fish, and although not the biggest sandwich it has so much meat and honestly was perfect to share for us. The fries were also delicious, well seasoned with Cajun spice and salt. Muddy Waters also offers $10 off bubbly and $20 off bottles of champagne. We opted for a bottle of bubbly from France and did a DIY mimosa.   Service was good, nothing amazing or worth mentioning. Our orders were correct and came out promptly, so hey no complaints here!

riEoCCDdUtPI2TbHDuDO-A.text: I love New Orleans. This place is trying to bring a piece of that back to Pittsburgh. The reason I have given this a 4/5, is because I haven't gotten consistent service, unfortunately. I have been here for happy hour and brunch. Happy hour is great if you like specialty cocktails and oysters. Brunch was delicious both times I went, however, the last time I went, they were understaffed and service was extremely slow. We were waiting 30+ minutes in between someone checking on us. Other servers passed us by, without try to help as well. We finally got the check and then they never came back to get it! Luckily we had enough cash to cover the check, so we could leave. We got no acknowledgment as we walked out. I'm not counting this place out, since I have had good service before, but use caution if you go on a busy day.

photos.caption: Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lobster Benedict with crawfish hollandaise

OK255ozWm-sw9-VZjdvSaA.text: Decent attempt at Cajun cuisine but incredibly over-priced. $26 (as of this review) for a bowl of Seafood Gumbo?!?. The gumbo itself was tasty but not necessarily memorable (and, frustratingly, not heavily portioned) and the Chargrilled Oysters were ultimately just "OK." Solid list of beers but nothing on draft. On the unalloyed plus side, the wait staff were friendly enough and prompt and the music rotation was fun (for this electric blues buff).  In sum, having eaten there once, my curiosity about the place was satisfied.

bBSWj3GvyF6EwlS9fXmU9Q.text: I went for brunch on a Sunday morning and I couldn't have been more pleased with the wait staff. Everyone working was extremely friendly and attentive. Oh, and the food was fabulous. My only complaint is that they were slightly overpriced. Definitely going back though.

oLfwpvKqpdqD5qj6mb0DRw.text: So the food here was delicious! I had a fried crab sandwich and Cajun fries! Soooo good! There's a bar, intimate setting and the vibe is very low key! I don't eat out often but this place was worth it. This is going to be a new fave of mine.

o_tpmeKP4LcZgaitRJtOLA.text: Great variety of fresh oysters and their brunch bar is amazing w lots did creative toppings. Food is great and the service is always nice too

thD11kNjqP0oRS7jxPdJuA.text: Here is an eclectic joint. From the historic looking narrow footprint with tin ceiling, to the sidewalk food bar, to the bar top that is 1/2 the restaurant's length, to the menu, this is a unique place to eat. The selection of oyster types may be overwhelming,  but luckily they have put together oyster flights with tasting notes for the newbies. We tried every single oyster they had in stock, each one was impeccably prepared & extremely fresh. I have had fresh oysters sitting in PEI, Maine, Massachusetts, NJ & Seattle, these are as good as they get.       Excellent selection of liquor & some wine. My "New Fashion" was expertly crafted, I had to try 3 to make sure they were consistent... they were.       The staff was quite attentive and everyone of them was having a good time, so how can we not? I wish I could take this restaurant back home with me...

photos.caption: Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Trendy little hole in wall type place. Great selection of oysters, west coast &amp; east coast. Nice full bar selection, short wine selection.

TYr7F_0Wsuc4qx7WnVixRw.text: I went there during happy hour! This place has amazing blood mary bar.. i ordered three different kinds of west coast oyster and shrimp po boy.  Oyster was freshly served as soon as ordered. Love the interior as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

zKOCQP9fGC96VDTK7uFDjA.text: I had been tourturing myself by following Muddy Waters on Instagram...beautiful photos of plates of raw oysters on the half shell...and I couldn't wait to go for my birthday!   We went for happy hour. I thought the place would be packed on a Friday but it wasn't. The front of the restaurant is open and airy. We were seated in a high back booth in the back of the restaurant. Corrugated metal on the wall.   Oysters were delicious but we forgot to ask for horseradish...it comes with lemon and some type of red oil.  Ordered both east and west coast oysters to try...all delicious. Minimum order is 12 oysters.   Fried catfish was very thin and breaded with cornmeal so very dry...I didn't like it. Hush puppies were good...warm and soft. Chargrilled oysters were too salty and greasy for my taste...they had parm cheese on top. I'll stick to the raw oysters.  Fried green tomatoes were bland. They came with a really good vinegar cole slaw.  Weren't going to get dessert but so glad we did! Beignets and ice cream. Fluffy puffs of deliciousness.   Happy hour drinks: I got a boilermaker. Shot was Clyde Mays. Good and strong bourbon. Other drink specials are pickle back with a shot of liquor and a shot of pickle juice. There was a cocktail but our waiter didn't tell us what it was and I didn't have a chance to ask him.  There were some dishes we liked and dishes we didn't like but overall it was good food in a fun atmosphere and we will return.

e1HJY_cZhCQZ_DFvVFnb-Q.text: I love the food here. The fried green tomatoes are amazing! Also, I'm not a fan of hush puppies BUT the hush puppies here are delicious. The waitstaff is polite and very helpful. Oh, and Tara is the best bartender, EVER! Tip- it's crowded during happy hour and it's small, so if you don't want to sit at the bar, make reservations.

n2rili6IZwLkTtvhpdug3w.text: Intimate space with laid back vibe. Staff was very friendly and attentive. This place is not ideal for large groups.  Started with the sweet cornbread that was amazing. The Po Boy was decent.... expected the shrimp to be covered and coated but they weren't. They were lightly friend with soft coating. Bread was fresh and tasty along with the fresh, heavily seasoned fries. Finished up with the bananas foster bread pudding which was a disappointment. It was warm on the outside and cold on the inside. Little to dry for me. The bananas and cream helped make its little better.

photos.caption: Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

Z8sIRYP6kqcQ2rAb8qGAgw.text: Happy Hour is amazing. I want to eat all the oysters...all of them! French toast is life changing. Not a huge fan of the bacon.

khB0Q6_mmVDEYt73H2F6vw.text: Amazing!!! Had crawfish on a Sunday. So fresh and so tasty. Also had the raw oysters. Very delicious. Loved the atmosphere good music great great great service very friendly. Will definitely go back again.

-W23x16do_XkM6UKFngCWA.text: Best place in town for oysters and craft beer. Ask for their Gose collaboration. Friendly staff. Great info in the various types of oysters.

pEOt4KC3BfTM4PWG8RlU1w.text: Nice place with Super oysters. Amazing Bloody Mary.  Wonderful Lobster roll sandwich. Delicious  Foie gras egs.   4* because I ordered Alligator sandwich and it was over salted.  ordered coffe and they forgot to bringing it. this should not happen for the price paid

photos.caption: Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

Fao9DUhNaANOnlsSseJMPA.text: A pretty solid 4 stars in my books! Seems like this is one of the more poppin' places in the area, so definitely make a reservation regardless!   Pro tip 1: HH: M-F 4:30 PM-6:30 PM, Tues 9 PM-11 PM, Sat 11 AM-1 PM // $1 east coast oysters, $2 wet coast oysters!   Pro tip 2: Sat/Sun brunch, 10:30 AM-3 PM (20 ft long bloody mary jar?!?!?!)  I came with 2 others, and we quickly ordered: 1) Chef's Choice Dozen of East/West Tasting ($36) // Total of 12 oysters.  +1 I love how fresh it is!  +1 Cool story: they change their sauces (I think) every so often....they use fresh ingredients so that your drizzle on the oyster is fantastically paired.  2) Seafood Gumbo x2 ($24) //  +1 OH YESSS. What I've been looking for! It's not your typical red sauce soup base, more of a black bean soup feel.  +1 TONSA SEAFOOD! OH YASSSSS. Hella worth! +1 Rice AND french bread?! NOMNOM. Carb overloadddddd.  3) Fried shrimp po boy ($16) // +1 Fries are yummy!  +1 Sandwich is really big! Lotsa shrimp, that my friend had to take the other half back.  Overall, great spot for a lunch or definitely an intimate bar experience! It's pretty dark in here though, so you won't get nice photos. But, you'll get some tasty food! Solid spot in PA.

photos.caption: Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fried shrimp po boy $16
Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Seafood gumbo $24
Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. East and west platter $36

Tnp-BDKazyeOxAd7wdMS0A.text: One of my favorite restaurants... EVER. Amazing oysters, lobster roll, alligator, and hush puppies. Knowledgeable staff and of course great cocktails. Can't recommend this place enough. :)

UIb3Uccrla0WlaOweU_ZTg.text: My wife and I met up with some good Yelp friends here on a Friday afternoon for their Happy Hour.  We arrived around 445 and this place was already packed.  We did have reservations for two but since we added a few more friends last minute we just risked it.  Luckily our friends got there at 430 when they opened and saved some seats for us at the bar.  Next time we will make sure to update our reservations.       We looked at their Happy Hour menu and first decided on some drinks and then we ordered Oysters.  There were dollar Oysters for their East Coast and two dollars each for their West Coast.  We ordered both which was about 24 all together.   We preferred the East coast oysters more.  We put some tabasco on it and we used their homemade vinaigrette with lemon juice to make the oyster just right.       It was a great time!  It was a nice warm day out and they had their window open from the street which made it really nice in there.  It was a very nice atmosphere to hang out in. Like I said it was busy.  The bartenders needed some help I think.  They did a good job but they seemed stressed and needed some more help back there.  We left around 530 and it started to die down a little.  It still was busy but when you stop here be sure to plan ahead and get a reservation!

photos.caption: Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Yum yum

3wbrS0xAqebu9P1gw0oD2w.text: I came here for brunch, so I didn't get to experience their dinnertime menu, but I feel like I still got a good feel for what Muddy Waters has to offer. I got the lobster roll sandwich with fries. The sandwich was stuffed and overflowing with lobster and crawfish. I like that it wasn't heavily sauced like some lobster rolls, allowing you to really enjoy the taste of the lobster and crawfish. The fries were served a little off temperature...they weren't cold per say, but they also weren't really as warm as you'd expect fresh fries to be. Other diners in our group also had issue with their coffee being cold, but Muddy Waters staff were happy to give them a fresh cup that was much better.

photos.caption: Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lobster roll and fries. So good!

VN-d9ode2jdHY_A8W95dqg.text: The dining experience was nice.  The waiter was patient and nice, even tho he forgot to put in my order and messed up our bill. But I guess he was just having a really long day. So I steal my friends food and still had a pleasant experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sooooo good
Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. So fresh. And it&#39;s happy hour price.
Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The mimosa I got was pretty good ! The glass was that clean tho.

emZxXruIFSgzR-d1nKU5dw.text: We came here for the happy hour oysters and were not disappointed.  $1 for James River and $2 for Hama Hama, Kumamoto and Hammersley.  While $1 was a good deal, the $2 tasted so much better.  It's a difference you can tell, and definitely worth that extra $1.  I ordered the Bergamot Kiss - citrus, refreshing, foamy egg whites.  It was a soft and delicious drink.  We also ordered the duck & sausage gumbo and the chargrilled oysters.  The gumbo was great, and there were tons of meat in it.  The chargrilled oysters tasted soo clean and good.  We just came back from NOLA and this place brought us back "a little bit".  The food and drinks were on point, but NOLA is delicious, dirty NOLA... However, Muddy Waters Oyster Bar is a gem in Pittsburgh nonetheless.

photos.caption: Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Duck and sausage gumbo
Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. $1 oyster (James River)
Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bergamot Kiss

aFbIzkuCGA-Psx3F9hiraw.text: A 'Monster' find in my 1st trip to Pittsburgh! As a Southern & EastCoast 'seafood guy' I was 'blown away' by the freshness of their fare. Oyster selection was phenomenal and the raw clams may have been the best I've ever eaten. The only thing better than the food was the friendliness of the staff...kudos to Alexandra, Lissa, and the entire staff!

photos.caption: Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

VuyusFJEg0_MEOAg2BXk5g.text: Not many places in Pittsburgh specialize in oysters but luckily Muddy Waters does and knocks it out of the park. Not to mention they have an excellent happy hour with oysters included. Then Tuesdays they do a late night happy hour from 9pm - 11pm. The bubbles are $10.00 off bottles and champagne are $20.00 off bottles. They also have boilermakers on special.   Muddy Waters is my go-to since to me you can't go wrong with oysters and bubbles.   Also, it has to be mentioned that the staff is lovely, Adam has really hired excellent people.

UgOyA1ATZCOl-N2z7YlNlQ.text: We had dinner here late on a Friday night. The ambiance is great, the tables are cozy, the bar is pretty cool, and there was a musician playing. We obviously had to get the oysters, and the waiter recommended the east/west tasting which was really fun- we surprisingly liked the east coast oysters better! Dinner did not disappoint- the meals were beautifully presented and had excellent flavor, exactly what I would expect from a Cajun/creole restaurant. We finished off with the beignets for dessert which were absolutely delicious. We will definitely be coming here again!

2dIhz5-lrTd-0AcXZVTMig.text: We went to New Orleans in the beginning of March and we were already craving some oysters again, so we decided to give this place a try for a Saturday brunch. We made a reservation for 12:30, although when we arrived, the place was empty. I was a little hesitant when I saw how empty it was, but eventually around 1:15 more people stopped in.  My boyfriend did the Bloody Mary bar which I was really impressed with. They had loads of toppings and hot sauces to pick from. I got a cocktail with vodka and jalapeno, which was absolutely delicious. It was actually pretty spicy without being too difficult to drink.  We had our waiter choose fresh oysters for us to sample--great recommendations, friendly service and the oysters were awesome. As an entree, the fried chicken and biscuits were great. The chicken was very flavorful and not too greasy, but I did find the gravy to be very salty. My boyfriend's seafood gumbo was rich and hearty. We got beignets as dessert which were delicious, although hard to compare to Cafe du Monde's which we just had a few weeks ago!  Overall, it lost a star for me because the menu wasn't very large and the ambiance of the place was strange when there was no one there. We will be going back, but to try dinner next time as opposed to brunch again.

photos.caption: Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fried chicken and biscuits with the &#34;I Mississippi You&#34; cocktail

o6y230nTmwbrjvPSQmDX3g.text: Best oysters I think I have had ever (and ive had then in San Diego and many nc beach trips). I had ham and beans with a fried egg and my mom had gumbo. The bloody Mary bar alone is worth a visit with so many options to add to your drink. A hidden gem!

photos.caption: Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

GfDW54hNYINAn7TUngaA0A.text: Stopped in here for dinner on New Year's Eve and I couldn't be more excited to have an oyster bar in the city!  We ordered the large seafood tower which was perfectly shared between Lee and I.  Fresh chunks of lobster meat, a variety of oysters from the raw bar, and head on/tail on cajun shrimp that I'm still raving about!   The sauces that come with the oysters are fantastic, my favorite was the aioli-esque one that was pinkish in color (helpful, I know).  I don't know what was in it but it was sooo good.  The one downside to the seafood tower was that we were seated at one of the high top tables along the wall and it was kind of hard to fit the tower, two plates, beverages, and condiments on the table.  I'd definitely request one of the booths or larger tables if you plan on ordering more than a few snacks.  I was hoping to see a seafood pasta, like a Spaghetti ai Frutti di Mare or seafood alfredo on the dinner menu, but no dice :(  So to round out our meal, we decided to share an order of Oysters Rockefeller which were rather good and served with crusty bread, and the beef tartare which was amazing.  For dessert we ordered the beignets.  Next time I'm here I definitely want to sit right at the raw bar, I love watching the manpower that goes into preparing the perfect plate of oysters.   I think my favorite thing about our meal was that I walked out the door feeling satisfied, not like I had overindulged or consumed anything terribly, uncomfortably filling.  It was a delicious, fresh & quick meal that I look forward to having again soon.  They even have $1 East Coast/$2 West Coast oyster happy hour Monday through Friday!

K08_3F_nZC1yHuyCjTyjiw.text: Oyster happy hour runs until 6:30, and if you're even curious I say "Go for it!" The value proposition is phenomenal-- $6/half-dozen of eastern shore oysters raised in the majestic land of wild horses, Chincoteague VA. Considering the labor intensive art of oyster shucking, it's a plum deal.  I appreciated the salty brine of the oysters and how they paired nicely with the supplied lemon wedge, red wine vinegar sauce that accompanied it. The two types of hot sauce were also used, but to a much lesser extent.  We sampled six charbroiled oysters in a delectable Parmesan-butter sauce. One yelped commented that s/he would have preferred the French bread accompanying it to have been toasted and buttered. I think that Muddy Waters nailed it by opting for simplicity. We used the bread to soak-up the butter and Parmesan that remained once we devoured the succulent, perfectly seasoned oysters.  Nice selection of top-shelf spirits--if that tickles your fancy. Happy hour includes deals on "bottles of bubbles" and boilermakers. Would like to see that deal extend past Clyde Mays, but that's not necessarily a high-priority. Add it to a wish-list with very, very little to speak of.  TVs above the bar featured a rare afternoon Pens game with the volume on mute. Nice to check a score, but not allowing it to be obtrusive or detract from the chill vibe. Great mural of the eastern shore and view of the oyster shucker from our vantage point.  We used yelp to make a reservation--as it was a busy Friday night and we wanted to partake in the specials. A few taps of the app and we were good to go. Couldn't possibly get easier or more convenient.  Will return to Muddy Waters to take a happy hour tasting tour of the emerald coast's oysters, or to sample their brunch offerings. I did not see much publicized about brunch aside from a chalkboard sign, but I am curious enough to consider it even with limited information.

yc-1cWdIOCLpijRYQYfi6g.text: Went here for lunch after a bad oyster experience downtown and was very pleased to find good fresh oysters in Pittsburgh! We got to sit outside in their restaurant front bar. No alcohol allowed outside yet but they are working on getting a license. Full bar it seemed otherwise. They have a dinner menu which they serve during lunch, a brunch menu for weekends, and a raw bar/shellfish menu.  Shared the east/west coast raw oyster chef sampler ($36 for 12), which had 6 oysters from VA, 3 from MD, and 3 from British Columbia. They were all delicious and fresh. The menu seems to change every day based on what they get shipped in. Unfortunately I can't splurge like this every day, but they have happy hour 4:30-6:30 M-F with $1 east coast oysters and $2 west coast oysters, so I can't wait to return for that.  Also got the chargrilled oysters (5 for $15), rich, delicious and garlicky. I personally prefer the raw oysters but these were well done. We also had a side of Cajun fries ($4) which were great.   The only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is the service was super nice and friendly, but slow. In particular the kitchen, think we waited 45 minutes between getting our raw oysters and our hot food. Understandable as they just opened, and got a bunch of togo orders while we were sitting there. I'll be returning for sure and will upgrade to 5 stars as their kitchen fine tunes!

photos.caption: Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Beef tartare
Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Ramos gin fizz
Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Beignets

K4iX9nFQu35sYkYIT-N3_A.text: I have a small obsession with oysters which are difficult to find in Pittsburgh, so from the moment I heard Muddy Waters was opening, I couldn't wait to check it out! We secured a reservation and had dinner with two other couples last Friday and had a great experience. Although, I would definitely recommend making a reservation if you plan to go on the weekend or with a larger group. We didn't realize how small the restaurant is and you're literally sitting on top of other tables. For this reason, it's also extremely loud. They had music playing loudly and with the tables so close to one another everyone was shouting to talk. This may not be the case during the week, but on a busy Friday evening we struggled to talk to one another. But that is literally the only negative about our experience here, though. Everything else was great!   We started with ordering all of the oysters, of course. We tried the chefs tasting of both east and west coast oysters ($36 for 12), the char-grilled oysters and oysters rockefeller. They were all wonderful. We especially loved the char-grilled oysters with lemon and garlic. We also sampled the smoked deviled eggs and the hush puppies. Again, the whole table really enjoyed everything! Our server was extremely attentive, made recommendations and always checked in on us. Poor guy was losing his voice from talking over everyone, but he was a trooper!  For my entree, I had the shrimp and grits and it was delicious! Highly recommend this dish. Others in our group had the blackened salmon, the lobster roll and the gumbo - all were pleased with their meals!   I also loved the variety on the cocktail menu - great cocktails, champagne, wine and a solid beer selection. It's not often you can find somewhere that does everything well. The sparkling rose on the menu was wonderful and paired perfectly with the oysters.   I definitely will stop back to try their brunch or happy hour next!

photos.caption: Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Shrimp &amp; grits!
Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. View from the bar
Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

AFP8vQm-FjPAb0Y3QErR_g.text: I really dig Muddy Waters! I don't think of Pittsburgh as a destination for fresh seafood, but Muddy Waters is excellent. I am a fan of Blue Point Oysters, and during happy hour they are only $1! They also have a drink special I believe - we typically will get some champagne to enjoy with our oysters as well.   I love going with a small group, because I get to try everything! I love their cornbread and fried green tomatoes as apps. I like the po boy and lobster roll, but my favorite thing to get is whatever fresh fish special they have that day.  I keep coming back here because the food is fresh and delicious, the atmosphere is cool, and the servers are kind and knowledgeable.

GJBdzCYPalZ3bd6iHfAAOQ.text: One of my favorite places in Pittsburgh.   Been there more than once....business traveler, here.  Fantastic food.

photos.caption: Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Awesome.  Shrimp and grits!  Yum.

8m1_sQZdP37RG_CaJ0Se2Q.text: We went for this excellent value happy hour on an unseasonably warm late fall day. We sat outside on stools and enjoyed the movement of the city behind us. Our server was as nice as could be. The Oysters were shucked perfectly. We tried Emerald Cove and they were divine. The house hot sauce was quite tasty. Our other dishes - wedge salad, cheddar grits, duck and sausage gumbo, and traditional lobster roll were all very good. My bottle of Proseco was $10 off and was lovely. We will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Wedge. A good version of it with some unique twists.
Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Gumbo of duck and sausage.
Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. This is half the lobster we split. Fries were very good.

2Ts1_MgN1t_Icc1ojynqeA.text: Was glad to finally make it over here, as a good oyster isn't always easy to come by in Pittsburgh - although that has slowly been changing. Stopped here during Happy Hour to grab some cocktails on a weekday.  Started with a wonderful old fashioned (not on special) and also had a beer. East coast oysters were in special for $1, west coast for $2. I'm a west coast fan myself and found them to be better, as I usually do. Comes with a simple mignonette and a slice of lemon. Normal prices are $3/$4 respectively, so Happy Hour is a great deal.  We also ordered some hush puppies which were fantastic. Hot, flavorful, and a nice breading.  Bartender was friendly and was more than willing to offer recommendations. Sandwiches sounded great but was saving that for another day as I'll definitely be back.  With oysters on your bill I can see how it can get expensive here real quick if you're drinking, so be wary.

OY1IBlBY6EUWJHSp67V8rg.text: First, I will start off with a tip. This restaurant now takes reservations. I would highly recommend for a Friday or Saturday night to call the week of and make one. We tried walking in on a whim twice and the wait was almost an hour.  We went on a Thursday night with reservations but found it wasn't necessary for a week night because there were many open two tops (but rather be safe than sorry)!  The restaurant is surprisingly small on the inside. Cute but small. All two tops are on your right and bar on the left as you walk in down the aisle. The back has maybe 4 or 5 tables that could sit more then 4 but not more than 6 people.  Our waiter was super cool and laid back. Any waiter that goes over the menu with you is cool in my book. As recommended, we started out with the gator. It was a seasonal appetizer and we are happy we got to try it.  It literally looks like a hot pocket but filled with gator meat. It was very good (warm and tasteful). The appetizer was small. Between my husband and I, we had one and a half each.   As for the entrees, they have a descent sized selection of both raw and cooked meals. We got the platter for two which included shrimp, crab meat, and oysters.  It was fast and quick service, I think we received the entree after ordering in less then 15 minutes (but it is raw so not too much to do except presentation). It was all delicious and very fresh, however, it did not fill us up. So, we continued our venture with their boucherie platter. It says right on the menu its a cajun styled charcouterie board-YUMM. Now that filled us up! It was filled with smoked salmon, tuna, pickled vegetables. It was delicious.  Our bill was pricey but expected from a restaurant that serves fish.  I would definitely recommend!

WANW0B7HsZgQPEHMn0bYpw.text: I came here once for dinner with a large group and everything was great. I tried oysters for the first time here, so I don't even know what oysters should taste like, but they were good!  Most recently I came here for brunch. It was Easter Sunday, but we came right in and they sat our party of 4 right away. Our server was very friendly and attentive, menu had a lot of nice brunch options for reasonable prices. I got a mimosa and the breakfast biscuit, both were awesome. Bloody Mary bar looks good as well, but avoid the green Bloody Mary mix (so I heard). Definitely will be coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sunday brunch breakfast sandwich

wpBo8igwvRAGhspyfu6obw.text: Really great drinks and service. The fried green tomatoes are amazing. I never tried oysters. My sister and friend had a dinner together here and the waitress was really helpful. They offer raw and cooked oysters. I tried the (?) grilled or pan seared ones. They were great. Defiantly will go back.

tMJGhcRucAdRN6sSQKDKMQ.text: I've enjoyed oysters from Boston Harbor to Camden and Portland Maine and I have to say that this place dominates when it comes to fresh and delicious oysters right here in Pittsburgh! The rest of the menu is absolutely awesome with outstanding hush puppies, chargrilled oysters and savory gator gumbo! The Louisiana feel of the restaurant is perfect and there's always some good Led Zeppelin or Jimi Hendrix playing overhead. Beers and wine galore finish off an incredible menu with Po' boy sandwiches that can't be beat! This is our favorite restaurant in Pittsburgh, which is saying a lot considering all of the great venues in the burgh!

qxNX0VBoOsxW2RoeIDfocA.text: I came for the oysters and it was absolutely satisfied. My favorite kinds after trying out all the "west and east coast tasting" are Malpeque and Kiapara. The oysters are freshly open in front of you. Fresh and fast service. Oysters are all good quality and worth the money. I wish I can come during happy hour so I could have eaten more.

photos.caption: Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Kiapara oyster

iT1n48aj5kcJNELQ2NstrQ.text: Best hush puppies EVER, great fried green tomatoes, chicken and biscuits are out of this world and I don't like bloody Mary's BUT I guess I never had a real one because these rocked!!!  Highly recommend!

y-iMMKevKMJn-Vk2Ab4Snw.text: Their brunch was so good!!! I love the industrial look of the restaurant. The biscuits and gravy was delicious. I'm not a seafood fan so I can't attest to their oysters. Highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Truffle hush puppies
Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

oe5aWGt57ifnRC5rZ6Kp4A.text: Absolutely awesome!!!!! The Gumbo stands up against anything we have ever had in NOLA ! Oysters were amazing.  Our server Marley was the man !!!!  Back again tonight and another amazing meal.  Marley took care of us again and is still the man.  The andouille and shrimp corn dogs were stupid good! Gumbo was awesome as always.

HkIPftGACKOjdFUFv3ebsQ.text: Great seafood bar in east liberty. Tried to put a dinner time reservation in around 6/7, but everything was fully booked until 9pm. Ended up taking the 9pm reservation, but showed up a little bit early. They were not able to seat us right away, so they offered us a spot at the bar. We ended up liking the bar a lot and opted not to take the table we originally reserved. The bar is full service and provides a great view of drink mixing and oyster shucking. The space was large enough to hold our platter of oysters and an entree for each of us. Although the seats were all occupied, we didn't feel crammed and liked that they offered hooks to hang our bags/ get them out of the way.   Food was delicious. We ordered the east/west oyster taster dozen, a po boy and a Louisiana lobster roll! Our only complaint was that the fries were saltier than we would have liked!   All in all, this place had great vibes, great service and great food!

PiB4unGoSG0dvbiZzI377A.text: Me and my girlfriend love oysters, and wanted to go out for a fancy meal.   The restaurant is not suit and tie persay, but the food is.   We got the West Coast Oysters, then the East Cost Oysters. I got the seafood gumbo and she got the hot chicken. It was all phenomenal!  We had a few drinks, they were made perfectly.   Will got back when we are in town again.

1lZVzwko30xWxhGvN7Q-tQ.text: Situation: Came for saturday happy hour (11am-1pm) and for dinner a few weeks ago  Background: We came with a small group of friends for happy hour ($1 east coast oysters, $2 west coast oysters,  $4 oyster shooters). The bloody mary bar was clever. You get to pick whatever vodka you want (some with infused flavors) which was given to you in a mason jar, and you can add the mix with as many condiments (which included thickcut bacon, olives, peppers) as you want.  Lobster roll was mostly crawfish, so dont expect a lot of lobster. The cornbread was more on the sweet side, almost like a dessert version of zucchini bread. The truffle sauce for the hushpuppies was very good.   Assessment: Great meal for oyster lovers (a good deal especially if you come for the happy hour)  Recommendations: oysters, fried oyster or shrimp po-boys, grits, fried green tomatoes, bloody mary bar

Ja2rALsgVQ9BckIS1j1CFw.text: Great oysters, great bar and wonderful vibe. On certain nights they have a live jazz trumpet player and I am in heaven!!!   The food is good but does not compare to the real deal. If you've ever had real cajun food, you will have to reserve judgement. The whole fish is great, the duck gumbo is fabulous. The boudin is just ok. The fried chicken is crazy good! Also, oysters rockafellar, to die for!!!   After 3 meals here and my 26th birthday party, I think I am going to start passing on the food and focus on cocktails and oysters at the bar.

2hBOzW9Vhusm2SkDLCFTCA.text: I finally made it over the weekend to Muddy Waters for a wonderful brunch!  We were greeted immediately when walking in the door and seated right away with our reservation.   The morning was off to a perfect start after trying the cocktail special for the day: Floral Gin Punch. It had just the right amount of sweetness.. a very unique and successful cocktail.  For my main dish, I ordered the Fried Chicken and Biscuits. Every. bite. was. amazing! The biscuits were fluffy and buttery. The chicken was tender and paired incredibly with the sausage gravy. The finishing touch were the house pickles -- YUM!  I also had a bite of the other two entrees that were ordered by my family: Banana Foster French Toast & Seafood Gumbo. Both were just as delicious as my own dish.  I will definitely be back for brunch asap and look forward to trying dinner as well!

photos.caption: Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fried Chicken and Biscuits
Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Floral Gin Punch

3QjVX8m2P-sD5PynCR-Eew.text: This is my first Yelp review and it's long - sorry about that. Over the last decade I have used Yelp and its contributors countless times to influence my lunch / dinner choices as much as I've used anything else. My wife and I always promise each other to start writing Yelp reviews to 'give back' as it were. I swear to contribute more from here on out!   So, a little hung over from an oyster and beer binge last night, me and my coffee and my dog are going to have at it. The dog is stoked, trust me.  Muddy Waters Oyster Bar. Interestingly enough, (to me anyway - hey, it's ME time here!) much as this is my first Yelp review, last night was also my first experience with raw oysters. I eat pretty much everything and find delight in essentially all of it. Except goat cheese - a pox on goat cheese - if a smell were a taste, the smell of goats is the exact taste of their gnarly, funky chee.   Excuse me. Kind of went off the rails there.   Anyway, for some reason I never dipped my toes into the oyster scene until last night.   Boy howdy! I'm kicking myself for never trying them before. If you love the clean flavors & fresh smells of high quality sushi, shashimi, nigiri, etc., you'll probably love oysters. I think. Unless you have hang-ups on texture or something. Some folks can't eat certain things if the texture of is not to their liking. In any case, this is some good stuff, and I'm hooked. Don't forget to chew. Maybe do a little reading up before you go.  We started off at the stand up bar in the middle of a very tiny space. Solidly in the Top 5 most cramped restaurants I've ever been in. We kind of like that though when we're in the mood for it, which we were.  We had a 9pm reservation but it was 6 and we were hungry, so we walked in, cancelled our reservation, and posted up to wait for a spot at the real bar. We got lucky and landed a nice spot directly in front of the oyster shuckers and the TV for the Buccos game. I say lucky because we stood at the stand up bar only for about 5 minutes before our server (who stayed with us for the evening) let us know he just cashed someone out at the main bar and we should pounce when they get up. I'm glad we did, because this place being what it is, folks pretty much grew roots where they were. The takeaway here is, if you go (on a Friday anyway), you have 3 routes to take. 1) Get a reservation and get it at least a week in advance 2) prepare to stand at the stand up bar, or 3) prepare to watch the main bar like a hawk if you want to sit.   I'll try to be concise from here on out. Bullet points! Still wordy though...  - The staff was great. If you've never tried raw oysters, they will nursemaid you through the process and explain everything. It's similar to wine.  - It's a bit pricy. Which is fine with us (us = my wife and I). You get what you pay for, folks. These are fresh oysters and I'll pay whatever it takes to facilitate that kind of quality.  - It's slow. Which is fine with us again. Our favorite dining experiences are the long, slow, drawn out ones. Think more French service vs. standard US service. Don't expect the server to be breathing down your neck every 5 minutes. Take your time and enjoy the food and your company. Trust me, it's better that way.  - We never even ordered an entree. That will definitely happen next time though. Instead, we gnared with a righteous zest for 2 hours on small plates, apps, and oysters. And I regret nothing! Well, almost nothing. The exception to the rule last night was the deviled egg app. They looked amazing but in our opinion, were actually so-so at best. Seemed a little old or something. Maybe they were straight from one of the staff's backyard henhouses or something and we're just used to the swill that Big Egg forces on us dahn Giant Iggle. Whatever.  - It's loud. Again - groovy. If that bugs you though, be warned.  - It's small. I said that earlier but it bears repeating. If this bugs you, maybe skip out or go on a Tuesday or something. You will physically interact with servers and fellow diners, probably knock something over, and possibly make a friend or two.  - It's fresh. I didn't ask, but Shirley they are flying these things in daily.   - Champagne seems to be the drink of choice. They have something like 10 choices of champagne and almost everyone was busting up some bubbly. That said, they have a very, very solid cocktail, wine, and beer list as well. Kind of weird because I don't remember seeing anyone drinking champagne anywhere under any circumstance the one and only time we visited New Orleans. Maybe we were at the wrong places!   Okay that's it. Abrupt ending in 3, 2

Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Oysters du jour!
