UEpyzmw03O_4vio5ioFYsw.text: Food was amazing! Oysters are pricey but totally worth the cost! Definately going back!

gGwTSG1mvR4X17jWVmjX2w.text: We headed to Muddy Waters on a Saturday for brunch and I have to mention that we are pretty avid brunchers! They have a KILLER Bloody Mary bar & an awesome oyster special for happy hour. My husband & I shared the lobster Benedict & the hot lobster roll. They were both excellent, but the lobster Benedict is truly a stand out dish! Almost our entire party ordered it & everyone was blown away by it! And my lobster/crawfish roll was really good, but I did find the bun to be lacking slightly. We did order some hush puppies but sadly they never made it to  our table, but that was hardly even an issue after enjoying some extremely fresh & well shucked oysters. We honestly didn't even care that our app never showed up & our server took it off our bill no questions asked. We will DEFINITELY come back here for brunch & I will be telling friends about this place for sure!

S4wWjSBxRTyRo-fFGIpKNg.text: I finally had a chance to try this place out after drooling over the pictures for the past few weeks. I grabbed a couple of my friends and we went to Muddy Waters for dinner this past Friday. I called earlier in the day to make a reservation (which I recommend). The place is on the smaller side but they did a great job making the most out of the space they have. Upon our arrival, we were promptly seated and the waiter came to take our drink orders soon after we were seated. For an appetizer, we got a dozen of oysters on the half shell. It was chefs choice so the oysters were both east coast and west coast (I apologize that I can't remember the names of them all). The oysters were so fresh and delicious. It was really neat to try different kind of oysters to see how different they tasted from one another. One of the west coast oysters had a cucumber melon finish. So good!! For dinner, I got the fried oyster Po boy. You can get your Po boy with shrimp, oysters, or mushrooms. It's topped with chili mayo, lettuce, tomato, and house made pickles. They are also served with Cajun fries. My Po boy was so good. It was fried perfectly and I really appreciated that there was not a lot of coating on the oysters so that you could still taste the oysters on the sandwich, as opposed to just breading. I already cannot wait to come back to this place. I would love to come back for both happy hour and for brunch. Overall, I definitely recommend Muddy Waters! Pittsburgh needed a Resturant like this! :)   P.s. An added bonus for me is that they played Muddy Water's music the whole time. It gave a nice relaxing "down south" feel to the place!

photos.caption: Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Close up on the Po boy.
Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Oyster Po boy and Cajun fries!
Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chef&#39;s choice (east and west coast)

dqTqMheVgKj1g8Dvop1C4Q.text: This is one of my favorite places for Happy Hour. They offer $1 raw oysters during happy hour but they also have a variety of other oysters at higher price points if you want to try out oysters from different regions.   They have a great cocktail menu that I believe changes from time to time. I highly recommend trying one of their cocktails. I usually get a Moscow mule here but my friends often explore the other custom drinks and specials. The bartenders are very friendly and the staff is great.   I am also a huge fan of Cajun food because I grew up in New Orleans. Honestly, most places this far north do not know what they're doing but this place does a good job. I highly recommend their seafood Gumbo. It's the best gumbo I've had outside of Louisiana hands down. I've also tried their cornbread mac and cheese which was surprisingly delicious.   This place is definitely a must if you like seafood and Cajun/Creole and a good cocktail. It's not quite the real deal, but they do a good job emulating some classic Bayou cooking.

gMZvo1Hw0g77TllhLALjKg.text: Alright, Muddy Waters...5 stars. Eh. I'd go  a solid 4. I made a reservation on the fly tonight and was kind of surprised I could have the pick of the litter! For some crazy reason East Liberty doesn't exist to me for food options, even though I am well aware it should be somewhat on the forefront of my lil squirrel brain. I can't say I was blown away though and was really expecting to be!  I got my tax return and was really feeling like blowing some money on a great meal. I took my boyfriend here and it was pretty fantastic. I ordered the lobster roll and he got shrimp and grits. My roll was simple and successful and my boyfriend's shrimp were delicate and delightful. I'm not sure why I wasn't fully blown out of the water by the meal, it really may just be my personal tastes. I loved the food but didn't think it was interesting/exciting enough for the price tag. But, again, that could just be me and my tastes. There is nothing wrong with simple, good cooking! I would definitely want to go back and try more of their menu!! The happy hour is pretty decent and I wish I could say I ordered oysters but we were not hungry enough to get multiple courses. Next time, it is happening!

zrkngwRMQ4Vynw2Vgsyr6g.text: We have been here a few times. They have a great selection of oysters. All of the food is amazing. The service is great, we prefer to sit at the bar.

photos.caption: Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pimento cheese dip
Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chargrilled oysters are amazing

Kws50SvHkumEhxJmdmpAdA.text: Go for brunch and have the Lobster Eggs Benedict - it's the BEST benedict I have had anywhere. Seriously delicious!  My only complaint is about the high-top seating. I know it helps restaurant maximize space, but it is so uncomfortable.

I5ho17RNWPVyswM7mJ9DeQ.text: My fiancee and I went here because she loves oysters more than anything. Me?  Not so much. I reviewed the menu before we made our reservations just to make sure that I would want something. I saw wonderful photos of heir food on here and on Instagram and figured I would find something good. We made reservations for 8pm on a Saturday night.  The place is a lot smaller than you would expect. A LOT smaller. It's a very narrow inside. No matter where you sit there are other patrons and employees right on top of you. We got seated at a high top table on the right hand side of the restaurant. The table was extremely wobbly which made it difficult to feel comfortable having a drink at the table.   The server was very friendly and knowledgeable about the menu. My fiancee ordered the big oyster sampler place which she housed like the oyster champ that she is. She also had a side of mac and cheese which she absolutely hated. I had the jumbo which I loved. The taste was awesome but the portion was very small compared to the price that I paid for it. The server didn't come around that much and didn't seem interested in coming back to check on things after the food was served.   We found this place to be completely overpriced and not worth it.  Since it's hard to find a good oyster spot in PGH we gave it a chance. We won't be

hqjnt1h3gKbi9fsBA77_gg.text: Great place for both dinner and brunch. I would highly recommend the regular and char-grilled oysters. Oh, and they have wine Wednesday's! Half off bottles of wine

sLljZNOs2ERpq974Vleasw.text: I managed to get a little sneak preview of Muddy Waters last night, and am so excited for this place to officially open.  The interior is nicely decorated, lots of industrial metals are used to create a clean, contemporary atmosphere. It is trendy, but not overly pretentious.  At the corner of the bar, there was a mountain of ice and a big selection of oysters. At the time I was there - 2 different West Coast species, and 4 different East Coast. I loved all but one of the East Coast. I do quite like oysters, but unfortunately am not enough of an expert to give an expert review. I'll just say that they were some of the best I've ever had.  As for drinks, there was a nice little cocktail selection, including a couple New Orleans classics like the French 75 and the Sazerac. I thought the champagne of the French 75 paired nicely with the oysters.  I'm looking forward to coming back to try some of the food from the kitchen! The po-boy looks especially exciting, and can also be made vegetarian.   Its always nice to be able to have a place to drop in and have a half-dozen oysters when I'm not super hungry.

photos.caption: Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Logo

PSC94zjZG__9AtMD8aNBNg.text: Best place for oyster in the Burgh. Always have gone during happy hour and appreciate the energy everyone brings.  If only they had one in the South Hills.

gjbIx1p0fiQVsEFWJGnsSw.text: Came here with my wife and mother to celebrate my mother's birthday.  We started with two appetizers - the fois gras deviled egg and the iceberg wedge. It was my first time ever eating fois gras and will probably be my last. I found the flavor to be very off putting. Probably not the chef's fault, just not my thing. The lettuce wedge was great. Definitely a fan of their ranch dressing. For dinner my mother and I both got po boys. Mine oyster, my mother's shrimp. Overall a quality sandwich. I liked how they hollowed out the bread to make it more manageable. My only complaint is that the sandwich had a lot going on. With the lettuce, tomato, dill pickle and chili mayo, the flavor of the oyster got s bit lost. Next time I'd probably get the mayo on the side. My wife had shrimp and grits.  It was good, but she said the Pioneer Woman's version is tastier. But overall, a good experience.

jirBYfN6LdsYeHDuX68oJg.text: start to finish, AWESOME!   We didn't have reservations so we sat at the bar, which was fine with us. The two bartenders working were great. We went for lunch on a Saturday which is during their awesome happy hour! Specialty drinks, dollar oysters, cheap small plates. Tons to choose from. The alligator and sausage gumbo was SO flavorful, the $1 east coast oysters were solid, the fried alligator was probably our least favorite, a little chewy, but it wasn't bad, my husbands banana foster french toast was so yummy, but I just can't stop thinking about those CHARGRILLED OYSTERS!!!! They were delicious. So fresh, garlicky, cheese, grilled perfectly! I can't wait to go back and try more things on the menu!!!

Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. East Coast Oysters
Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fried Alligator

blSIYei5fTpDTaiOAv-gtg.text: I've been meaning to visit this location since it opened and finally got around to it.   The space is narrow, low-lit and intimate with the focal point being the well stocked bar.   The staff are masters of their craft, giving both food and beverage items the care and attention necessary for a superior dining experience. The cocktails are meticulously constructed and elegantly garnished. The resulting flavor is on point.   Each menu item is obviously well considered. Today's special was grilled oysters in a Cajun butter sauce. Perfect! Cornbread with bacon in it? Why did it take us this long as a society to put bacon in cornbread? I also tried both the lime in the coconut oyster shooter, which was light summery and refreshing, and the red oyster shooter which was tangy and just a little spicy. Alligator bites? Yes please!  I will definitely be back as soon as possible.

zJKZYmB-FbViUZeN1Ki0pw.text: We came here for Saturday morning happy hours. They have $1, $2, $3 specials. The $1 is always the same but the $2-$3 one's are different every week. The only down side is you have to order half or one dozen for each kind. I really enjoyed all the oysters.  The other awesome thing they have to offer is how big their bloody merry bar is. They have so many options to choose from!  I also got a shrimp P.O. boy, it is a thai style, it was 3 out of 5, not bad but for the cost of the sandwich, I don't think it was good enough. Would not recommend the sandwich to my friends.  I would definitely come back for more oysters and blood merry!

photos.caption: Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Conway royal
Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bah mi P.O. boy

dOdBO_fo7TKxtJJZS6JGOw.text: Amazing lunch menu on the weekend with great happy hour prices, especially for the oysters! We ordered a doze and a half and paid $1/oyster, and they were delicious.   Parking is street so be sure to plan accordingly. The restaurant also takes reservations through Open Table; it does fill up on the weekends so definitely make sure you utilize that.   Staff was very friendly and attentive. There's no kids menu but they did have fried fish sticks, which my son enjoyed.

At31OE92DLRnWE9f-2PWVA.text: Not enough stars to be said about this place!!! It was SO GOOD! The staff was very helpful, very personable and easy to talk to. I really loved everything about this place. The atmosphere, the staff, and of course the food! I have already been spreading the word about this place and I'm sure they'll have good reviews too! I wish I could eat here every single day. I got the gumbo, I was purely amazed at how much seafood this soup has!! Every single bite had some sort of seafood/fish/sausage/pork. I am getting hungry just thinking about it! My husband got the Jambalaya and he wasn't disappointed at all. My son got a big mixture of oysters and he wanted more (he's only 11!). My daughter just got Mac and cheese, but that was just the average food for kids. I can't wait to go back again! I want to try everything on the menu!

YQz6_LuvAVB5yld2SK90hQ.text: Had a girls brunch here and I enjoyed the freshness of the food. I ordered the Shrimp and Grits. It was very interesting tasting. Shrimp were large and enough. The music has a really nice, New Orleans feel. The green tomatoes are really good. I didn't try the green slaw that came with it but my friend said it had a very strong vinegar taste and she loves vinegar which says something. I had a mimosa which wasn't string but the Fig N Thyme was really good and had the kick it needed. Very great customer service with multiple waiters. It really made a difference in our experience. Char boiled oysters were very tasty. I and my friends really enjoyed our experience. Would definitely come back.

9caUbLog9zIuQY4R_6jQTw.text: Who would've thought that there'd be a knock out oyster bar in the middle of Pittsburgh?  We tried almost everything on the menu and we weren't disappointed. Grab a Bloody Mary to wash them all down. You'll make a return trip to this little gem.

Tjui2vFNOQ52ACvz0l0GHQ.text: I ordered the Jamison farm lamb po boy and I was very satisfied with what I got. Definitely filling and worth your money, I'm a big fan of lamb so I love to taste the natural flavor of it; however, the overall flavors were a little bit lacking and on the blander side. They do have a bunch of sauces to compensate for that so it was still good. My friend had gotten some of the oysters and although I'm not a big fan of oysters I tried one and it tasted very fresh and clean compared to oysters I've tried in the past (which is the reason why I dislike them). Food was excellent, the interior fits the atmosphere of the food but was just a little too dark for me. Definitely would like to be back one more time!

5_KFrv02864S4jSfuO0WfQ.text: Great in every way. Great food, great staff - it's our go-to restaurant! Cocktails are amazing and the Nashville chicken is phenomenal! Fried green tomatoes are a must!

foA2MtC1IXeOXsUN83XYnw.text: Food was ok, pretty greasy. I would only recommend the oysters. The service was ok was well...

2bBktQznMPyPHbs3-g6Kqg.text: Muddy Waters Oyster Bar is a cute little Cajun/creole oyster bar nestled on South Highland Ave in East Liberty. East Liberty is a rapidly growing area, so it's location is great. They have a relatively large assortment to choose from in their "raw bar" as well as a very interesting menu. I really enjoyed the catfish sticks and alligator nuggets. In addition, their lobster roll was excellent, as were the lamb sliders with pimento cheese. The only thing I've had there and haven't been a fan of was the Mac n cheese. The flavor wasn't quite there for me. All in all, I've been really happy with my experiences here and I'll definitely be back again.

7Hrjg9A7ZnZ6A74B2mzZ6A.text: Am I in the Big Easy? No--I'm in the heart of Pittsburgh's East Liberty (E'sliberty) neighborhood eating the best canon creole cooking I've had this far up north--but you could've fooled me. The atmosphere is great, big bar, raw bar, lots of two top tables and a few four top booths.   The menu includes apps, sandwiches, large plates, a few sharing plates and variety of seafood towers, raw oysters and cold shrimp and lobster.   I had a few raw oysters which came with a variety of toppings to enhance their taste. Next my wife and I split the fried green tomatoes app with pimento cheese and slaw toppings--and these were the best green tomatoes I've ever had (and we are big time green tomatoes fans).  Finally, I had a large bowl of seafood gumbo which was just perfect. A bit spicy as it should be, loaded with shrimp, blue crab, sausage, crawfish and okra! Topped with rice and baguette.   My wife ordered the hot chicken which came with collard greens, house pickles, cornbread and grits--it was delicious! Incredible southern cooking, average prices for what you're getting and a friendly staff.   We have to go back a few more times to try other menu items--this made our date night list.

Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Oysters with amazing toppings!

1KyN8HuAqxBT5x1JUuoUDg.text: Went here for brunch with my friends. I tried the Banh Mi Po Boy and the Lobster Eggs Benedict. Wouldn't necessarily recommend the Banh Mi, but the eggs benedict were definitely a treat! Even if the lobster was swapped out with a normal piece of ham, it would still be pretty good, but the lobster made it even better! Pieces were literally spilling out of the benedict, and boy did they taste delicious.   Would like to return to try their cocktails and more oysters!

8pJ1TtW412JhehmPu9jRpQ.text: Go for brunch - you will not be disappointed! $1 oysters + a really tasty Lobster Eggs Benedict. Small space but very well lit + a friendly staff. I've visited twice from NYC + plan to come back many more times in the future.   PS - Try their cornbread. They switch out their flavors every so often, but it's delicious nonetheless.

XkJfIH0CRbKnuXTboZKUKQ.text: Was pleasantly surprised by the ambience and great oysters. Portion sizes are small for the "large plates" so if you are a big eater you may not get full here. Otherwise, cool hang out spot.

Q17B86zaewkOmIWQQLaxxg.text: One of the best lobster rolls in Pittsburgh. The oysters  are excellent baked or raw .They have a wide selection of beer and drinks.Services was prompt and courteous. I will be back again especially doing happy hour.

2fEO_kXlAf8JWkQJfBJwjQ.text: The food was pretty good! The drinks were fantastic! The fried green tomatoes lacked flavor. I wished they used the batter flavor from the po boy for the fried green tomatoes. The chargrilled oysters we soooooo delicious! Oh, the sweet potatoe cornbread was also delicious!

vfO3-TTbsYwGPcRzVTwNxQ.text: I always like leaving great reviews. I saw a couple bad reviews with curt responses from the owner. Well, who cares... I am not looking to be buddies with that guy, I just want oysters. While the oysters were not the best I've ever had, a few things need to be accounted for. First this is Western PA. 350 miles from any ocean. Second, there is a large selection. Third the oysters were very far above average. And lastly, they were very reasonably priced.   I forgot the salumi plate! Also fantastic. Head cheese in PGH? Who would have thought...  Great drinks, although I could have used a bit more alcohol for my $10, very well and promptly prepared. Desserts were also very good. Definitely not the pre-packaged frozen fair that some other restaurants pass off as gourmet.  Bottom line? If you want to eat oysters in da 'burgh, this is your spot.

2JCT4_CTCEPYrFusLiHVTQ.text: Apparently things have changed since the last reviews were written. The gumbo was smoky, salty, and had a normal cup of rice smack dab in the center. The seafood was plentiful and of good quality, but it was overpowered by the smokiness of the roux. The BBQ Shrimp and Grits was buried in BBQ sauce and the shrimp was blackened before they drown it. It was hard to taste the cheesiness of the grits because they too were drown in BBQ sauce. Seafood and sausage were of good quality completely lost in the dish. Oysters were top notch, but run from $2 to $3 a piece. Service was meh, almost like they were doing you a favor by waiting on you. The guy shucking the oysters was friendlier than the waitress or the host. I've had much better meals in way worse places. Skip it.

Zqpv4HiRZbH73NjkDkUf1Q.text: Loved this place! A little pricey but very delicious. On Saturday they do happy hour 12-2pm. Amazing oysters! I recommend the Delaware Bay. It's the cheapest and still pretty big. The alligator po boy is juicy and very filling. Best Cajun fries I've ever had!!! It was my first time trying an oyster shooter and it was so good! Also recommend the brunch punch-- very fruity :)

24xaBYudZBQiio9DF7BQag.text: Muddy Waters was great. We ordered the raw bar sampler to start, 4 oysters with crab and shrimp cocktail. Very good.  I ordered the fried chicken sandwich, the "hot" version. It wasn't too spicy, just right. It's the typical Nashville hot chicken style, which is kind of oily.  My wife got the strawberry pecan salad and enjoyed it as well. We were there during "brunch" and didn't do the bloody mary bar, but it looked really good.

iTrMzxtyT8TbM0x20Zzwpw.text: We drove over to East Liberty (a 7-minute drive!) after cruising this year's always-enjoyable "A Fair in the Park" arts & crafts show in Mellon Park. We don't get out east in Pittsburgh too often & have been wanting to try Muddy Waters since they opened a few years ago. We were hoping for good oysters, but - beyond that - weren't quite sure what to expect. We got there just in time (4:30) for Friday afternoon happy hour and were seated in a cozy booth. The place is one of those store-front kind of places: not too wide, but it goes way back. Very "neighborhood bar" kind of place - unpretentious & you feel welcome & right at home. You enter and walk past the raw bar on your way back to your table (or booth). Nautical theme with a great East Coast mural on the wall. The young-ish staff was friendly and attentive. (And they all wear black tee shirts proclaiming them as "bad mother shuckers "!) Our server, William, has been there since the place opened & helped guide us through the New Orleans-themed menu & the specials. We started by splitting a dozen big, fresh Delaware Bay oysters at the happy hour price of $1 each. Thoroughly enjoyable. We went on to shaved catfish (sort of like chicken tenders, only catfish), a combo shrimp & oyster poor boy, and a big wedge salad. (Loved the fresh, vinegary cole slaw that came as a side with the catfish!) They have a full bar, and offer a wide selection off beer by the can (nothing on draft - I enjoyed a couple of Vermont Magic Hat #9s served with Mason jar glasses). We had no room left for dessert, and departed the now-bustling dining room with 2 containers of left-overs and a to-go order of fresh, hot New Orleans-style beignets & chocolate sauce (recommendation: don't go home without them!) What a great dinner & overall experience! Long drive, but we'll be back with friends & family. Thanks, William!

photos.caption: Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Part of the Muddy Waters decor

NzmA_ixzY79aocSUJ9KQdg.text: I really like this place! The oysters were great, the cocktail and bubbles selection lots of fun, service friendly and attentive. Loved the fried green tomatoes - thought the lobster roll, although tasty, was more crawfish than anything, would have liked to have more lobster. Creamed collards were not what I expected (spicier) but still intriguing. The Po Boy's fried oysters were on point! Pecan pie was forgettable and not worth finishing, but eh, no harm there. It's loud, so don't go expecting romance, but I will be back!

e9dAQXIOQ-uPQZw7sbm9gA.text: We went here for brunch. Chargrilled oysters were nice. But other menus were far short of our expectations considering their high prices.

uZwCqRDSA1lzu_tqaXV6Qw.text: The oysters were good but unfortunately for us this is where the goodness stopped. The food is heavy and not well executed. It's out of the way for me to go get just oysters here and there are some other places I'd be just as happy to get them from.

t5JbFFsVkDk2c7cskTy-qQ.text: Awesome food, great service and fantastic atmosphere. Went there with a girlfriend after hearing good things and I wasn't disappointed.

d8q59kR_1pfgIU8bT7wK5A.text: My girlfriend and I recently stopped here for dinner and got seated at the full service oyster bar since there were no tables available in the restaurant.  To start, we got a tasty cheese appetizer which involves a soft cheese spread to put on pita-style spiced chips and home-made pickles.  For entrees, I got a lobster roll and my girlfriend got a shrimp po' boy.  Despite loving lobster, I generally shy away from getting lobster rolls because at most restaurants what you receive is a hotdog bun filled with mayo with a tiny bit of lobster.  The lobster roll here was probably the best lobster roll I've ever had because it was stuffed with well cooked lobster and craw-fish and not even an iota of mayo.  I only wish the bread was as good as the bread used to construct my girlfriends po' boy, but I know it's hard to break tradition with the split top bun for a lobster roll.  The cajun fries on the side were also delicious, and delectably spicy.  I don't indulge in raw oysters, but I was impressed with the variety of different oysters that they offered here to eat.  The service was good as well, and I'll likely be returning soon to have another lobster roll even though the meal overall was a bit on the expensive side.

xsZtXaObiUaB0c5Opog8eA.text: Superb raw bar with a diverse selection of oysters from both east and west coasts. The brussel sprouts were amazing, however they were removed from the menu this spring (5/18). The wait staff was friendly and would recommend this to any shell fish aficionado.

imkgdFxEbSi3ss24Ke_PVQ.text: This place is top notch.  We had a reservation on a Saturday evening.  We were seated right away, and our waiter was very knowledgable about the menu.  Neither of us had ever tried raw oysters, so the general manager offered us a couple of shooters on the house; we also ordered the hush puppies, which were flavorful and crispy.  For our entrees, I had the filet and my husband had the catfish with beer mac and cheese, which was one of the daily specials.  Both came out fast and were incredible.  The steak was the steak of my dreams, the cocktails were top notch, and the sweet tea was perfect.  Great experience!

gyOlMsJxgkBHNHU22RBnWQ.text: The best oysters in the state! Do the Mac & Cheese and charcuterie plate with the salmon spread

3_XH0jnH8BiRHmX6iA6Jxw.text: I know this has become popular and I would be willing to give it a second chance. The food, both mine and my lunch companions, was just meh. Neither of us ordered oysters ( I'm allergic) but other featured items on the menu. I was diasappointed

64KKTTrarQJjNKuXp3Rb8A.text: Whiskey selection is superb and bar staff is amazing. Some of the best cocktails in Shadyside.

2VuIQEjBDhmzSsCbYzeJLg.text: We had the lobster roll which are second to none. 12 bucks for a dozen raw oysters at happy hour is quite a deal and I recommend the cornbread. Didn't sound too good with some of the ingredients but it works well

4WTo9fCNUuQ054s5Qr_sfw.text: You either like oysters or you don't like oysters.  And i really think that a restaurant can't really ruin oysters.  So this review might be a little dry  I went to Muddy Waters for oysters (it is an oyster bar!!).  They have a happy hour that starts at 4:30 (when they open) where oysters are $1 or $2.  You have to get at least 12.  Along with the oysters, we ordered the jalapeno hush puppies.  They were great.  Hot, right out the fryer with a tasty remoulade.  We also go the fried green tomatoes.  I am not sure what I thought about them.  Maybe it is because tomatoes are out of season or the "salsa, chutney" item had too much vinegar or I think served with the same remoulade **I think** as the hush puppies.   I would definitely go back and try them in season, but on that February night, just not hitting the spot.    The service was prompt and professional and our server timed our meal perfectly.

-WKhJHBsQ5OGbpptPWnTuw.text: Amazing food and drinks. There is nothing else in the pittsburgh area that compares to the experience here.

sVbnTXZm7lfuaSXjr_0kRw.text: Great food, great service, great oysters!! I recommend this restaurant highly! There's something on the menu for every taste!

wpQDbs105cbYCYU-j4ipWg.text: We had a great experience in the restaurant, came for happy hour and happily consumed 3 dozen oysters (East Coast)... but fast forward a few hours and at home, my husband is violently throwing up and basically living in the bathroom. He also got severe abdominal pains and had chills and I stayed up all night with abated breath to see if he was developing a fever -- in which case I'd have rushed him to the hospital because it might be vibrio.   Please, if you're going to be a high end restaurant serving raw oysters (and charging an arm and a leg for it), you need to get your shit together and make sure the oysters are good! Needless to say, we will not be coming back in here again.

xSlD1XwEHOBE3-cryaQsIw.text: Fantastic oyster bar, but don't get caught up in just the oysters, the other food they serve is amazing. The foie gras deviled eggs with bacon and their oyster Rockefeller are some of the best appetizers I have ever had. It is also a great spot for drinks and the bar has a wide selection. The ambience is also pretty cool and I always enjoy the music.

TGCFB_XStDBWiRtIroy03g.text: Outstanding food, everyone in our party got something different and it was all great.  Also, I think I remember seeing that most, if not all, the bottles of wine/champagne on the menu were the same price as you would pay buying it at the store (so no markup?), which is amazing in itself.

7wYpt1pxELBE0Q-JVKCpiw.text: I have eaten at Muddy Waters once before and it was average. I lived in the south for several years and had some very good eats. Our meal tonight was reminiscent of those fine meals. My husband had a superb soft shell sandwich and I had the Gumbo. Both were authentic. We sat at the bar. The service was excellent and all was good in Pittsburgh.

Di8MBMkYFlDZPatn-eP7qg.text: A really good oysters.  I love the chargrilled oysters. This dish is a "must have ". We finished them all right after they were served. The sausage and gater gumbo is also good. There are a lot of mentions of fried green tomatoes. But I think they are just medicore. It is crispy indeed, but also salty.

XwvCRUOhmcnUbBZjkR8S9w.text: Clearly a winner!!! Flavorful Cajun and Creole food, knowledgeable bartenders & servers, great happy hour specials on oysters, drinks, bubbles & champagne! Seriously, it's awesome here!   Happy Hour seems to offer a daily $1 oyster special & our group devoured several dozen. The gator bites and hush puppies were so tasty, we ordered 2nds. Their cornbread is STELLAR! Literally the very best I've ever tasted. Everything is exceptionally well flavored and has a little kick of tasty heat to it - just the way it's supposed to! Hubby & I also split an oyster Po'Boy (they're enormous, so splitting was easy). Personally I wish the oysters had spent a few seconds less in the fryer, but my guy was happy with it.   We attended a birthday bash with some great friends here so we had a comfy space reserved for our large party. Service both at the bar where we started and at our table was spot on all evening. These folks were all well prepped on the day's specials & didn't mind repeating when we couldn't remember the lengthy list of available delights.    Great spot to hang out for drinks & some really tasty food. We'll be back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The best cornbread I&#39;ve ever tasted!!!

hs5scVZvPHR8vkj_MB_uOg.text: I always have great service here, and the food is fresh and delicious. Highly recommend making a reservation on the weekends. Their brunch is amazing as well!

Fbbe9EDRQ9H9WgovjeFlXw.text: Highly recommend the breaded catfish appetizer ($10), the fish tasted very fresh and refreshing.  Also really enjoyed the cornbread (3-4 large pieces for $7).  It was still delicious the 2nd day for breakfast, and we didn't even heat it.  So good my sister swallowed both leftover pieces when I went to the bathroom for 2 minutes...   Would skip out on the chargrilled oysters (6 for $12 and comes w/ a slice of bread); they weren't bad, but not anything special.   Our server was super friendly and made the overall experience great!

photos.caption: Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cornbread ($7) &amp; Chargrilled Oysters ($12)

GpUL7IRV1smkeu1wuznUxw.text: It's kind of hard to find oysters in Pittsburgh. In fact, this was my first time enjoying oysters in Pittsburgh and I had a very good experience. Made a reservation for happy hour (4:30pm to 6:30pm) on a Monday, which turned out to be completely unnecessary because there was tons of space when we went at around 5pm. Boyfriend and I ordered a dozen East Coast oysters and half a dozen West Coast oysters (and another dozen East Coast oysters for round two...because never enough oysters!). Both were fresh and satisfying. We also got the lobster roll and cajun fries. The lobster roll was a bit smaller than expected but not bad. The fries were good and very seasoned. Glad there's a place like Muddy Waters in Pittsburgh!  Taste | 4.5 Atmosphere | 5 Presentation | 4.5 Service | 4 OVERALL | 4.5

Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

FKx3HZUQi1pqQhpslQz6VA.text: I finally made it to Muddy Waters after months of saying, "I can't wait to try it"!  Now, I'm pretty mad at myself for not ordering oysters, but I got distracted by the Bloody Mary bar and the rest is history.  All seriousness, the Bloody Mary bar is the real deal.  It is probably my second favorite Bloody Mary bar in Pittsburgh (first is at Meat and Potatoes).  The selection of condiments for your drink are endless.  You could build your entire brunch around your drink.  And if I wasn't driving that day and didn't have other things to do I might have just done that.  For my main course I had the lobster Benedict.  It was good, nothing over the top, but I enjoyed it and would definitely order it again.  Our table was given a couple baskets of beignets so I indulged in one of those, too.  I almost had to roll myself out of the restaurant because I was very full after all the Bloody Mary options and my meal.    My only gripe is that the music was a bit too loud.  I was excited to catch up with my group of friends but could only hear those sitting directly next to me.  Seating is also tight so the wait staff is in competition with the guests to move around.    I'll come back and order oysters next time.

3Nzl2ZFkw339hWp-hZf_hQ.text: Very good west coast oysters but kinda pricey. Bartenders were nice and fast even tho is was a very busy day.

SZ2fmKrI9guSlRodOBh6ow.text: It's not often I'm in a city with extensive dining options after transplanting to Erie from CA so I decided that my first trip to Pittsburgh warrants an Oyster feast. Ordered the Lobster roll, which was buttery, garlicky, and delicious! Also ordered the West/East dozen oysters, which came with three sauces. The oysters tasted very refreshing and the "What's Crackin" cocktail and "Manhattan" were amazing! They even had the dark maraschino cherries as a garnish. Our bartender, whose name I believe was Cameron, was fantastic! Highly recommend checking out this place!!!!!

t7tN0ud72g83jXW9xv_f6g.text: I'm kind of in love with this place. The crush was easily formed when they serve delish oysters. The happy hour specials are fantastic! $1 oysters and $10 off Bubbly- I can't think of a better way to spend the night!  The service is pretty great too. Our waiter was way into oysters and was crazy attentive.   My second visit was just as great as my first! I will be going again!

The fish in the gumbo was not edible!! Very fishy and needed more seasoning. I have had much better gumbo. The lobster roll also needed more seasoning. The waiters were super nice!! Jvl9QBsmJ3ccvxO6Ofk69g.text: I really like this restaurant.  The oyster selection is really great and the service was super friendly and nice.  We also tried the foie gras deviled eggs, fried alligator, and brussels sprouts.  The brussels sprouts were my favorite - the glaze on them was especially good (but sweet!).  We finished the meal with the beignets, and they were probably the best I've had outside of New Orleans.  I'm definitely looking forward to going back and trying their brunch menu.

X1XQ6-NDt0xaXDoSP0pA_Q.text: I'm so into a place that has happy hour FOOD specials. Especially when they happen to be $1 oysters. While they are select oysters, I haven't yet met an oyster I didn't like!  You know what makes this even better? $10 off champagne bottles. Seriously, the deals keep coming! I could hit this up once a week just for that combo alone!  But the more you dive in, the better it gets! The heartier food is also fantastic. I've tried fried green tomatoes, oh so crispy fries and a really delicious bean salad side (that day's special) that was enough to fill me after oysters.  Absolutely make a reservation because it's small inside and gets packed on the weekends. I'm sure you could potentially scoot in at the bar, or those adorable seats at the window outside. Can't wait to get happy there again soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Oysters

Za94yhxBOkgu5-UmDUurxg.text: Service has gone down hill. Previously 5 stars. Now barely worthy of 1.  Incorrect order No correction  Long wait after food order Incorrect bill   The happy hour prices might be enticing but not worth the headache.

YTXAo5MhO7oGUD00eF0zbg.text: If you love oysters and want variety, look no further because muddy waters delivers on this. If you are not a fan of oysters, they have items on the menu for you too!   My friend and I stopped in around 7 on a Wednesday night and there was plenty of seating. This might not be the case on weekends, as they serve brunch! We ended up sitting at the bar area. Our server was very knowledgeable and helpful when it came to deciding what to order.   My friend ordered the corn bread to start. I was really shocked to see how many pieces they brought out and they were thick pieces. I am not a huge fan of corn bread, but this corn bread was a total game changer in my book. They also don't mess around with the peach pecan butter-delish! She ordered the shrimp and grits as her meal. The shrimp were really large and had the head on still. I ordered the chargrilled oysters and I was not disappointed one bit. I may have been disappointed that I didn't order 2 orders of this, but now I know for next time!   Overall, everything was as fresh as it gets and the prices were what I expected. The only downside is parking, but we ended up parking in the garage by Whole Foods and it's free!

photos.caption: Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Corn bread
Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chargrilled oysters

bNpbQWKgkaZHN2rNgItwSw.text: I have been dying to come to Muddy Waters since it first opened and can say that I was definitely not disappointed! A group of girlfriends and I had plans to come here for brunch on Saturday afternoon. Of course, we woke up to a huge snow storm that morning- but it didn't stop us from getting here for a Saturday funday!    Once we all battled the snowy streets of Pittsburgh, it was around 1:30 that we ended up getting here. The hostess informed us earlier that there was an oyster shucking class that afternoon, so we weren't able to reserve a table for our group. We ended up sitting at the bar which was fine, but I would have preferred a table- especially with a larger group. The atmosphere inside is super clean and cute! It reminded me of a restaurant that would be at the beach- which was super refreshing for a frigid January afternoon! The service here was quick and efficient- I have no complaints!   We started our lunch with plenty of cocktails and an order of the cornbread and various oysters for the table. The cornbread was served with an amazing sweet butter. This hit the spot for a cold day. The oysters were also phenomenal! We were seated right in front of the oyster bar- so it was fun to watch them prepare the oysters for us. They were served with a tasty vinegar to put on them to make them more flavorful. Their oyster menu had a lot of options & our waiter helped us choose some based on what we told him we liked, which was perfect since I personally don't know a lot about oysters. For my lunch, I ordered the bahn mi shrimp po boy with the cajun fries on the side. I could not stop eating this po boy- there was so many flavors with the perfect amount of spice! I look forward to coming back to Muddy Waters in the future!

hFFYht85dSfnb0Ba7i675A.text: Muddy Waters has a great brunch menu. Their grits are the best I can find in Pittsburgh. Their Bloody Mary Bar is really good too and they have oysters you can put in them!

BLVLaSC0Ocn6Xtl8zJV1aw.text: Oysters are great!  Drinks are are short.  Tiniest martini with the biggest price in town.

jRdUTclLQbfYWIjjpxvmDQ.text: What lovely service and food! Hush puppies, Brussel sprouts, po boys, burgers, and beverages! So pleased with this experience with such a large party. Highly recommended.

aC79bTtcQrTha6i4Dy88TA.text: Very casual, no pretense, and very good, especially the oysters.  I particularly like the Oysters Rockefeller, with spinach...and bacon.  Drinks are good too and reasonable.  What else do you need?

em4ygk-absU-P6-Ftop88g.text: We went tonight for dinner & it was also our 32nd wedding anniversary!   Loved the food & the atmosphere!  My husband & I had drinks to start.   I had wine & he had the greys sour.  We had the hush puppies for appetizer.   Very good!  I had the special - a whole red snapper.  It was so good!   I never had a whole fish before.   My husband had the shrimp & grits.      Very good also.  Would definitely recommend!   Had a wonderful experience!

NaHpBsd6ZDTf7bD2sUeiSA.text: I had a wonderful time here! The oysters were great, the Virginia ones were the best to me, so thank you to the waiter for reccomending it. The food was amazing. I had a poboy, which was the first of hopefully many poboys in my life, because that was a fantastic sandwich. My girlfriend had the gumbo and said it was the best gumbo she's ever had. They've got a pair of fans in us!

4zxdzk_YNz0AUnVDFCHFOw.text: My wife and I stopped in for the second time, we were here 1 year ago and loved it, but did not write a review. Muddy Waters did not disappoint as it was as delicious as the first time. We were there during happy hour on a Saturday and there were all sorts of good deals! We are two dozen east coast oysters on the half shell which were delicious and only a buck a piece!! We then both ordered the bloody Mary's which were cheap, an oyster po boy sandwich and fries, and fried green tomatoes! Everything was excellent and the service was out standing!! We will definitely be stopping here again!!

wNaFgFy4YTfnBsIZTABzBA.text: This is the best happy hour in Pittsburgh-$1.00 oysters and $10.00 off bottles of prosecco-heaven! Better get there early (4:30) cause it fills up fast.

MosBzn6cNLH_P-iE4bpOQQ.text: The oyster selection is incredible and every one we sampled was delicious! I had the seafood gumbo, and it was the best gumbo I've ever had. The baguette was a wonderful touch. Muddy Waters' drink options are also very impressive. I can't wait to come back!

4i4jeRXFYR4YXsRgNLgBcA.text: I've been to Muddy Waters many times since it opened and have never been disappointed. Great oysters and drinks. Delicious!

sRMFaMjaEO6VvjLOK_6mEQ.text: If you're gonna put a lobster roll on the menu, do it right.  Probably won't go back. Also, our server was not nice at all.  Not friendly.  And it was bloody hot in there on a 90 degree day.

jt7tYfDjfc3zgMJzWsWmbA.text: The bartender I unfortunately had acted like he was serving me as a favor. Absolutely no interaction except for listening to your order and handing you the check. For the sake of social decency, I left tips but frankly he didn't deserve any. One star for the service.

zUiKPXwBZJJwtXKJVRSYXg.text: Live music on a Tuesday night? Yup. Great oysters? Yup. Great drinks? Surely. Good food? Yes. I wasn't knocked off my feet, but it is hard to obtain a 5. Very New Orleans-esque. Come here to enjoy that lifestyle. Bon apetite!

BxnxVza0zoNGXkRiWNB3mQ.text: This place has a great atmosphere and great food. Highly recommend trying the salmon, it was very fresh and at a great price for the portion. Service was outstanding and parking wasn't an issue.

IX7DvExGOVJV50ow58zoVw.text: Let's not waste time with verbose reviews - this place is outstanding!   Oysters are 'dock fresh', deviled eggs are the best I have ever dreamed of, and every other small plate is aces.  Solid cocktail program and servers hustle. GO!

_BOpM_dItgEIcNpBG3wXkQ.text: First of all - to the management, can it with the sarcastic review responses on the Google reviews site.  Insulting your customers is not good business, and just makes you sound like a bunch of a-holes.  I almost didn't go to Muddy Waters after finding it on Google, reading the reviews and the jerks representing your restaurant who responded.  Grow up.  THAT BEING SAID...  It is a quite small oyster bar + restaurant in Pittsburgh.  Yes, you will pay more (ironically) than even Manhattan, but the oysters I had were quite high quality and the ambience is nice.  Plan on $50 min per person, and most of the oysters are $3 each, so not a bargain by any stretch.  The oyster po' boy is great, and the burger is also quite large and satisfying despite being around $14.  Waitstaff was friendly but not overly attentive, but for a leisurely meal doesn't matter!  I recommend for a special occasion, or just a nice evening splurge.  Weekends will be packed, so make reservations or go at non-peak times.  Their social media team needs to be fired.

RhU4TeRb4LK3EdTHOEhGTg.text: Great oyster bar. They are friendly, help you pick out the variety of oysters that they sell (I didn't even know this was a thing) AND make great drinks.   I will be going back.

EGDm5DPd14TskQHBDXhyxw.text: I like to come when they are having an oyster special, don't sleep on the pig skins.

GRIcsVQKtI28ASQNW4xHBg.text: Been here a few times and I've had various dishes. I enjoy their oysters but everything else is underwhelming or overwhelming-not in a good way. Today we had a lobster roll, sausage hash that was on special, wedge salad and the seafood tower. The wedge salad was overly acidic-it was sour. The waiter told the gm of my complaint and she was very accommodating offering to take it off the bill which I appreciated. He also messed up and brought the wrong dish which is a forgivable mistake but still a mistake when one person watches everyone else eat for 10 minutes or so. My problem with their food is that they try too hard. A lobster roll should be about the lobster-not overwhelmed with seasoning and toppings. Everything is a few ingredients over the top and just overwhelming in one direction. They have a good raw bar but don't deserve more than 3 stars for shipping and shucking fresh seafood. Their prices are nearly at Eddie V's level as well which is by far the best seafood in Pittsburgh-go there instead for your fix or stop in MW's for happy hour.

c0vZPW3lQ83MgQiucdLrPA.text: This place is super yum. I'd probably give it a 4.5 star rating, though, because we thought they were trying a little too hard to be over the top with the drinks, which resulted a little too much fuss for not as much flavor. The food, however, is off the charts. I'd say that cajun-type food is my least favorite of all foods, and I loved their eats. It is cajun-done-awesome. However, save yourself $5/drink and stick to wine or beer to wash it down.

kNK8z2rmn3cwabEx-jUuKA.text: Delicious! Cool vibe large bar area. They have a big garage door that can open when the weather is nice! We had the shrimp po boy- I recommend getting tartar sauce on the side and the lobster roll! Both were really good. Lobster roll wasn't the traditional mayo kinda but there was so much flavor I loved it. I hear they have great brunch as well!

zgpOlGdHV_ZSg5Boi7VHAA.text: Okay, I promised the hard working shuckers Justin and Nate I would rate them on Yelp but it took a while. My wife and I visited on 8/2/19, we are from Detroit and made a B-Line to Muddy Waters Oyster Bar. Everything was better than advertised. Great service, people and prices. Sat at the oyster bar and those guys were kicking out the trays of fantastic, fresh oysters. They really knew their stuff and spoke to the flavor characteristics of each type of oyster. We even had a couple oyster shooters. Fortunately, we have relatives in Pittsburgh, so we will make this a destination whenever we come to town. Thanks Justin and Nate!

d5wGiHGfZ_lRHo-_P3EuqA.text: This place is absolutely delicious. The gator bites, the Nashville Hot Chicken, and the jambalaya are the dishes we ordered. Just so those who don't live in Pittsburgh near East Liberty know, there is NO parking available besides street parking, and at the nearby target, but the street parking is almost always full during night hours.   The chicken feeds two people happily. It's pricey, but when you find out it's basically a huge southern happy meal of sides and chicken cooked to perfection, there's no room for complaining. The biscuit that comes with the dish is delicious.   The jambalaya is portioned very liberally and can feed you for dinner and for lunch the next day.  The gator bites were good, and the aioli served with it paired very well with the taste and texture, but they were a bit pricey.   We didn't try any oysters this evening, because the boyfriend does not like them, but I am sure I will come back another time for them.

S2zBCqSvQGRnz9kCLqLY_w.text: The ambiance was cool but we had to ask them to turn the music volume down. Too loud to even start a conversation. Service was great as was the food. Yummy oysters and lobster rolls. Food is a bit too pricey though.

Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Brussel sprouts
Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Oyster sampler

3x-cCr9DWSMA5vG_kHwQeA.text: We were extremely excited to try this place out given the high marks, but we must've come on an off night. The restaurant itself has a more casual feel with some personality in its decorations, but with the high price and quality of food and service, we were sorely disappointed.  The east coast tasting of oysters was okay. We also ordered the Louisiana Lobster Roll and Seafood Gumbo. Something must've happened in the kitchen because the lobster roll had absolutely no butter at all; it was a dry piece of lobster in a roll. The Seafood Gumbo also lacked flavor and didn't have much taste. The fries were okay, but didn't have any particularly special texture nor flavor and were slightly soggy.  Service was also a miss. The servers felt inexperienced and disorganized. Our waiter was not thorough in explaining the menu, and he was inattentive to our table. My husband had ordered a drink from the bar and no one went to pick it up. When the waiter was prompted to finally check in on the drink, he brought it over to us with nearly all of the ice melted, leaving the drink watered down. Honestly, it shouldn't have been served at all.  Unfortunately overall the level of service and quality of food here did not justify the cost for us.

4oOhQ7CIlq0pnTq_oGjhdw.text: Oyster happy hour!!! Don't be fooled by old menu photos like dumb me did. East and West coast oysters are $2 each besides for the Delaware Bay oysters that are $1 as of Feb 2018.  DELAWARE BAY: Tastes 'basic'. You'll know what I mean if you compare it to the others. It's $1 though! KUMIAI ($2 during HH): This one was pretty bomb, maybe West Coast tastes better than East Coast? Mmm, be sure to get a order of 6 of these. LOBSTER ROLL ($22): Wowweee! This was sooo buttery like dripping butter no me gusta. Also it wasn't very big so don't be convinced by pictures. Lobster and the fries were good but not as crispy as I'd like.  I don't have the biggest appetite but zamn we both ended up dishing out like $40 which is kinda a lot since it was happy hour and we're broke college students but it's ok it was kinda worth. Wasn't exactly full though. *nervous laugh* I'd maybe come back, but I believe there is another restaurant in the Strip that does oyster happy hour too.

u23-qw7uuBLlUfJ6s1zwiQ.text: I can't say enough good things about this place! I've been for brunch before and it's amazing! The entire center island is filled with BYO Bloody Mary items. They also have happy hour from 11-1.  Most recently I went for normal happy hour which is 430-630. On Tuesday's there's also live music and a second happy hour from 9-11. Parking can be found on the street (digital meters) or nearby garages.  Happy hour was perfect. We were seated at the raw bar with a front row seat to the oyster beauties. They have $1 east coast and $2 west coast. Honestly the east coast were way better; meatier in my opinion. We splurged since I had a gift card from work and got bottles of bubbles since they were $10 off (you'll feel like a baller and not break the bank, do it).  After legit 3 dozen oysters, we paced ourselves the rest of the night with fried green tomatoes (huge slices, firm, perfectly fried), Mac n cheese (so cheesy), hush puppies (I wish I had some now) and the rosemary and roasted garlic cornbread with Abita root beer glaze and smoked sea salt butter (this was like a dessert and i legit wanted to keep eating the butter).  Can't wait to come back!

yOn3rzeekE2BFQAZSHClyA.text: Came a bit too early today with my friend because we were sooo eager to try this place out. Alex kindly let us in early and gave us a short rundown of the place. Muddy Waters is selling bottles of wine to raise funds for The Tree of Life Synagogue. All proceeds go to the synagogue! How amazing is that?  We went in at 4:30PM for HAPPY HOUR. The oysters are sold at discounted costs (about $1+ cheaper). The menu is helpful in that there are "Oyster Tasting Notes" on the back.  [Atmosphere] Chill vibes. The bar has a cool marble countertop and minimalistic design. The wallpaper is very thematic. Light fixtures are artsy. Pops of blues liven up the place.  [Service] Then employees here are phenomenal. Friendly. Helpful. Patient. You can tell they care for their business. A big reason for the high rating is the service! Kieran was awesome! Cool dude with some sold recs.  [Food] The Hama Hama and Squalli Absch were really good. I personally liked the cleaner, sweeter taste of Hama Hama. Def try it out!

19V5p3UuprQj63cUt7OtJg.text: A few weekends ago, a friend of my boyfriend's was visiting from Maryland and we wanted to go out for a nice brunch. Maryland does have better seafood than Pittsburgh does, but we decided on going to Muddy Waters to see what their brunch specials had to offer. This was both of our first visits to this restaurant, so we were really looking forward to it.  We arrived later than most of our friends, but as soon as we sat down we looked over the menu and decided pretty quickly what we'd like to eat. It was a Sunday afternoon and the Steelers game was on, and I wasn't sure going into this that there would be a TV in the restaurant. To our surprise, the game was on! It was nice to be able to keep up on the game while enjoying our time here. I ordered the fried oyster po boy, and my boyfriend got the lamb po boy. I gave him a hard time about ordering lamb at a place predominantly known for seafood, but when it arrived I ate my words because it looked delicious. The lamb was juicy and there was so much piled on the sandwich that it was falling off and had to be eaten with a fork. The po boys were gigantic, and the side of fries was a decent portion size, too. Two of our friends at the table ordered the lobster eggs benedict, and that would have been my next choice if I wasn't feeling a po boy during this visit. All the pieces of lobster were huge and looked buttery and perfect. Everyone at the table with us seemed pretty happy with their meals.  Muddy Waters has quite a few specials during their happy hour on drinks and oysters, and I can't like and act like I'm a huge fan of raw oysters, but I do enjoy them cooked. I'd love to come back and enjoy a happy hour here. Also, I'm a big fan of bloody Marys, and the bloody Mary bar seems amazing here because there are tons of things you can add into them to jazz them up. The service here was great, and prices were fair for the portions and quality of the food. I'd recommend this place for brunch for sure and for anyone that really enjoys good seafood!

photos.caption: Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Oyster po boy

UVAFxoQpgsSZOhllG2nAnw.text: Great wait staff nice location. Decent New Orleans cuisine. Parking isn't hard to find either

2enyrP6aXaVKvoQd05X3uA.text: Sampled Oysters, did a shooter and watched the magic all unfold at the bar. This place is a hidden East Liberty gem. The bartender is a mixologist and takes cocktails to the next level. I also tried an Oyster shooter that was spicy and fun to throw back. Also had a beer to enjoy with the mix of East Coast Oysters I Tried. With the raw bar they serve a watermelon sauce that is served in a eye dropper. Tasted great and makes a very interesting presentation. Can't wait to return and sample more of the menu and try some exciting sounding and great looking cocktails. Enjoy!

eksuPeqvUKvLLjY63-xybg.text: First time to Pittsburgh and love this city. Discover the oyster bar through yelp and apparently it's a good pick.  Muddy Waters Oyster Bar located about 20 minutes from downtown. As we walked into the restaurant, we can immediately see the whole shelf of liquor and the oyster bar on the left side. We seated close by the bar and able to see the oyster chef delicately open the oyster as order come in.   There are wide range of oyster to pick from. The server is very patient and take time to explain to us the different between them. Other than oyster, they do have other menu items to choose from.   I would said this is my first time been to an oyster bar and it is a good experience. I love the chill environment with some fresh oysters and delicious food.

Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Louisiana Lobster Roll with fries

7OLCExfwwuWfd8wQIwKF3Q.text: I've heard great things about Muddy Waters, so I've been wanting to check it out.   My friend made reservations on Wednesday night around 6pm - because we hit traffic, we made it to the restaurant around 6:20pm. The restaurant wasn't too crowded, so it wasn't a probably that we got there late. We got seated in a booth, which I preferred because I hate high top tables.   Our waiter (Alon) came to take our drink order, but went over the specials too fast. We ended up ordering a bottle of Pino Griot / they had half off bottles on Wednesdays.   Alon had a bad attitude with us. When we tried to order oysters, he wasn't helpful - we aren't familiar with how to order the various of types of oysters and was looking for some guidance- he didn't share any. He seemed irritated that we had questions about the menu. We ordered some East Coast and West Coast oysters- I enjoyed the East Coast ones better.   We also ordered a couple small places to share - we ordered the hush puppies and Mac n cheese. A few of the hush puppies were uncooked and gooey - they were nothing to write home about. The Mac n cheese was good, but it was a little too spicy for me.   My entree, I ordered the lobster and crawfish roll with a side of fries. The lobster roll was tiny for the price point of $22. I also had some very tough pieces of lobster that made me turn my stomach. The fries were okay, nothing to write home about.   I can understand the appeal of Muddy Waters  - I would tell you to try it yourself....And I would go back one day, but not for a while.

Juj_g_gUf0OMCQohG7tvYg.text: First time here...food was GREAT!!!  Kieran was phenomenal!!!!  We will definitely be back...  THANK YOU!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

GGwpV8-POrLJvmj04m6UZw.text: I felt like I was stepping into Louisiana or Mississippi when I walked into this restaurant. When I was examining the menu, my eyes immediately gravitated toward the alligator and sausage gumbo. I love alligator, however it's hard to find up here in Pittsburgh. The gumbo was incredibly seasoned and absolutely delicious. It's a little on the spicy side so beware when ordering this but I would definitely order it again. I also had the hushpuppies, which were good, however, I'm used to having hush puppies that have a little sweetness to it and these do not. They still had a great flavor to them and I love the pieces of corn throughout the hushpuppy. The sauce that it came with also complimented it well. I also had the pleasure of trying my friend's meal who had the banana fosters french toast. This isn't just your regular degular french toast! It was almost like a bread pudding with banana and bourbon flavor throughout. Absolutely delicious and the bacon that came as a side had a nice smoked flavor to it. No complaints here! I can't wait to come back and try more things on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Hushpuppies
Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Alligator and Sausage Gumbo

OIYLTfO2_NiNij7RrRSuyw.text: Muddy Waters is one of my favorite restaurants in Pittsburgh! For starters, their happy hour is amazing! I highly recommend their chargrilled oysters and a bottle of their sparkling rose! My first time there was just in an attempt to explore the city and I randomly stumbled across it. The wait staff and bartenders were the nicest and extremely helpful. I also find that their portions and prices are extremely reasonable    So far I've been there for brunch and dinner and would definitely come back for both.  Whether it's a mid week pick me up or an end cap to the week, I'd highly recommend this spot all around, it a go to place for my friends and I.

vLCuEy4wgMMI5SNn2QPqRQ.text: Their oyster happy hour with the $1/$2 oysters is a great deal and I definitely recommend visiting during those hours! They have a nice selection and everything we tried was really delicious. I wasn't a huge fan of my lobster roll but the oysters alone were good enough to give this place 5 stars.

9WYcOYTL0t2hIjkbq7SW1g.text: Great happy hour prices! Fresh seafood. Best place for oysters in the burgh. Bartenders can make you a fabulous drink. Get an oyster shooter!

B-BzX8G2qJXTdsmIZA0qJw.text: I had the sampler platter of oysters, six east coast and six west coast. The oysters were great but it took quite a while to get them. My intention was to eat the oysters as my appetizer and then order something not too heavy as an entree. At $3 per oyster, my dinner budget was shot and my time had slipped away. I left without ordering an entree and stopped at Popeye's on my way back to the hotel.

V9TP13jfhontiBk8xf7rtQ.text: FANTASTIC!!!!!!!!  Hands down one of the best restaurants I have been to in a very long time!  Our server Marley was so knowledgeable about oysters and their entire menu.  He took the time to explain the different offerings of Oysters to us.  His suggestions were so good that we decided to get a second tray of Oysters. The pineapple and vinegar sauces add so many different levels of flavors to the different oysters!   He suggestions for dinner (lobster roll, alligator po'boy) were delicious and cant leave out the cat fish sticks for an app. Service was attentive and quick but not overbearing and the atmosphere of the place makes you feel like you are not in Pittsburgh.  Every employee that we came in contact with were friendly and flashed a smile.  Cameron at the bar was also fantastic.  This place is a gem!!!  Thank you for the great time and we will be sure to be back!!!

ScqWfSgGCnr1pl8TfJIAYw.text: Paid $75 for frozen, chewy crawfish when they were supposed to be fresh! How upsetting.

BqvvYGFxUMRfXy0BVJpQzA.text: We have wanted to try this place for a while. It was excellent and much more than we expected. The decor is really fun and the food was outstanding. The shrimp Po boy is excellent!

JLciNyi0gQeYfSA3xZ7kuQ.text: My family and I checked out Muddy Waters on Father's Day per a recommendation from a coworker. The restaurant is definitely on the smaller side so it may be best to get a reservation if you plan to go. The main reason I checked this place out is for the Bloody Mary bar. While it was not the best I've ever seen, it had some interesting options such as raw oysters and pickled green tomatoes that I haven't seen anywhere else. Which is one thing I really look for in a Bloody Mary bar. Everyone can do a Bloody Mary bar but how can you make yours stand out from the rest.  As for the food, it wasn't out of this world but we definitely liked it. 3 of us got the breakfast biscuit and 1 of us got the special quiche. Overall I think they took something that was relatively basic and boring and made it a little better by putting their own spin on it. I'm not a huge biscuit fan but their biscuit was amazing. That topped with an egg and red onion marmalade how could it not be good!?   A coworker has told me that the lobster eggs benedict is also amazing so I will definitely be back to give that a try and also to give the lunch/dinner a try.

Dmol0J2w0H7NW4BtYseyLw.text: The food here is good.  The lobster roll was tiny.  The tables here are awkwardly long and thin.  You are much closer to random people next to you than you are to the person you are eating with.  It makes having a conversation difficult.

0rltxZ2JolPQvYSmcgjEaw.text: For a super hipster eatery, this place actually appealed to me! It really was perfect. I went during happy hour and it was da bomb.   Hubby and I went all out and ordered 24 East coast oysters, the hot chicken entree, the skillet cornbread and the beignets! Everything tasted amazing and the ambiance was relaxing and nice. It is a rather cramped interior with uncomfortable chairs but their Bayou menu makes up for it. The staff is very friendly too. Everyone was pretty attentive whether they were your waiter or not. The beignets came with this bourbon caramel sauce that I swear I got tipsy from, lol.   Usually, I would not give cramped, expensive popular places with no parking many stars, but I think the appeal of Muddy Waters was too much. I'm a sucker for New Orleans themed things and this one just really satisfied me. Well done. I will be back to try the rest of the menu.

cjm6RddtsWCgJ73gg3Niiw.text: Fried alligator...lobster eggs benedict...oysters...chicken po'boy...duck and sausage gumbo, poutine with green tomatoes and blue cheese.. Muddy Waters offers a unique and hearty take on brunch and I loved every second of it. The lobster eggs benedict was my brunch pick and it was completely amazing. At $20, I hoped I was going to get my money's worth and I did. Lots of lobster pieces strewed around the biscuit, ham and poached eggs - my stomach was very happy.   My friend tried to the fried alligator and waffles to be a little adventurous. NOTE: This is more than enough food for two people. Alligator was piled high enough that people from other tables stared at the plate of food before us. It was a bit of a spectacle but that wasn't the best part. The best part was that the fried alligator was DELICIOUS. It's like a slightly more chewy and flavorful chicken! So maybe it didn't end up being super out of the box, but it was pretty delicious.  Also, service was really good! Our waiter was really friendly and happy to talk us through the menu.

yURG1_fN5Sc0bpNIWqji0g.text: Awesome happy hour- $1 east coast and $2 west coast oysters. They also take reservations!  Standouts: Fried Green Tomatoes (excellent pimento cheese spread) and Hot Chicken (1/2 spicy fried chicken with rice and collard greens). The Lil Chunky Burger was OK.  I also tried a banana dessert with whiskey at the recommendation of the server- very good, but the alcohol content was stronger than I expected, which I guess isn't necessarily a bad thing.

M0JccGoMKiPaxmaUHiIOLg.text: We love this place and go often. The oysters are amazing, as are all of the drinks, and the service is flawless. Highly recommend the chambong!

J7ohrkDZlID5i2MGSuMqAw.text: Super delicious. The staff is great at helping you choose what to get. Kind of pricey but come during happy hour and it's affordable.

gSeoP0WfCdh_jgPysz0X6g.text: This is the second time I have eaten at Muddy Waters and both times have had excellent food and service but my second visit was off the charts! Saturday evening December 1 we had made reservations for 730 party of 5 when we arrived they had seated another party in our place so we went and sat at the bar, ordered drinks after a short while and many apologies from several workers we were told they could seat us at a booth until our table was ready also because of the mix-up would receive complimentary bottle of champagne it wasn't long before we got the best seats in the restaurant and given VIP treatment by the staff! Started out with Cajun oyster shooters, fried green tomatoes and hush puppies for apps all delicious followed up with several different types of oysters and gumbo finished with beignets!! I highly recommend this restaurant and give kudos to staff and chefs!!

MqZTUXgtX90Y3YhdQw0-6g.text: Completely underwhelming. First, the good - the cocktails I had were well done with top shelf stuff. Really enjoyed the drinks. The atmosphere is the usual trite hipsterville stuff - nothing offensive, but nothing unique. Safe. The staff was efficient with a discernible lack of passion and/or personality. It seemed all business to me, but for some that's good enough. I tend to like a staff that is lively, effusive and possess a witty demeanor. During my visit it was all 'whatta you have? Gotcha. Here you are. Everything ok?'. Attempts to dive deeper in conversation didn't go anywhere. Whatever... So, the food. Ordered fried green tomatoes as everyone seems to and they were fine. Ordered a po boy and it was fine. My partner ordered seafood gumbo and it was...wait for it...fine. For $24 I want really good not ok.   So I get that I am actually not in NOLA so I should be less critical, but I think there should be more to a New Orleans themed restaurant than 1. Delta music on juke 2. indulgent use of salt... 3. remoulade. Perhaps I'm being too harsh, but with these prices and with the hard sell of an eating on the bayou experience I think they could deliver more than they do. I'm glad I went, but I don't think I'll go back. Frankly, for what my bill was -  I can get a RT ticket to New Orleans. That is not hyperbole. It really is not.

KaTJXSmf1B2JxthGyVmQaw.text: First impressions: My family (dad, mom, stepmom, two younger sisters and young cousin) came in on a Thursday night to celebrate my mom's new job. My mom made a reservation for 6:45, but we were able to be seated early (6:30) because we arrived early. My mom, sister, and I arrived first and were seated. We then were informed by the rest of our party that my cousin would be joining us as well, and the staff quickly accommodated the extra person. Awesome! We mentioned my mom's new job to the waiter and he brought my mom a glass of champagne on the house (I am underage, so I did not taste any drinks myself, but she said it was wonderful)!  Service: Our waiter was awesome! I'm sad I didn't get his name so I could give him the proper respect. He was very attentive, always quick with refills on water and other drinks, and overall very helpful and friendly. The entrees were a little slow coming out, but it was definitely worth the wait. Plus the restaurant was busy (yes, busy on a Thursday night!), so it's totally understandable. There was a minor problem. My mom wanted the Oyster Po Boy but asked for it with no bun. It came out with a bun, which is no big deal but just a slip up I thought I would mention.  Atmosphere: A little noisy because of the loud music, but not a huge issue.   Apps/Sides/Drinks:  - My dad got the Ain't Got No Thyme. He is not a fan of bourbon, but still enjoyed the drink a lot which speaks volumes.  - Pork Rinds: The table enjoyed them. I was not a fan, but that was because of personal preference rather than execution.  - Hush Puppies: These were excellent, and so was the sauce that came with them. Definitely would recommend.  - Cornbread: A little too sweet in my personal opinion, but still tasty. The bits of jalapeno were not overpowering if you're like me and are picky about spice, and they helped with the sweetness. The bread was nice and moist and served with plenty of butter.  - Grits: I was happy to find that these were plenty cheesy (lots of restaurants skimp on the cheese), but the texture was a little off. I wish they were creamier and not so lumpy. Still delicious though.  - Dirty Rice: My dad thought it was a bit mushy and bland. I didn't taste this, but my sister agreed with him.  - Parmesan Truffle Fries: Really tasty and good with any meal! Not really above and beyond your expectations for parm truffle fries, but still done very well.  - Duck and Sausage Gumbo: Everyone enjoyed this dish, and I found it interesting that it had a smokiness to it, which is not something I usually experience in gumbo.   Main Course:  - I ordered the lobster roll. The bun was very soft and fluffy and brought everything together. The lobster and crab was cooked nicely. I kinda wish more had been done with the dish though. It was tasty, but basic.  - Whole fried fish: My stepmom got this. The fish depends on the night and tonight it was some sort of bass. It was so good, she had the chef come out so she could thank him personally.   - Hot Chicken: This dish is very spicy, but also really tender. It can be hard to get tender chicken breast, so I was very happy with the outcome here.   - Oyster Po Boy: My mom really enjoyed it, despite the bread mishap. I tried one of the oysters and wasn't a huge fan. Seamed like more batter than oyster (although I'm not a huge oyster fan so I'm probably not the best person to judge).  Dessert:  - Beignets: A hard pass. I was really disappointed in these. The texture was awesome but there was NO sweetness at all in the dough. The only sweetness came from the powdered sugar. If there was no powdered sugar, you could probably serve them as yeast rolls. It came with a chocolate dipping sauce that just tasted like melted chocolate chips. If you want really good beignets, try Nola on the Square downtown.  - Chocolate Pecan pie: Pretty good, but the chocolate chunks in it were unnecessary.  Overall: Great service and great food. Avoid the desserts. Will definitely be back though!
