DYha7bUBVMteo8Iy-XhgcQ.text: Came here from a friend's suggestion. We sat at the bar because the wait was 2 hours! So definitely make a reservation if you want to sit at a table. They had great food and drink specials for happy hour. We had the lobster roll. A TON OF LOBSTER! yum! The fiance loved the hama hama oysters... I'm not a huge fan... but just my opinion. The staff was friendly and attentive! Will be back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Hama hama and a half a boiler maker

GXm7xhkZZSj-llArOO_Nzw.text: The atmosphere, food, and drinks are great. I love that there is restaurant in East Liberty where you can get seafood in a casual setting. My favorite are the oysters and the lobster rolls. The oysters are served with a delicious variety of hot sauces that you won't find at a traditional oyster bar. The cocktails are also very creative.

Fdu2zCfyOkHUEWK5bnltJA.text: Came here around 5 to get in on oyster happy hour specials on a weekday. This was part 2 of a quest for good seafood.   AMBIENCE A- Simple decor and small tables. It felt intimate, but not stifling. Clean counters and a small open seafood bar area. Nothing to write home about, but in my mind that's a good thing.   SERVICE B+ The guy was nice. He ended up carding (and then apologizing) my friend who is well past 21. Which was funny. But as the night progressed I started getting slightly more uncomfortable with each interaction with him. Maybe he was just really awkward, but he stopped looking at me and at one point directed all questions to my (male) friend. I thought I was imagining things until we left and my friend mentioned how awkward it was for him as well that I kept getting ignored. 'It seemed like a lifelong back of house guy really wanted to wait tables and is just not doing so hot yet.' Hopefully he's getting better at it!  DRINKS B Since I'm predictable I had the French 75. It was the flavor of a limocello. Cool it with the lemon juice!   APPETIZER A We went at such an early hour just to have $1 east coast and $2 west coasts. We had a few happy hour priced oysters and then branched out from there. The selection was ok. Was surprised that there were none from Long Island, but they were all quite fresh. They came with a mignonette sauce, so don't expect cocktail sauce!  MAIN COURSE A- I ended up having a bowl of gator gumbo and the sausage and pierogi plate. The gumbo was pretty good, but needed a bit more salt. The sausage and pierogi were fine. My friend got the gator po boy. I lost him for a few minutes while he inhaled it. It was apparently very good. His came with Cajun fries which tasted great but weren't very well-cooked.   DESSERT I ate too many oysters. I can't remember if there was a dessert menu.   Will be returning again for oysters. And if I can convince a few more friends to come, a seafood tower.

AmrTCuv-A2beHLEnhvEQ-w.text: First time. Unlikely to return: service ruins the experience despite good food.  For restaurant, here's a bad service recap so you can hopefully work on it...  Before sitting down - seated over 30 minutes late (had reservation) - while waiting for table, we were directed to standing bar waiting area. Given menus and told we could order food/drinks. No one came over for over 10 minutes (after walking up to misc. waiter to ask if we were supposed to order at main bar or if someone was coming...) - drinks didn't come until moments before sitting down  While sitting down - Couldn't hear waiter at table and had to ask him up speak up when talking about menu  - Had to ask a different waiter to get a second drink (main one disappeared) - Main waiter forgot to bring a drink my friend ordered at table - Mixed up items on the check  Honestly, I wasn't keeping track. This list is just what comes to mind the next day.    Food was great, props to the kitchen.

DEXlvqvOSyZczGJvVWJWuA.text: Delicious fresh oysters in a beautiful setting with great live music!

OB8iIrB67f8SiVX28tVERg.text: The place has just the right swag and delicious food.  Everything we had was delicious.  Deviled eggs, oyster shooters, gator gumbo, fish and po boys.   Just delicious.    Go here please!  You won't be sorry.

JLOJK8xCn8u1qKslsOrWMw.text: Never have I'm been disappointed with a meal at Muddy Waters! Always a strong selection of varied easy and west coast oysters and seafood. Friendly staff with great brunch( don't pass on the bloody bar) and happy hours ($1 oysters and 1/2 price sparking wines)!

w7BKMexSJWOQvSpbmbOvbQ.text: Not a seafood fan but this place was awesome.  We went for brunch and would go again. They have a huge bloody mary bar.  We had the Brunch Punch, though, and it was potent and delicious.  Started with fried green tomatoes...DO NOT MISS OUT!  They were amazing! It's definitely pricey, don't let the 2 $'s fool you.  But sometimes it's worth splurging for atmosphere, delicious food, and good service.

YLfaTA_0sEglaJdaf9j0wg.text: We were here for the first time. Although we came for the lobster roll, but surprisingly, the happy hour oysters were amazing, the sauce was just great...yum yum yum...  I thought the lobster roll could be better.... but will definitely come back again for the oysters

0kDDh88fvQLlgLBU_Qofgw.text: We loved everything about this place... From the decor, the service, the food and the oysters...everything was amazing. Definitely recommend calling for reservations!

Fjf_Fh03Z8rBLbxsI_rAQA.text: Another great meal. The spicy chicken is, without doubt, the best friend chicken I've had in this lovely city. The bar staff is so attentive and awesome and the Pacific Northwest oysters are the best. The atmosphere is perfect for a great night out.

YHRBCND7_ybiscLEtX4M_Q.text: I've been looking forward to visiting Adam Kucenic's new place since the Post Gazette gave them a preview back in June of 2015. I have been waiting a long time to find a place for oysters au naturel this far away from the coasts--Muddy Waters Oyster Bar is here, and it was worth the wait.  Tonight I was looking for simplicity, and after Adam talked me through the four eastern offerings and the two westerners, I chose the full range with a chef's selection of 12. This gave me two of each, and ample number to share with my two other companions. Neither of them had ever sampled a raw bar, and this was a fine first experience. The oysters, served on ice, were just the right temperature. Not too cold to attenuate the flavors, but yet cool enough to help support a nice clean edge. The flavors were clear and bright, the subtle notes of limestone minerality, tangy brine, elemental flavors of the living ocean mixing and swirling with each other. All the liquors were clear and limpid with just the right weight on the tongue, supporting the firmer texture of the oyster itself. A well balanced range of flavors: assertive and sharp, comfortable and gentle, sweet and flavors of melon. Fortunately, no heavy cocktail sauce in evidence, just fresh lemon and a well crafted mignonette. Well done--these fellows had been well treated from oyster bed to bed of ice. Not easy to do, and not done without appropriate expense. Adam and his suppliers are to be complimented.   The only suggestion I would make would concern presentation--a bit more visual flair would be helpful. A touch of green, perhaps dill sprig, parsley, cilantro--a bit of contrast. And,with a more abstract arrangement--think of the flair of the best Neopolitan pizza makers--let's just not circle the shells on the perimeter.  Tonight I only sampled one more item from the menu, the pimento mac & cheese. A solid offering, set off with crumbs well browned and mixed with bits of bacon, Just a tad too long in the oven--a bit more flow to the cheese matrix would have made it a 10.  And, of course, there was the Abita Purple Haze. Would not have thought of a Pilsner with a touch of raspberries at first, but it worked! And, from NOLA--what's not to like!  A great evening! Congrats Adam! Will be back soon!

NXhhY2ZuzPiEB1YHdJ1agQ.text: The foie gras deviled eggs were surprisingly very good & that was the highlight of the meal.  The grilled oysters were so heavy with garlic and cheese you couldn't taste the oysters. The oysters Rockefeller were dry and dull and the fried green tomatoes were greasy and hard.  I love oysters prepared just about any way and was hoping that Pittsburgh would finally have a great Oyster place. Oh well, I'll just keep on hoping!

d648vxUzUzv5aPzUD3qKBg.text: We were a party of 6 tonight, and Real waited on us.  He was absolutely AMAZING! So attentive, friendly, informative, and personable. The food was incredible, service from Real was outstanding, and we will definitely all be back again!!

vDveWBj1EFyQItVmPQkfXg.text: I really wanted to like this place as I love oysters and Cajun/Creole food and I was excited when I had heard that this place opened. So last evening my girlfriend and I walked over from her apartment to try it for the first time. I have been to New Orleans over a dozen times and am a wine and food lover and I looked forward hopefully to finding a place here in PIttsburgh. Sadly what I found was very disappointing. My girlfriend and I split the chargrilled oysters, fried green tomatoes and hush puppies as appetizers and then the Blackened redfish for dinner. Having eaten at the Acme Oyster House in NOLA many times the oysters were a sad representation of those, not very good and a terrible valued. The fried green tomatoes were okay and probably the best thing that we had though it was the remoulade sauce from the hush puppies that brought out the flavor not the sauce that accompanied them. The hush puppies were bland and seemed undercook, I have had better at Long John Silvers, and the Blackened Redfish which I had been looking forward to was under seasoned and had very little taste.   A small offering of wines that match nothing on the menu with small pours and large prices. Little ambiance, cavelike and noisy. I am sorry but I see no need to come back.

HyJvLEbFnM1lmNk2EmQejw.text: This place is really spot on. We went during happy hour and they have oyster deals a swell as $10 off bottles of bubbles. That is my jam. So we did that and it was great. We enjoyed the west coast a little bit more than the east coast but both kicked ass. We shared a lobster roll and it kicked ass. Go to this place and eat and drink. You won't regret

_cDatU33JDysdqpKZ9KLzw.text: Took our Mom out to dinner here last night for her birthday. If you like seafood you must come. I am not a fan of mussels (however my other family members were impressed with them) but had my share of the freshest prawns and lobster I have had in a very long time. Salmon was cooked to perfection but my favorites of the night were the sides and garnishes. Smoked Brussel sprouts, hush puppies ( don't think Red Lobster) , fried green tomatoes ( the best I have ever had), smoked deviled eggs, pickled green beans and homemade pickles. Can't forget the grilled bread that melts in your mouth either. Good selection of wine. Bartender knows what he is doing and is not stingy with his pours. My mom must have ordered 8 different unusual concoctions and he was able to deliver. Decor is cool with jazz music in the background. Parking is limited so allow yourself time to get there. Thank you Muddy Waters for an incredible dinner and really great service. We will be back soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

dg6Bsre-a5NOxxm583bPGA.text: What a tragic experience that could've been avoided. I made reservations to celebrate my birthday with friends last Saturday, or so I thought, upon arriving to my reservation, I was told that there was a mistake and my reservation was put in their system for NEXT Saturday. I made the reservation myself, and know that I clearly stated the purpose and the date of my visit. The staff, including the manager on site was not only unapologetic to me and the slew of friends that I brought to eat and drink in their ephemeral restaurant, they were downright rude to me, and others in my party who tried to figure out a reasonable solution. That being said, we walked next door to Livermore, and they were more than happy to accommodate my party, and we even invited a few more friends to join because the experience next door was so nice. At the end of the day, its all about service, and I will never step foot in this place again because of the rude, unapologetic, and immature behavior of the staff. The oysters could be made of pure gold, and this place will not survive with a staff like that.

E1Owq48QV6do3DuVPNS83A.text: We were pretty disappointed with Muddy Waters, after years of waiting for an oyster bar to open in our part of the country. The very slow service has already been addressed in older posts so I'll skip the part where we waited for 30 minutes for our drinks. My real problem is with the food. Oysters are oysters, and as long as you have a regular supplier anyone can put them on the menu and they will be good. I live in the neighborhood and saw that they get their seafood from the same distributor that most restaurants in the area do, so nothing exciting there - the oysters are fresh and there is a selection of about 6 split between East and West coasts. If you go for those alone, this place would be fine (as soon as they get the service thing under control). However, we ordered two really simple and classic entrees - BBQ shrimp and gumbo. They were both terrible. Even if you had no prior experience with these foods you would be unhappy with what we got. The shrimp were enormous, served whole. They were also so over-cooked I could have bounced them off the floor. Enough said. The gumbo: my understanding is that gumbo should be lots of fresh seafood, sausage and veggies in a rich roux-thickened meat stock over rice. The sauce was super dark and tasted of burnt flour, with little seasoning besides salt. There were about 4 very small chunks of sausage a few teeny tiny out-of-a-bag popcorn-type shrimp (again, rubberized) and a few overcooked vegetables, all swimming in a lake of the dark stuff. It did have good rice though. For the price of these things, it gave the appearance the that management is trying hard to make as much money as possible quickly, because what we got was not any where near what we paid for. I hope they turn things around and don't just count on people buying into the concept and not really caring about what they are served. One caveat is that I'm sure the fact that we made reservations for a busy Friday night and that they were clearly overwhelmed influenced what we found on our plate.

ava08pxuQa0RzjlikXqocg.text: What a great experience! The place is small but they were able to get us a table right away. The bar is very nice and includes an oyster bar as well. The service was very attentive and knowledgeable. We went for brunch on a Sunday at about 2 PM. The place was very busy and a lot of people were getting up and down for the bloody mary bar which looked great and included a ton of items to add to your bloody mary. I had a Sazerac and my wife had a French 75, both superb. We had an assortment of east and west coast fresh oysters and they were great. My wife had the lobster eggs Benedict and loved it. She said the hollendaise was especially good. My son had the lobster and crawfish roll and cajun fries which were hand-cut fries with cajun spices. He ate it in about 3 seconds, I had the gumbo which was the best i've had since New Orleans. In fact, it was as good or better than anything I've in NOLA. For dessert we had the Biegnet which were spot on clones of those at Cafe Du Monde. All in all, it was a great meal. When we left my wife asked if I thought we could get reservations for dinner that night. That's high praise.

soBOmlbyE-_jhQ0r-1vvAw.text: I called Muddy Waters 3 weeks ago and made reservations for tonight for a valentines day celebration with my fiance.  I thought it was weird that I never got a confirmation call for my reservation, so I called this afternoon to confirm our reservation for tonight.  They had no record of it, the guy put me on hold for about 4 minutes and then hung up on me.  For the complete lack of service and professionalism and ruining our valentines day plans, we will never try to go here again.  Just a word of caution for others!

u-6w-KGGrdm0T7dbEYisvA.text: Last night was mine and my girlfriend's third time visiting Muddy Waters. After being thoroughly impressed with their brunch, we decided to check out their dinner experience. Almost out of necessity, we started with the Chef's Oyster Sampler from the east coast. One of the things we love about this place is that their oyster selection always changes and we were very happy to see new additions as well as an expanded selection. As always, the oysters were delicious and a great start to the evening. We got cornbread and fries to start which were both superb, some of the best fries in the city in my opinion, while the bite from the jalapeno in the cornbread was delightful and delicious. For an entree, we split the fish of the day, which came whole (I must admit I've forgotten the name of it but our waiter said it was similar to Black Sea bass), that was absolutely superb with amazing greens and polenta. We rounded everything out with some fantastic beignets. Overall this was one of the best meals we have had in Pittsburgh and Muddy Waters has quickly become our favourite restaurant in the city. On top of the amazing food, the staff is amazing. Our waiter last night, Real, is incredible knowledgable and very friendly with impeccable timing on when he checks in and brings the food. Guaranteed to have a great experience if you sit in his section. So thank you Muddy Waters for another fabulous experience!

m_esacOVBNsDwrJt5gKhyg.text: Spending a lot of time in New Orleans, the food is here is absolutely authentic and so so good. Couldn't love the gumbo more than if I had ordered it in New Orleans. Everything we ordered was delicious. I ordered the whiskey drink and it was really good although not as strong as I would have liked. Our service was perfect as well. My only complaint was that I wish the music was louder to add to a more lively vibe. Will certainly be returning again and again.

VDeHsC4PnqjsYiHlCgmOtw.text: Such a solid place for Pittsburgh. Reminds me of oyster bars at home in Eastern NC, but with much better cocktails.

LnZFrv-4HJebqAhlQSdDYA.text: A friend made a reservation for four of us last night. I was the first to arrive for my party, was greeted kindly by the hostess and was seated in a booth in the back right away. Muddy Waters was busy on a Sunday evening but wasn't loud. Everyone at the table was happy with their orders. I ordered the po boy sandwich and got half shrimp and half oysters - one half was all shrimp and the other was all oysters. The po boy was tasty though could have used more kick and the order came with fries which were seasoned well though some were soft. My friends really loved their orders: gumbo, bbq shrimp grits and fried green tomatoes. Food seemed to come out a little slower than we had wanted however our waiter was kind and checked in on us periodically. I am so happy there is an oyster bar finally in Pittsburgh and Muddy Waters is priced reasonably that I will be back again. One thing we had thought of was that Muddy Waters should team up with the other businesses for valet as there is only street parking and nearby garages.

KnXiPatBU-rciv0bSGc-WQ.text: It was my second time at Muddy Waters and I will not be going back. After specifically stating no mayo on my shrimp po boy, I waited an outrageous amount of time just to receive my sandwich slathered- I mean slathered top and bottom bun and everything in between- with mayo. Needless to say I couldn't eat one bite, and so I spent an outrageous price for mediocre fries and three drinks. They didn't even have the customer service to take the sandwich off the bill. I most certainly will never be returning...

MrbHhtU8ab1sWGhPGrOGOQ.text: Muddy Waters was the icing on the cake of my trip to Pittsburgh.  Went here with two friends, and couldn't have been happier.  The Chicken and Sausage gumbo has this dark roux which I've never had before and will want from now on.  Apparently, they literally cook the roux until it's burned, I guess?  The result is smoky, spicy, layered and awesome.  Chicken and sausage both tender, okra (which I'm not generally a fan of) cooked perfectly and not slimy.  The Lobster Roll WOW.  Large, unctuous chunks of lobster and crawfish dressed in a whole lot of butter - verging on a little too much, but it works - and really, really tasty cajun fries.  But the star of the meal was this unassuming little bowl of perfection they called cheddar grits.  If you like grits, you have to have them.  They're the best I've ever had - a perfect creamy consistency that made this Southern boy very, very happy.  Great beer list, cool upscale rustic room...I'll be back when I'm in Pgh next time, for sure.

LYn7YKqUIMpkEUT4_EeDHA.text: Always fans of a raw bar, we looked forward with anticipation to try this new oyster restaurant. Unfortunately, we were left rather underwhelmed. A dozen oysters cost $36 which may be standard but significantly limits how many oysters one can reasonably order. This would be okay if the other food items were exceptional but sadly they were not. The food is more reminicent of mediocre bar food. I ordered the lobster roll. While the lobster was fine the bun it was served on was not properly toasted or buttered, felt like I was eating my lobster in sad little hot dog bun- kind of doughy. My husband order the oyster po boy- nothing special, not memorable- just seemed like a lot  of starch. The oysters were lost in it. We ordered the steak tartare- would describe as courser than we are used to- not so appealing. Ordered the pickled devilled eggs, these too seemed liked they were prepared in advanced, a bit disappointing, lacked a delicate hand. We normally gobble these up but we actually left one behind. Lastly, we ordered the mac n cheese- this was served in a skillet that was obviously placed in the oven, I suspect to make it toasty on top but the effect was to dry it out. Funny thing, we picked at it a bit and there was sufficent left over so we asked to have it packed up and accidentally let behind. My husband realized later and commented what does it matter, it wasn't very good, not sure we would have eaten. This is a sad commentary. I do hope soemone from the restaurant reads this, because we are happy to see new food places open  in our neighborhood but I do think that that once the novelty wears off they will need more substance to sustain. Our total bill was $120 which is a lot given the quality of the food.

s_3uvQiHjwaURBUmL6xqcA.text: great food great service great location great character so glad they opened i dont think you will see much riff raff loitering here any longer

o3zJDVLy8BF4S6ONktihmA.text: Great environment for some drinks and oysters. The drinks can be a bit hit or miss depending on who makes them. Great variety of oysters. A definite Pitt establishment for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. East oyster sampler

pXtAAqiCOp5h4LSuN3O75w.text: This was our first time here and let's just say I can't wait to go back again! The cornbread is just amazing, the apple butter spread you get with it is the best I've ever had. We also got the lobster roll which was done perfectly, my husband ordered a dozen oysters, which I don't eat, but he said they were delicious. I highly recommend this place.

SpeG5QYf0oqHoOPorG751w.text: Unbelievable food. The appetizers were amazing. The Hush Puppies, smoked devilled eggs and the fried green tomatoes are highly recommended.  My blackened salmon was succulent and not overly spicy.  Sazeracs are as good as you'll get in New Orleans.  It's an excellent addition to Pittsburgh

lHemaBEUT0e5ERGcMtBx3w.text: What an awesome place. Oysters were great and the cocktails top notch. My wife wanted to go out and have real cocktails and they delivered. The atmosphere was loud and exciting. Prices were high but worth it for the whole experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Oysters???? Yes please.

_XhWSu3yMqYyMHX1FtsGHA.text: Great spot in the Pittsburg area for oysters both raw and cooked. The staff was great and happy hour is by far the best value on raw oysters. Definitely worth the trip.

uGctnu2bJb5-ZbOOtTiZaw.text: Great drink menu, great service, and really good oysters. Welcome to the neighborhood!

IKI74fPkrmSQqlRuTAYzgw.text: I was between 3 and 4 stars for a review, but I decided to go back and try again in the hopes that I can bump it up.  First, the food was excellent.  We started with the hushpuppies and cornbread, and both were surprisingly light on the grease-factor and worth the price in terms of size and quality (6 large hushpuppies, and 4 good-sized squares of cornbread).  We had the lobster roll and fries and the seafood gumbo.  For me, the lobster roll was too garlic-buttery, but that's kind of how it's supposed to be.  It's one of the few in the city that goes the butter vs. mayo route, so if that's your thing, it's a substantial portion of seafood for the price (albeit the lobster is cut with crawfish).  The seafood gumbo was delicious.  A little heat, but a ton of seafood.  I had no problem at all paying $24 for something that hearty and generous.    We also had the cocktails, one sazerac and one Mardi Gras special drink.  The sazerac was ok...not common on drink menus around here, so I was happy that a creole/cajun restaurant was smart enough to at least try to include it.  The other drink was a funky combination of Purple Haze, mezcal, and flavored shrubs.  It was very heavy on the mezcal, which can be a pretty acquired taste, so I wish they had dealt a little more deftly with that flavor.  We had a reservation and still had to wait about 15 minutes, which would have been less irritating if they actually had somewhere to wait.  It's a pretty small place, so we had to sit at the bar, which unfortunately took seats from people just looking to sit at the bar and give business to the bartender for a bit.  The other complaint was that though our server was very personable, we were done with our cocktails mid-meal but he didn't offer us another cocktail until our plates had been cleared and we were finished.  We were wanting to have another drink, but at that point we were done with the food and felt kind of like he was trying to quickly turn over the table, which wouldn't be surprising given the limited seating.  He also didn't offer dessert, so I'm not even sure if they have a dessert menu there.  Not a big deal, but if you have a dessert menu, I'm usually a pretty easy sell.  Overall, great food, ok cocktails, but the experience seemed a little too rushed for us, whereas most restaurants at this price point tend to give you time to relax and enjoy it a little more.

wCF7ksm4HWpki-jlemBLVg.text: Listen people. Real is real. He's attentive and professional. The drinks and food are impeccable. Come. Try. LOVE

rvtObYsf_N8n6RAvtLdu4A.text: Great brunch!! Liked Bloody Mary bar and Oyster sampler was great!! Atmosphere and concept both very nice!! We'll be back!!

_YisWrSZCbF_dewlWwD8YA.text: This is a great addition to the Pittsburgh food scene.  Very nice variety of fresh oysters.  Better go during happy hour when the oysters are decent cost.  Otherwise this place is pricy!

eqZ82rfyMjtlwi7Cl0v2rg.text: This place is amazing, recently visited Nola, so we were craving some of the same. We didn't have reservations but sat at the bar. The bartenders were excellent. Drinks were great. Appetizers and meals were well worth it. Did the chefs choice of oysters, all were amazing, ask for a side of horseradish. and finished the night off with beignets.

41F6U0p3ImC77Fiw_44gng.text: I've been twice and both times it seems like they've have problems shucking the oysters, we've had to spit out grit. The drinks are good, but nothing too special that we've had. Probably not going to go again.

y87ZVA-GV1HWyPa5x6i2Rw.text: This is the best place I've ever been to for brunch! Delicious menu and the Bloody Mary bar is fantastic! We will definitely be back! This place is for sure a hidden gem. I got the shrimp po boy and it was absolutely delicious. I recommend getting reservations. I'm not sure if we would have gotten seated without them.

fvC84W1hEBCp_P6PjQ705w.text: What a great place.  The east/west oyster platter was superb and that was just the beginning. Then for dessert the charred peach crumble wirh its smoky taste was incredible.  Then everything in between....the wait staff....the atmosphere...the music....the main dishes.  We had an excellent birthday dinner for my daughter

In7lqUPEi0rc0nYSddhB2g.text: Amazing customer service, atmosphere, drinks and food. Try the salmon corn dogs with collard green slaw and lobster roll!!

WTBiLbuJMMqChrjfFv6F_Q.text: Really really good. We started off with the east/west coast oyster sampling. East coast was way better than west. Their green fried tomatoes were very very good. We then split BBQ shrimp and grits. 4 humongous prawns and the grits were cooked perfectly. Highly recommend!

aeIXVqCbs0KHAdfylMV0BA.text: Went for brunch and tried multiple items on the menu. Obviously if you like oysters you have to check this place out, but the cornbread and fried green tomatoes are amazing!!

c6951DKNKVaedYnsmtt2kQ.text: It kind of all comes down to price at this place...if everything we ate was reasonably priced then I just wouldn't have as negative feelings...I emphasize "as negative". The entree's were just ok....lobster roll was bland and overcooked. The gumbo, again, nothing great or notable. Some of the other entrees sounded better but honestly I wasn't in the mind set going there to pay steakhouse prices. The oysters were good...if I go back (and that's a big if)....it'll just be for oysters and apps. OH! Huge pet-peeve....if you're going to serve beer in bottles and cans offer your diners a glass! Here we are paying over $150 on a dinner for two and drinking cans of Dale's Pale Ale. Classy...

lRdszlFm_DndB6G_J0xGsQ.text: Whether just popping in for quick oysters on half-shell and wine at the bar, or for a full dinner, I have never been disappointed. What a great addition to the neighborhood.

u4joA0v1fSp3V_idMI12DQ.text: Happy Hour Oysters were awesome! I would suggest east coast but that's just my preference! Everything was awesome!

IYrzLdmxx0W0ZR9Gbn7wpQ.text: To be honest, I thought the food would be better for the prices and the vast amount of positive reviews on Yelp. The oysters were good, and the ponzu and cucumber/lemon (or whatever it was) sauces on the side were interesting. I probably would have preferred regular ole cocktail sauce and horseradish, which I know they also offer (if you ask for it). The lobster roll, while stuffed to capacity, unfortunately, was so incredibly tasteless, and the lobster/crawfish was overcooked and chewy. I understand this was not a typical New England-style lobster roll, but I had expected it to at least taste like something, anything. The Cajun fries were pretty good though. Overall, I left unsatisfied, especially because I had chosen to dine here instead of at another restaurant nearby.

6ItDnxEJFq-OFT733soICg.text: Stopped when was In the area and the Oysters are soooo good and the staff!! Great experience all around! Will defiantly make the trip again!

V27WQz9ImBcT2tvQ93D7rA.text: All around delicious.  Fabulous wait staff who patiently helps with deciding on happy hour oysters, excellent "sides" fried greens/ hush puppies and the kale salad and of course, super oysters. Great tunes.

ckCRKbqVd98xy_iN_mvqEA.text: Muddy Waters has a hell of an oyster selection. I didn't realize oysters varied as much as it turns out they do.  Muddy Waters bar service is really good. We got lucky and managed to get the outdoor window seats. The traffic noise wasn't distracting at all. Great can beer selection. I was striking out on wine, but I think it was just me.  Great oysters.  We shared the hot chicken. It was legitimately spicy. It wasn't insane spicy, but has a good heat and was served on two slices of white bread. It was exactly how I wanted it. The collard greens were absolutely amazing. The grits were super cheesy. It was practically Mac and cheese grits. They were great.

nD0uQLljo62Q5OuoBrwFbw.text: HOLY MOLY THE BRUNCH!   This may have taken the spot of my favorite brunch spot in Pittsburgh (food wise).  Came in on a Saturday around 12 for brunch with a reservation. Place was pretty calm and not packed but our waiter said that brunch for them is mainly busiest on Sunday's.   Our waiter was AWESOME. My friends both got the bottomless mimosas and I got the Bloody Mary bar. At no point did we have to ask for more mimosas he just kept them coming! And the Bloody Mary bar was second best I have experienced. First is definitely Meat and Potatoes.   Amongst us we got the shrimp and grits (head on shrimp), chicken and biscuit, and Lobster Benedict. Every single one was absolutely incredible. The ingredients were beyond fresh and the mix of flavors were very well executed.   I will definitely be back to try dinner!

hxOuzONbavJaIxo8-NM_kg.text: The food is delicious! Especially the cornbread. the service was great. The restaurant is a bit small but it's worth it.

6zBhmLr_irqIpAMGyJaHgw.text: Stopped in recently for a friends birthday (maybe her 25th?), what a good friend I am, right?  Really liked the ambience as soon as I entered.  Quaint and comfy, yet still a modern feel.  Let's start with the service.  The people working here are stellar!!  Super friendly, engaging, willing to answer questions and just humor me at times.  Seriously, they are fantastic.  They have a great happy hour with discounts on food and beverages.  $10 off bottles and I believe $20 off Champagne (sign me up!).  Also beer and other specials on drinks.  The bar is fully stocked, but the focus is more on your whisky (whiskey).  A great list of specialty drinks lines the menu and the bartenders are easily able to deviate from that list and make the drink you want.    They have a pretty solid food menu with the focus being on seafood.  Oysters are the big seller here and what they are known for.  We decided to have the cornbread and some friend gator bites.  I think the cornbread was some of the tastiest I have ever had, except for maybe a visit to an establishment in New Orleans.  So delicious.  The gator bites are good as well, nice crunch and not overly chewy.  This is definitely a nice addition to East Liberty and a place I will likely visit again.  Give it a shot, you will not be disappointed!

-Ql0G37UUW32OgRKScHP1Q.text: The restaurant itself is pretty small and cozy. We started by getting drinks at the bar while we waited a few minutes for our table. We ordered a bunch of appetizers, a lobster roll, and a po boy to share amongst 4 people. The chargrilled oysters were amazing! I will definitely go back and try their happy hour!

5X2Vg8cASWp6fBzkZ2u-9g.text: I love oysters, so why I ordered the Lobster Eggs Benedict, I'll never know. But then again, who can say "no" to LOBSTER EGGS BENEDICT? The Sunday Brunch Bunch arrived at Muddy Waters one lovely Sunday afternoon in East Liberty. Though the hostess discovered a mistake with our reservation, our server made it up to us with a complimentary serving of beignets all around. The beignets were good. The Lobster Benedict was good. The atmosphere was good. While nothing fell under the "great" category, MW is a fine restaurant with an interesting menu. Try it out, but bring your pocket book (my brunch came in around ~$30 - ouch).

bxudKhRvIxsVRehQeUgZIg.text: A great spot for oysters and new Orleans fare. My wife and I enjoyed a east coast mix of oyters, soft she'll poboy, and crawfish boil. As well as a nice bottle of rose.

yhX5IjHrjNUHcXlIZs0WDg.text: I enjoyed my trip to muddy waters oyster bar. My friend and I came for happy hour and sat at the bar. The bartenders were friendly and it was fun watching them prepare the oysters. Unfortunately we didn't stay for dinner but we're still hungry after each having a few oysters.

P7GyLphVlGy2OBz2ITKe5A.text: I visited Muddy Waters Thurs. of the week before last for HH.  I'd been wanting to check it out for awhile, but wasn't sure which of my friends enjoy--or would be willing to try--oysters.  Given that Chelsea S. and I wanted to get together for HH, I suggested it.  Fortunately, she was game, so we headed over to check it out.  We ordered a half dozen each of two different types of Oysters--West Coast and East Coast.  At HH, oysters are discounted at $1 each for West Coast and $2 each for East Coast, but you have to order them by the half dozen to receive the discount.  Between the two of us, we polished off a dozen quite easily.  We started with the West Coast oysters, which were a variety from WA, and they were mild and creamy, as good West Coast oysters should be.  We then proceeded to the East Coast variety, which were from VA, and they were brinier and chewier, but still delicious.  I tried the one of each type unadorned, and both were definitely enjoyable in that form.  However, they were improved by the tangy and slightly spicy mignonette sauce that came with them, so I added a helping of this to all subsequent bivalves.  As a Cajun/Creole themed bar, Muddy Waters specializes in drinks with New Orleans roots.  Accordingly, I ordered a Ramos Gin Fizz and Chelsea ordered a French 75 ($10 each).  This was my first gin fizz, and I can definitely call myself a fan!  Due to the inclusion of beaten egg whites, it had a light, airy, and foamy head which gave way upon imbibing to a refreshingly tart liquid body.  It had a nice alcoholic kick which was muted by the lemon and foam, making for a well-balanced drink.  While I didn't try Chelsea's French 75, I could tell that she enjoyed it.  Although we didn't have a reservation, we were able to get seated without a problem at the oyster bar, where we were able to watch the employees shuck oysters.  Service from our waiter was cordial, which was also nice.  Overall, we very much enjoyed our HH experience at Muddy Waters, and would definitely return!

Hh0ne3O9D43SXSHnklFu6Q.text: Outstanding! Impeccably fresh east and west coast oysters, hip not pretentious vibe, busy but unhurried. Fun meet-up spot for a small group. Reservation recommended, metered parking on Baum.

tVvtm06tEuYC1yB-YRDg8w.text: I came here expecting a delicious oyster meal with my friends after a long day. I am allergic to oysters, and these oysters set off my allergic reaction for some reason. I am very upset. I will not visit this again. Do not go if you are allergic to oyster. The atmosphere and staff was nice so they earned an extra star.

QnHGiaMl952vvFCOb6FFIw.text: Love this place.  Everything about it.  The ambience, the food, knowledgeable and competent wait staff.  If I was independently wealthy I'd just camp out in the restaurant and write the great american novel while drinking prosecco and slurping oysters.  But I'm not.  So I just come here every couple months.  You're going to have to wait about 15 years for that novel at this point.  I always get the sampler...east coast/west coast.  Great date venue if your date is fun.  Not as great if your date is a dud.  Dump the dud, get a fun date and come back.

UUVzkTwBhBK9oEF-LBlitQ.text: Went here for brunch with the hubby and an out of town friend as well as the little one who slept in his car seat for most of the meal.   I got a bloody mary and I was really impressed with the selection of hot sauces and garnishes at their bloody mary bar. The whole oysters,  shrimp,  bacon, and stuffed cherry peppers where especially delicious!   For my entree I ordered the lobster Benedict and it was insanely delicious. I really liked the biscuit,  ham,  and huge pieces of lobster. The crawfish hollandaise was delicious and the exact right consistency(I could have used a bit more, but that's more of a gluttonous desire) and the egg was perfectly poached.   My husband ordered the gumbo and our guest ordered the special which was a fried oyster omelet with chiccharon and a side of andouille sausage. When my husband heard chiccharon he requested a side if the kitchen could accommodate, and they brought out a small fry basket full of them. It was nice to see a kitchen willing to accommodate crazy requests and at a reasonable price.   Everything was delicious and fresh. We loved it and can't wait to head back there for a happy hour at some point.

-JkwfaMyVy7ES6r-8DUzRg.text: This is my second time visiting Muddy Waters and it's quite normal to average food. Their charred oysters are palatable and the hot fried chicken is juicy but needs proper seasoning to be edible. The collard greens are salty and the grits are grainy. Maybe I'm a New Yorker with a sense of flavor but I would love to see small businesses thrive, please do better. HOWEVER, They do have the best sweet potato cornbread in the Burgh, texture and taste is delicious. Don't touch the CB.

9ywDglpyBQfs6klj2A6lMg.text: My boyfriend and I decided to check Muddy Waters out on a whim one day for drinks and appetizers and it's our new favorite place! Everything we've had has been amazing so far. For our first visit, we had hush puppies and the oyster appetizer, which was awesome.  We went for our second time last night and were officially sold. We tested out four different raw oyster options and the fried green tomatoes. I got the shrimp and grits and he got the seafood gumbo. All amazing!  Not only is the food great, but so is the service/atmosphere. Our server, Nia, really made our dinner memorable and sealed the deal for us. We were originally seated next to a boisterous group of guys that were being pretty loud, and without even having to ask, she offered to move use to a better location. She was super helpful in explaining the oyster options to us, and gave us a ton of great information on their happy hours and brunch options! It was cool to learn how the oysters are brought into the restaurant, and that they have their own oyster farm in Virginia. She also recommended their delicious sour beer collaboration with cellar works.  Anyway, we love it! Great food, great team, great place :) Thank you!

EexWB4D-1EZcDb8F8M4tKg.text: Third time here. Never disappointed.  Oysters are fresh and tasty. Raw and grilled are both good. I've never tried other oyster bars in town so no comparison in town. But I saw almost every tables ordered one to share so shouldn't be disappointing to more experienced tastebuds.  Tonight we had a group dinner of five. Thursday evening not too busy and we've got seated quickly. I've tried the gator jumbo with a spring salad this time. Jumbo is tasty with very substantial chunks of meat. Spring salad is heavy on creamy dressing, so if you're looking for a light salad maybe gets the dressing on the side.  I also tried their banana pudding once. It was very impressive. Not your ordinary pudding but more like a cake. Dense, moist, and you can taste the real banana. A must have if you love banana.

gSLDOqAO8UbicJcxO65-tw.text: I love Muddy Water's atmosphere and attractive staff members. It's very intimate with its dim lighting however, it also manages to be lively. My favorite dish here is the deviled eggs. Definitely a go-to whenever I am doing the Keto diet. I stopped by here last weekend just for a quick bite. A friend and I decided to order the cornbread and gator bites along with Mexican got chocolate spiked with tequila.   The cornbread came out in two large wedges. The cornbread wasn't so sweet but also wasn't soggy. It had a good flake however, the butter that came with it was a little underwhelming for me. The dish had a good taste however, was not worth $9 and did not taste as good as it looked on the menu.   The gator bites were tasty, fried to perfection and the alligator inside was moist and tender. The Mexican hot chocolate was not good. I was able to drink it however, the tequila overpowered every other flavor.
