urMWVifOU54OIEHRiPWnGg.text: Really obnoxious restaurant.  Twice I have gone here without reservations and 50% of the tables are open. They will not seat because they are "booked" but 30 minutes later I walk by and those tables are still empty.  I also walk by here at primetime maybe 3 or 4 times a week and I have never seen it full.  The owners should probably fire whoever works the front.  You've turned away a lot of business to create the atmosphere that you're always busy.  I live right there and would go all the time.  But I'll never go back, fake busy for res only is one of my biggest restaurant pet peeves.

RhsA9GbqbnGfOApyF8_ORA.text: Pittsburgh did not disappoint with their amazing restaurants! Found this place on Yelp and made reservations for brunch 2 weeks in advance. The interior is very clean and bright. Our waiter was super friendly and attentive. I ordered a Mimosa (3/5 standard OJ Mimosa but it was straight up juice), while my other 2 friends ordered from the DIY Bloody Mary Bar (5/5 menu says the price starts at $8- the price depends on what type of vodka you ask for and there are a lot of great toppings to choose from including raw oysters, shrimp, bacon etc.) We also ordered a couple of Oyster Shooters (5/5 standard but delicious).  For my entree, I decided to order 2 things off of the 'Pre-Gamers' in order to try more things. I ordered the Fried Boudin Balls (3/5 the pork sausage balls came apart very easily and I didn't love the flavors), and the Gator & Sausage Gumbo (4/5 tasty gumbo, especially the alligator meat and a decent portion for $9). My friends ordered the Seafood Gumbo (4/5 honestly if you want to try the gumbo but not order the entree portion I suggest ordering the appetizer gumbo. Pretty much the same thing except the entree has more seafood/different kinds of seafood), and my other friend ordered the Louisiana Lobster Roll (4/5 both the meat and the roll were way too buttery but otherwise delicious).  NOTE: my friends and I wanted to order the raw oyster with uni on top but apparently this was a 'special/seasonal oyster' that they offered a while ago/don't offer it anymore.

xDC-uuYe5G4Z5dYZKPLHSw.text: My friend and I came here the other day for their Happy Hour. We've both been here other times but I would say this one was the most memorable. Maybe it was the Don Wayne talking (a "tiki" style drink? uhm yes PLEASE), but the oysters tasted fresh and were so easy to eat one after the other. Before we knew it, the tasting platter we got, which included a selection of east coast and west coast oysters, was gone. To be honest, my palate is not refined enough to tell a difference between the two coastal oysters. We were still a bit hungry afterwards so we ended up ordering from the Happy Hour menu and got a dozen more of the east coast oysters (**Side note: during Happy Hour, east coast oysters are $1 each and west coast oysters are $2 BUT you have to order them in batches of 6, so either half a dozen, dozen, etc). A woman sitting next to us at the bar ordered some fries which smelled HEAVENLY, so of course we had to get some with the Cajun spice. No regrets. What topped off this whole experience was that we got an entire beignet dessert from the table behind us since they were too full to finish and didn't want it to go to waste. Well, to the kind couple that sent us that delicious plate of beignets, it did not go to waste. I will definitely come back again when I am craving oysters.

photos.caption: Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Oyster Tasting

3lf9co1SfgdZcoZigWzMaA.text: Amazing amazing amazing!!  I love shell fish since I grew up in a fishing town, and Muddh Waters shucks those oysters right!  Their happy hour deals are unbeatable and a great way to get friends together to try some shell fish.   Their drinks menu is also super impressive and delicious with something for every palate.  I have to say the rest of their menu is also as impressive as their signature oysters. Hot dishes go past me and I always wish I could order more!  Go any time and you won't be disappointed!

ySia2jDeSAVrmszFKV9_9A.text: Very friendly staff. Atmosphere is nice. Small place, close quarters which adds to the intimate feel. Went for oysters which were fresh when raw. Presentation typical for oysters. Bar good selection. Service average speed. No one is rushing you here. We talked for several hours. Went with my daughter and her husband. Excellent experience over. Prices are average for oysters about $1.50 per.  I don't comment much on menu, you can look this up for most restaurants and make up your mind everybody's taste are different . If a restaurant does not post their menu online this is not a good sign.

Z6QR3djJBAPm-W2zlF22cA.text: Very fresh oysters and extremely friendly waitress. I ordered 3 dozens of featured, a soft crab sandwich (), blackened salmon (), fried alligator, smoked boudin, and a cold lobster tail.  Service is 5 stars. Food is 4.5 and it's super fresh. I like the fried food especially because it's really light. Almost like tempura kind of lightness.  It's muddy good to drop by if you are in Pittsburg!

qeqSgYqFp3DWtpHZQgPpug.text: I had my New Years Eve dinner at Muddy Waters with two friends. I really enjoyed the casual, upbeat atmosphere from the instant I walked in the door. There were mounted alligator heads on the walls (fake I hope) and a long bar to illustrate that this is truly an "oyster bar".  My dining companions and I settled into a booth and ordered the hush puppies to start. They were some of the biggest hush puppies I have ever had! And very flavorful, arriving to our table hot and steaming with a creamy sauce for dipping.  For dinner I had the Louisiana Lobster Roll which was incredibly impressive. The roll was about the size of a hot dog bun (one of excellent quality) and it was stuffed with lobster--completely stuffed! Absolutely no filler to be found, and the meat was completely drenched in butter. I was not at all disappointed.  My boyfriend ordered the shrimp po' boy, and the bite I was able to steal was flavorful and the shrimp was very fresh. I would've liked a bit more slaw or something to cut through the rich sauce, but that's just me.   I will definitely be visiting Muddy Waters again, but next time I'll try some oysters!

fjnuLhv1lIG31w_S8wUEvQ.text: Sweet Baby Jesus!!! My brother and I put the hurt on the menu a little while back. This place is great! If you yearn for a little taste of the bayou, and love a relaxed atmosphere with good service, this place is your thing.  We did it all - oyster platters x 2, hush puppies, foie gras deviled eggs (MUST HAVE), po' boy, shrimp and grits, you name it, they got it. It was yummy.  Nice drink list - their Sazerac was pretty tasty, and it had better be; It's NOLA's official cocktail. Service was very attentive, and all of the staff were friendly and knowledgeable about their menu. Music was a tad louder than I'd like, but that's probably just me as I turn into my own grandfather... overall, a great place for good friends and family to sit down, relax, and chow down on some really fun Louisiana staples. Laissez les bons temps rouler!!

Nn0b_An9bQI-ADaF0XEB4g.text: Big big fan.   Such an intimate place with great service. Very knowledgeable and happy to help you if it is your first time trying oysters. The other food is great NOLA style soul dishes.  Probably the best hush puppies I have ever had. Can't wait to come back for more, definitely want to try their brunch.

e14iMp2Z8b6iPkobUSe0KA.text: Stopped here for brunch during my free time from a work trip. I started with a virgin bloody mary which is half off without alchole. They had a huge area to make your own and everything and I mean everything was there including any pickle you could think of. Also was bacon, shrimp and oysters. For food I got 4 oysters two from the west coast and 2 from the east. I am a osyster novice so was suprised it wasnt served with horseraidish but with a house sauce and in a drop bottle the spicer version. It wasnt bad and all the oysters were yummy. I also got the New England lobster roll which was filled with lobster and crawfish covered with butter, also the cajun fries. Fries were a suprise hit very tasty and really makes the meal.

cmO3MgJ_vyrBiY--2sK0Ig.text: Low quality food and server acted as if he could not pause to talk to us. Don't waste money ubering there like I did.

ABvsoLoxd8ozWw2eT1-XDA.text: If you are looking for oysters in the Burgh, look no further than Muddy Waters.  Especially if you want to indulge in several varieties.  Now coming here during their happy hour can help keep your bill light, however if you are like me, one dozen oysters just aren't enough, so even at the great price they can add up quick!  The happy hour is awesome though.  Select West and East Coast varieties ranging from 1-2 dollars.  The west coast ones will run a tad higher at the $2.00 price tag but the sweetness of the oysters make them so, so worth the extra buck.  The east coast varieties tended to be more briny but all is good and they pack a delicious flavor.    We've been here a few times now, but showing up during the happy hour is the best time to come.  We have also had several of their craft cocktails which are quite good.  The beer list is limited but sufficient and Happy Hour deals on champagne.  We have tried other items off the menu but it's the oysters that keeps us coming back for more.

photos.caption: Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

NCGlT4p4rGHjmKVnnNtDPw.text: Updating review based on brunch experience.   Bloody Mary bar, $8  Insane toppings  Oysters too!  I made a reservation through yelp, I'm glad I did! We were greeted and immediately seated.   My lobster Benny was made to order, I omitted the ham and requested asparagus which was no biggie.  Thanks for another great experience! Highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lobster Eggs Benedict (5 star)
Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. BBQ Shrimp &amp; Grits
Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bloody Mary bar

b-yIB6-VyBToOPVEQHaZug.text: After discovering my love for oysters and Cajun food in the Big Easy I knew I needed to try this place out. I've had oysters at a few other places in the city and they just don't compare to the ones you get in Nola. So I had given up on ordering oysters in Pittsburgh until I heard about Muddy Waters. I was very excited to try this place out and it lived up to all the hype! If you are looking for oysters in Pittsburgh, you MUST come to Muddy Waters...best in the city for sure!   My boyfriend and I made a reservation and arrived early so we sat at the bar and ordered some drinks. The drinks (Lavender Bees Knees and New Fashioned) were great as was the service at the bar so when our table was ready we opted to just stay and eat at the bar. I def recommend making a reservation though because it's not very big. They also had live jazz music which was pretty cool.  We ordered the chargrilled oysters and they were so delicious we had to get another order! I wanted to order everything on the menu but had to control myself. So after the oysters, we went with the fried green tomatoes which in my opinion was a no brained because not many restaurants have them. Oh and did I mention they come with pimento cheese?! Pimento cheese is also hard to come by and a favorite of mine...tomatoes were absolutely delicious and crisp to perfection. A very filing small plate too. After that we ordered the sausage and gator gumbo and corn bread. The gumbo was amazing, very tasty. I'd say prob the best gumbo you're gonna get in the city. Cornbread was also good but I was not amazed by it. It was a little dry, but I'm a cornbread lover so it was a must try and I'd prob get it again. We did not get dessert and I regret it because the beignets looked amazing.  All in all, everything from the food, drinks, atmosphere, service was wonderful and a great experience. I did not get to try everything I wanted so I will absolutely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fried Green Tomatoes
Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cornbread &amp; Sausage and Gator Gumbo
Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lavender Bees Knees &amp; New Fashioned

uPlDAZ05dcnKAsxF8zwpEQ.text: Great casual atmosphere mixed with sophisticated fare. They have great happy hour oysters; $1 for east coast and $2 for west coast; I believe they had two or three choices of each for happy hour. Drinks were good with a full bar and signature cocktails and dessert cocktails. Appetizers are also good including hush puppies and foie gras deviled eggs that look like a work of art. Po boys also good with cajun fries!

photos.caption: Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Happy Hour Oyster and Cava

OWC8sh9gPJHUcgxJ7q-70A.text: This is our first time ever coming here. We are a couple that moved to PA from New Orleans. So we were very hesitant when we saw Cajun food on the menu. I am very happy to say that not only did they nail the food, the atmosphere is perfect. We will def come back on a routine basis to get our 'food fix'

FVbYejkP3Rdk_iHTDihdIw.text: The menu is a bit on the smaller side, and not very easy for vegetarian friends to find something. However, the appetizers were great and fairly priced. The lobster sandwich was fresh and filled with big chunks of lobster. A bit plain tasting but good seafood for a city  not near the sea! Fries were seasoned perfectly

photos.caption: Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lobster sandwich and fries

Sip91OSXiE472BzrafA-eQ.text: Best seafood sandwich ever. The crab meat and lobster meat was amazing. The late night hours are convenient, and the ambiance with the open garage door concept is unique. Excited to return.

LU0xBFdXxNLIuOXKvrJtgA.text: Good casual atmosphere, great staff.  Food is always good.  Ask for the fried pork rinds (an off menu item outside of happy hour).  Unlike most local places serving oysters, MW does enough volume to maintain quality and freshness.

dIkQ6Ra2hXbFTyEet1rNOg.text: This is a pretty good place to hang out with your friends or a date. They have a good list of beers and spirits to waste the night away, pair with some fresh oysters. I have been to a few oysters bars and the quality of this place is up there, reason for 4* is because of the price. I guess happy hour with $2-$3/oyster is more reasonable than the regular menu price.  We had the mixed appetizer with 4 oysters, half crab salad, 3 cocktail shrimp, and a lobster tail for $37. Also we tried the pork rinds ($4), which is also very good and crunchy, great with beers . Main course I had the 14 oz NY strip. The seasoning is a little salty for my taste but the steak was tender and juicy even though i ordered well done. Overall i would come back try out some other item on the menu. The food is good enough and the service was very friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

VWDHEp2UIeI-bPPltWXVDg.text: I really like oysters. I wanted them for lunch but this place didn't open until 430. I made a reservation just in case. The Happy Hour was very oyster centric. The drinks were tasty but lightly poured so no worries if you order a couple. I had the smoke break and the New fashioned. If you like boozy the New fashioned is your best bet. The fried green tomatoes were perfect just the right amount of cornmeal breading. The hush puppies were also good. The smoked Lamb ribs were a tossup. The flavor profile was amazing but they can be a little fatty. The seafood gumbo was good but lacked real spice. There was a minor upset at the beginning regarding seating... The hostess worked it out but asked that we leave the table by 630. We got there at 5 so it seems odd they would leave that table empty for 90 minutes? Place gets really noisy as it fills up so be prepared for that. I would do it again but it would fall behind some other eatieries locally.

_gqJ3sSg_qMdym5fvwHfMQ.text: Went here for brunch on Saturday with the wife. Dollar oysters are served until 1pm, and the Delaware Bay oysters were so good we ended up getting another dozen. Very clean, meaty, and sweet taste.   The bahn mi po boy was excellent, with shrimp that were cooked just right and a creamy but not overpowering pate. The cleverest part is the Thai basil, which adds a unique flavor and aroma.  The seafood gumbo was recommended by our waiter, and I'm glad I listened to him. The shrimp, crayfish, catfish, and sausage had good flavor and excellent texture, and the brown gumbo base was perfect for dipping the provided baguette.  Certainly one of the better meals I've had in Pittsburgh, and a great value if you're craving oysters.

RIRFEixf0ODxDLpt6azh_Q.text: I've been here several times since my last visit and I really like this place. Came for brunch today and was surprised that they have happy hour Saturday morning! They offer $10 off bubbles!! $1-$2 oysters! This trip along with my oysters I had the hush puppies and wedge salad. The only thing I would change about there menu is to offer more things without pork in it. A lot of their items have bacon or sausage in it that you can't take out. I know I'm in the minority on this but hey, I'm just saying!

photos.caption: Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

kjxZZw7-MrgXR4HSUBDhcg.text: Great Experience!! If you like oysters, try theirs. They were full of flavor. I even enjoyed the salad and cocktail I had.

dv5fy6CavIjo0ebpHNA0oA.text: This place has good rating on Yelp and I decided to try. I liked the hush puppies and the fried green tomatoes which were highly recommended on Yelp. I also ordered cat fish item which is unfortunately very salty for my taste. Next time, I would rather stick with the popular items to experience the best!   The service was good. The place looked different and interesting with oyster bar. I was afraid to try oyesters since I didn't know if I am allergic to that or not. Next time, I am going to try oysters and update my review.

Fk7rwwgcf9Znk3924ptDHA.text: This place is an absolute favoritism, everything from the ambience, decor  is modern transitional style. They ouster flight  was nice, defiantly placed 2 favorites for the next time around. Unlike wine, every oyster tastes distinct even after a dozen down, unlike red wine where 3 glasses and you don't know whether you're drinking moonshine or what! Only reason I don't give 5 stars is because the shucking was improper, my wife got shells twice in her share.

A7jv9xkbSHhROxs5-GBGEw.text: I've been back twice now since my first experience, both times for brunch.  The first time was in early December for my dad's birthday and the second time was this past Saturday with my girlfriends.  The seating situation has improved and I was able to get reservations, though neither time it was very busy to the point where I actually needed them.  Their brunch menu is nice because it has the breakfast items and then the sandwiches and a few other more lunch-type dishes.  I have tried their poutine fries, sweet potato cornbread, bbq pork benedict (winter special, maybe?), lobster benedict, chicken and biscuits, bahn mi shrimp poboy, plus a couple of oysters.  Everything has been delicious.  They have a large bloody mary bar set up in the middle of the restaurant and you can choose what type of infused vodka you want as the base - which is an awesome touch.  Our service was much better the second time, but the third time was just OK.  Our server was very nice, but we sat at the oyster bar (as they weren't accepting reservations or putting together larger tables due to an oyster class coming in at 2pm) and I think the people behind the counter/hostess were annoyed.  All in all, though, far better experiences than when I came here for dinner a year ago.  Definitely check it out.

idfwNFi4hMzgp3K6YRll6w.text: Favorite place!!!! Great food and service. Fresh drinks and oysters. I go at least once a week because of the atmosphere and everything listed above. Must try!!!!

unErG8qyQl4ZnfQN1heuDA.text: One of my favorite places in Pittsburgh! They have a great selection of oysters and their other food is amazing. The ambiance is perfect, too. Definitely check it out.

HbM5Xot2ZwpfnCgltmq7BQ.text: Great experience! Atmosphere was awesome, food was amazing and definitely had a Cajun taste! Definitely will be going back.

7-Tny4hoWGPEI6ZyqzWOMA.text: I was here over the summer, and had the most amazing appetizers. The wait staff were really nice, and explained the different sauces, which was great. I'm not sure if they're still open :( I hope so.

gLF-UlDrGZXTHEzKjTFDtw.text: Oh my goodness! I am so happy to finally get to try this place. I've heard so many good things about this place prior to coming here. After coming here, I can definitely see what the hype is all about.  My boyfriend is a big fan of Cajun/ creole food, so I figured I would take him out for dinner here. Mmm we both LOVE it! I've driven on highland so often but I've never noticed this place being here, it is kind of hidden. The atmosphere here is great and intimate. Perfect for a date night! I would say it is a pretty small place, so I would definitely recommend a reservation in advance. We came here without one and did not get seating, but we don't mind sitting at the bar :)  It is pretty cool watching the staff making the oysters.  For food, we ordered hush puppies, lobster roll, and seafood gumbo. AMAAZING! We pretty much cleared the plates in less than ten minutes. I love the little kicks to the seafood gumbo. It is probably my favorite. The lobster roll is so fresh, also the fries that came with it is so well seasoned. The hush puppies is so flavorful, we are def big fans of these.  The price is a little higher than my normal going out dinner. (Broke graduate student.. ya know?) However, after trying their food, I would say without a doubt worth every penny. I would def come here again, maybe for a special occasion.

photos.caption: Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Seafood gumbo ayyyyy :)
Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lobster roll
Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Hush puppies .. and my boyfriends tongue LOL

4cf0_1uFLd7EvCaVVwgxeQ.text: The best oyster place in town I love going here everything is fresh the happy hour special is unbeatable

avfA9ExHQw5ADHClYXHduw.text: I'm from out of town and Im super happy with finding this oyster bar in Pittsburgh. Has a great vibe and great food! Kieran made my drinks perfect and even created a new one to my liking. Definitely recommend to come here and enjoy some oysters and cocktails.

photos.caption: Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Clover club with blackberries made by Kieran the drinks and food are amazing here!

k7yeVwUTeyJ6KAxEjNxbKA.text: Muddy Waters is from Chicago and not one deep dish pizza is to be found here. I liked everything and ate everything all the same. But I was sincerely craving an oyster deep dish pizza, as is obviously promised by naming an oyster place Muddy Waters, who once again is from Chicago, and furthermore is the father of the Chicago Blues and not in any way associated with New Orleans.

8cAFKlWUbcOM2arfbEJQmg.text: The service was awesome! The food was just ok, except for the oysters (raw and fried), which were phenomenal!

KgOyNgB5XlzJQ_kuuTzZvA.text: The oysters here are so fresh.  My husband gets their lobster roll every time.  I have had the hot chicken and shrimp and grits.  It was all delicious!

N-0IEFJKb94VS8NM3q6-1Q.text: Outstanding Cajun restaurant. One of the best Cajun restaurants I've been to anywhere in the US including New Orleans. They have a nice variety of oysters from both the west and east coasts. Outstanding selection of whiskeys.   My fiancee had the lobster and crawfish sandwich. It was served on a buttered pretzel bun. It had a flavorful Cajun seasoning.   I was torn between a few options but decided on the shrimp and grits. I think anything on the menu would have been fantastic. They grits were super flavorful in a Cajun broth yet still a little creamy. The jumbo shrimp were perfectly cooked. They were white and tender with a little bit of clearness that you see in raw shrimp. The grits had peppers, caramelized onions, pork bits, green onions, and a couple of raw tomato slices on top. Great balance of textures with the softness of the caramelized veggies, the creaminess of the grits, the snap of the shrimp, and the crispness of the raw tomatoes.  We shared the beignets with chocolate sauce for dessert. I'd recommend those too even if you're not a huge dessert fan. During the night, they had a live performance from a small three person group. They created a fun atmosphere with their bluesy yet upbeat music.

BmsRy3RxucdoomlpNOXiJQ.text: I highly recommend going to Muddy Waters's happy hour. The food is good and the price is cheap. Do I need to say more?   Food and Drink Ordered:  * worth trying  - [Oysters at happy hour*] : I would recommend getting a mix of East Coast and West Coast oysters because both types have different flavor profiles and the vinegar that the oysters come with is divine.     - [Fried Alligator*] : It reminds me of a combination of fish and chicken   - [Deviled Eggs*] : I love deviled eggs so of course I would recommend this. And they're definitely better than your run-of-the-mill deviled eggs. The sweet pickles were a nice addition.  Would I go back? : Without a doubt. My friends and I even had a hard time choosing what to order because everything looked like it would taste really good and what we ended up choosing did not disappoint either.

photos.caption: Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Better than your average deviled eggs
Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Get a mix of East Coast and West Coast

SuJNjeMZQOGonFjx4r8w6g.text: *HIGHLY RECOMMEND*  Who would've thought that Pittsburgh can have such FRESH oysters?!!!! My friends and I went during their happy hour time, which is basically most weekday from 4pm-6pm. Oysters were ONLY $1 or $2 depending on where it's from (East coast, West cost, the bay, etc). Everyday there will only be a certain selection of oysters to pick from, so you can go a different day and get to try new ones. Forewarning, you must order oyster in a set of 6 and that set of six must be from the same area and coast cannot be mixed. But, that was no problem because they were worth!!! And it was fairly cheap!   Oysters: We basically tried all the different kinds of oysters that were available that day. I cannot recall all the names but the Delaware Bay was my favorite. The lemon and the vinegar provided gave the oysters a bit of a kick, but it was good even without the condiments. It was so so fresh and smooth! It melted in my mouth.   Fried Green Tomatoes: I've never had fried green tomatoes but they were good. Crispy on the outside, tender on the inside. The sauce reminds me of spicy mayo.  Pork Rinds: I've never had pork rinds before either. It was more dense than I though but the seasoning was very flavorful. Very crunchy but at times it keeps sticking to my teeth.   **VERDICT:  Would I go back again? YESSSSSSSS, just for the oysters.

photos.caption: Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. SO FRESH!!!

e7viMKufx-YieDU6N2aP7w.text: Small restaurant located in east liberty.   They serve Cajun comfort food. The food reminded me of New Orleans and so does the restaurant.   We ordered the lobster Benedict and it was absolutely delicious. You could taste the butter and garlic. There was also plenty of lobster. The portion is huge and we loved every bite.

photos.caption: Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lobster Eggs Benedict

zYdFt7FjXsq3VVEBSzN-Vg.text: I'd say the food anh drinks are pretty good, although the price is sky high. Definitely will only come when I have a cravings for oysters.

TGnBWjbbKo7nl60Bukhkbw.text: I was craving for oysters after my NOLA trip. Muddy waters oysters is pretty much the only place in Pittsburgh that serves Chargrilled oysters so I was very excited.   The service was great. Our waitress is very fast and attentive.  Food is just okay. I got the Bayford which is $1 per oyster. There is nothing special about it. It doesnt have the firm texture and more toward salty taste. So if that is something you like then I recommend to get it. Chargrilled oysters is also just okay.  Cocktails on HH is $6 which is a good deal. Maybe I should have read the description more carefully when I saw hurricane and I thought it would be similar to hurricane drink in NOLA, but it was completely different. It was good but a little bit water down in my opinion.  I would go back again for happy hours.

photos.caption: Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Raw Oysters
Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chargrilled Oysters

cMs4YpzAo6wrlUPXgyzbgg.text: YES! The smell that hit me in the face as soon as I walked in was an instant indicator that we picked the right spot for brunch. Everything following that first impression was additional reassurance - a super warm greeting, an enormously long build your own Bloody Mary bar, an amazing menu for drinks and food, all the right music, and man...the food! I would absolutely recommend and hope to go again soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

bRg3jzV69e8L3ZXnW0Slyw.text: My boyfriend and I have been here too many times to count now. (Definitely "regular" status!) I recommend following them on Instagram to hear about specials and ticketed events in advance. We've enjoyed a pig roast, crawfish boils, and several varieties of premium oysters they've made available. Service is always friendly and attentive (they're great about food allergies) and the atmosphere is super relaxing. It's our go-to spot whenever we have out of town guests. Takeout is also a breeze, and we frequently call in an order of their delicious jambalaya with chicken and shrimp after a long day at work.   Recently we've been coming here for brunch, and I really like the variety of options they offer. Brunch is Saturday and Sunday and there's a great Bloody Mary bar, brunch punch, and many Louisiana-style takes on breakfast dishes as well as favorites from their standard menu. In short, Muddy Waters is an all-around fantastic restaurant, and I know I'll be a devoted fan as long as they're a part of the Pittsburgh restaurant scene.

VF-LU55Myftii9OKbCM6yg.text: Who would've thought Pittsburgh offered amazing seafood. This place was yummy. Oysters were from East and West and all were equally high quality and delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Oysters- chargrilled and raw
Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Louisiana Lobster Roll

qFgybN6PXtIcNkl4OS8-4Q.text: Have been wanting to try this place for a while. Came here recently on a weeknight and they had the front windows open which was nice. I had the Louisiana lobster roll and my friend had the Nashville hot chicken. The lobster roll was delicious and buttery, but I honestly would have preferred it to just be lobster and not combined with crawfish. My friend enjoyed her hot chicken and it was a huge serving! Overall, enjoyed my food and would want to come back to try brunch!

photos.caption: Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Louisiana Lobster Roll with Fried Chicken and Biscuits in back
Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Louisiana Lobster Roll

awr6EiXSypcsgVCbP1VXdw.text: I've been to New Orleans 4 times and have become quite the lover of all things Cajun, especially oysters. And good oysters are hard to come by in Pittsburgh.... until you go to Muddy Waters!  I can only speak for the oysters because that's all I ordered, but they were fantastic!! The chargrilled oysters were SO GOOD. you must order them!! The raw oysters were delicious as well....  cool clean space and great service. I will def be back so I can try the rest of the menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chargrilled oysters

XjkKPwKuWwxjDQY_hsR_zQ.text: Very cool little bar! Was visiting my sister in Pittsburgh and wanting to try this place after walking by and getting a whiff of the enticing aroma of oysters on the half shell. We decided to head in for brunch on Saturday and were very happy that we did! At just after noon, the place was hopping but we were able to find seats at the bar. Brunch happy hour included oysters for as cheap as $1 each, which we were thrilled to see! Menu also included a variety of fun cocktails, craft beers, and wines. They also boast a good variety of apps and entrees, many with a Cajun/New Orleans twist.   We decided that the sweet potato cornbread would be a good balance to our 18 $1 each oysters, and ended up being right. The oysters were very nice quality for the price, and the sweet potato cornbread was served with a sweet maple drizzle and savory whipped butter that we couldn't get enough of. Service was attentive given how busy the place was and we were impressed with the hard work of the staff. Would definitely recommend the place for anyone into seafood or Cajun fare, or looking for a fun place to go with friends or a date (especially during happy hour, given the affordability!).

photos.caption: Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. 18 $1 oysters for Saturday brunch happy hour!

2L6iTGVQHmF1zBNkvfUH1w.text: When we lived in Shadyside we used to walk here all the time to grab brunch or happy hour and food. Good happy hour deals, especially those oysters. The brunch is really good and you can't go wrong for the most part. We always end up ordering the fried green tomatoes with pimento cheese dip. The burger is outstanding. Diner style, double thin patties. Just outstanding.

ftp8hvaBQCkSJ8qmpCXRjw.text: You must try the fried fish appetizer. It was the best thing, absolutely delicious. We got the oyster sampler and I have to say the west coast oysters don't have that strong if a taste and it is more delicate. The east coast oysters are bigger and stronger in flavor. I also liked the cooked oysters. They were seasoned really well. I would recommend those if you do not eat raw food.   I made a reservation so there was no wait either. I would definitely come back here whenever people want to try oysters!

photos.caption: Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. cooked oysters yum!!!
Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

OOW4QoyfrjiC9HkwshPcLg.text: I have long awaited trying Muddy Waters and it was worth every ounce of anticipation!   I stopped in here on a Saturday night around 5:30 and was lucky enough to score three seats at the bar, but they were packed and I would definitely recommend usually making a reservation!   I can't say enough about the food or the service. We had two wonderful bartenders who were extremely friendly and kept our glasses of bubbly flowing all night as we worked our way through the menu. We tried the east/west oyster platter, the Bloody Mary oyster shooter, hush puppies and shrimp cocktail. I can't say enough good things about the oysters and the hush puppies. It truly transported you to a beach town, even on a cold rainy night in Pittsburgh.   I cannot wait to go back and explore more of the meal options. However, I'd want to sit at the bar again for another wonderful experience!

eatXXmXW-bNiJqNuWXGrmg.text: This was my second time here and the oysters are definitely the star of the show!  We had the east coast/west coast sampler.  The platter comes with a red wine mignonette, lemons, hot sauce.  Also included is a seasonal rhubarb mignonette and a ramp cucumber mignonette.  Now doesn't that sound fun?  Every bite can be a delicious combo of flavors enhancing the fresh, well-shucked oysters (no shells in these bites!).  We also had some hush puppies that made you want to slap yo grandma!  Yummmm!  I was skeptical of an oyster bar in PITTSBURGH...I needn't have been.  Some of the best oysters I've had (including along the shore!) Service is also a star here!

photos.caption: Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. East/West Coast sampler!

YmOOgA9gtSdZDWDSS7nPKQ.text: *Only had Drinks*  Came here after dinner to grab drinks at the bar which I heard were good and I was not disappointed. The bartenders tossed around a few suggestions after talking about my tastes. I settled on the O Eireann (Oh Erin) which is a smoke infused whiskey drink prepared by burning hickory chips and letting the whiskey sit in it until the smoke settles. If you are a fan of Smokey drinks then this is for you.  It was pretty close to closing time so there were not a lot of people there so service was quick. Chatted with the bar tender and I nice couple for a while. Everyone was friendly.

nW-Q30zw0kdGJ4r78YpvPw.text: Happy hour here is awesome! I love the chargrilled oysters! They have them on special during happy hour. They also have $1 oysters during happy hour! I have also tried their fried soft shell crab sandy and their shrimp po boy and both were very good! This place also serves Dom Perignon which I find interesting!

nE0PrLvDQ1LSeb74Z0dmhA.text: Very unique menu, absolutely delicious follow through! Cozy setting, with blues playing.  Love this

tCJo50v9nVvGH8_h8MezRA.text: We decided to try this restaurant for a birthday celebration and it did not disappoint. Everything - the food, the service, and the atmosphere, were top notch. The three of us ordered an array of small plates along with a large plate of jambalaya to share. It turned out to be more food than we needed, but it was all so good! We had the chargrilled oysters, which hold their own against the best we've had in NOLA, the succotash, watermelon salad - which came with these absolutely divine little balls of fried goat cheese, and the birthday boy indulged in some fried gator which he pronounced to be out of this world. I'm not a big jambalaya person but it was well spiced like everything else and quite good - not too hot and very flavorful. You can't go wrong here!

hwf0OnJA6yj8YmCmZQkGYw.text: The dollar oysters ($1 east, $2 west) are awesome. I mean seriously, you can get dollar oysters every day of the week for happy hour but Sunday here. How awesome is that? There's even a Double Happy Hour Tuesday nights!!  Anyway we had been here before but this time I decided to review. The Bloody Mary bar is pretty great. Pro tip: start at the end, it's where the oysters, shrimp and bacon are.   We had two dozen oysters (the West Coast Hendersons were fantastic), a Low Country Hash, and a Seafood Gumbo no rice.  The Seafood Gumbo is completely loaded with 10 ounces of seafood. It included crawfish, oysters, shrimp and lobster. It's a dark gumbo, almost mahogany, and very flavorful. I thought it was super legit that they would do it without rice and while the price wasn't cheap, it was fair considering the amount of seafood.   But if you need oysters, just come here. Make it easy on yourself. Can't beat dollar oysters.

photos.caption: Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Oyster Shooter! $4
Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Half and half, East and West ($18)
Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Seafood Gumbo. Spectacular!

ZHPEe6S2zAs6h9895Aqo-Q.text: My husband and I went for dinner on a Saturday night. We sat at the bar right by the oyster station because we were an hour early for our reservation.   We started with the rosemary cornbread and a couple of east coast oysters. The cornbread was a 10/10, served warm with slabs of butter within. The oysters were good too - definitely fresh.  For our mains, we had the seafood gumbo and the oyster Po Boy. Both were decent but nothing the shout about. The Po Boy was a regular Sandwich with tomatoes, iceberg lettuce, mayo and oysters - there could have been more filling in the sandwich. The fries that came with it were way too salty - make sure you tell them less or no salt if you want to be able to finish them. The gumbo was decent with a decent amount of seafood, but not the best you will have, and the portion could have been slightly more generous for a main. The food didn't feel or taste like it was "made with love." Even the ambience and waitstaff were a little cold - not as friendly as I would have liked.   Overall, it was a decent experience, but the only thing we would go back for would be the cornbread and oysters. Service was quick. We were in and out in less than an hour.

9ixst7nLMiMfCVFl0ha25g.text: Very nice restaurant. Loved the variety of dishes. The roasted lamb was superb. Hot chicken was so, so. Seafood gumbo was good but extremely spicy. Whole red snapper was excellent.

vwdA0zX1Eff4e80lH1HwGA.text: Had an awesome experience for dinner a few weeks ago.  Started off with the horseradish hush puppies. There were tasty without being overly horseradish-y. Also got the fried green tomatoes and these were delicious. Crunchy on the outside and soft but not mushy on the inside. My husband got the gumbo which was slightly oversalted which took away from the rest of our excellent meal. I got the fried soft shell crab special with  a salad underneath. This was absolutely delicious! My favorite part was actually the salad as it had some mint and watermelon in it. So refreshing and complemented the crab beautifully. Saw lots of other things on the menu I would want to try. Overall very good and would definitely come back.

ETmspjNvu4EC_co_XhgdkQ.text: Ordered the lobster benedict. The ham was ice cold and gray. 3 of the 4 meals at our table were barely luke warm. Given a free dessert for the cold gray ham. Still charged for the meal. Won't go back.

e8P_m5uNum_vGGXhhACi2Q.text: If I had rated Muddy Waters the first or second time I visited I would have given it 4 or 5 stars. After the 5th or 6th visit, this place feels a little "meh" to me.  My most disappointing food item has been the catfish. I normally LOVE catfish and couldn't even eat more than one small piece. It was dry, chewy, and smelled a little too fishy for my taste. I know I was *literally* eating fish, but the smell was a tad too pungent for me to be comfortable. Even the sauce that came with the catfish didn't make it better for me.  My favorite food item from Muddy Waters doesn't even come from the sea. Their corn bread is the best corn bread I've ever had and it comes with equally wonderful apple butter. The corn bread is made with sweet potato and is perfectly moist and flavorful. I could eat it for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. I wish everything at Muddy Waters was as good as the cornbread, but it isn't. I guess the pimento cheese is also good, but pretty basic pimento cheese dip.  Happy hour is also pretty limited. If you like oysters they are always discounted and have been good during happy hour. The drink specials are not very *special*, but they do have $10 off bubbly deals that make it possible to purchase a decent bottle of sparkling rose for $26.  Overall, you could probably have a good dinner or brunch at Muddy Waters, but it's nothing special. Service is generally good, food has been hit or miss, and I've usually spent more than I've expected- even during their happy hour.

UTSa4pXh6NyOLQfryY2_yA.text: The absolute best oyster bar in Pittsburgh it's a must. Great happy hour, great service. Clean fresh quality oysters. Love the look in the vibe of the place. Don't forget to try some their libations.

1HALuBa44szX-iLAWRwPsg.text: I have two great things to say about this place. Food and service.   Service...number one: my parents and I popped in here on a Saturday afternoon and I totally did not realize they were closing between lunch/dinner. That didn't stop them from serving us! They did explain that kitchen (hot food) was closed, but raw bar and drinks open. Thanks!!!! (Felt like kind of a jerk once I realized we were in the break time.)   We ordered the chef's east/west sampler and three cocktails. The server fully detailed the types of oysters displayed (beautifully) and their tastes, regions of origin. Very informally informative.   French 75, some bourbon and a Bloody Mary gave those oysters a real pop.   The atmosphere is totally chill and makes it perfect to relax, imbibe and have some great conversation.   Music selection was on point! Made my pops pretty happy!  I checked out the Happy Hour menu and it looks fantastic!! $1 and $2 oysters and drink specials. Other items off the raw bar look great too, but it's going to take me a lot to steer from those salty oysters. CAN'T WAIT to return.

photos.caption: Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Oyster heaven.
Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. French 75. I feel so fancy when I drink one of these.

R8VbvHKm1CoZzmqqX9fg9Q.text: My boyfriend was in the mood for oysters about a month ago and I totally forgot that he had never been here. He is from FL and loves seafood. Its hard to find fresh tasting seafood and oysters, but muddy waters does it well.   We sat at the oyster bar and ordered oysters. 12 to start. I enjoyed them but wanted something different. I ordered the alligator po boy while my boyfriend ordered 100 more plates of oysters and chatted away with the guy shucking them.   I enjoyed the alligator po boy, but I didn't care for the season on it (too salty)  $170 later (IN OYSTERS.. my boyfriend is a tiny guy but he cant EAT) we were on our way. After chatting away with the oyster shucker and waiter, we were invited to their superbowl party. (how cool)  Still love this place! The guy shucking oysters explained they are brought in daily on a plane... now that is FRESH!

GEIMypjnwyO9ChZX5SAv0Q.text: Raw oysters: Out of the east coast ones, Irish point and permaquid are bigger and have a more metallic taste. Permaquid also has a strong smell. They are also more salty. The rest of the east coast oysters are less salty and have more of an earthy flavor. I really liked the one called James river. The oysters from the west coast are smaller in size and sweeter. We tried Hama Hama. It was pretty good.   Cooked oysters: we tried the chargrilled oyster. You get 6 of them on a plate with bread and lemon. It was quite delicious.   Appetizer: we tried an appetizer called, as far as I can recall, halushka. It wasn't listed on the menu but suggested by them. It was a pasta like dish made out of egg dumplings, Brussels sprouts and pork. It wasn't the best thing I've ever had but it was filling and ok.  Wine: we tried a Portuguese white wine suggested by our server and it was pretty smooth.  Service: this place was pretty crowded for a Tuesday evening. Service wasn't slow. We were in fact given sufficient attention and checked upon regularly and asked about the food. Service was good. Ambience was nice. Music was upbeat and they also have live music. However space is less and we felt a little cramped. Good experience overall

mf_ogHKDvx_Iti9aHBtOOg.text: This is another new restaurant in the gentrified east liberty since I lived here. It's not very big so I would recommend making reservations. We came here on Christmas Eve and they had happy hour specials. One of the offerings was $1 oysters with a minimum order of 6. I am not a big oyster eater but YOLO so I ordered them. You can't not order oysters at a restaurant that's known for its oysters lol they were pretty fresh and big. Not as salty or strong tasting. We paired it with their $10 off special of a bottle of bubbly. We got the Italian prosecco. For my entree I got the banana foster french toast sans bacon. I don't really like bloody Mary's but it seems like a good deal for $10.

vFxDgwFCw1i5HJLE9ICxAQ.text: Yum!  I love oysters and was spoiled living along the coast for a long time, so I've always been kind of iffy about eating them in Pittsburgh.  Muddy Waters is the place though.  They have a decent selection that you can mix and match and you can watch them shuck right next to the bar.   If you aren't a fan of raw oysters, they have several cooked varieties.  I recommend the grilled oysters that are dressed with a butter sauce and served with a warm hunk of baguette.  More filling that you would think and very delicious.   I usually pair those with their succotash dish to make a complete meal.  The veggies are varied and cooked to perfection and then topped with a perfect egg.   They have a happy hour too, so if you happen to like the items they feature (raw oysters, bubbly, etc.) you can save a few bucks.    Three minor gripes bring the score down a star.  First, the wine selection is on the pricey side and the pours are pretty light.  Second, the pimento cheese is just a travesty.  I LOVE pimento cheese and was so excited to see it on the menu.  I ordered it with the fried green tomatoes (which were a little underdone and greasy).  It's not traditional pimento cheese, but rather some sort of Cajun-Creole take.  Whatever it was, it did not work for me at all.   Finally, I am on a crusade to rid the world of backless barstools.  I hate them.  Despise them.  Loathe them and  everything about their posture killing uncomfortableness.   Muddy Waters has a whole line of them.

BCWAz_hwPYgjsCPkMcjwgQ.text: Excellent, excellent place for dinner. Swung by on a Tuesday night and got happy hour deals on a bunch of their awesome MA oysters. Also ordered the lobster roll such was excellent and full of meat. Gumbo was also great with so much flavor. And gotta get the light and airy beignets for dessert!   And almost forgot, there was a live band and top notch service.

u1Wow2Ugv1xn6ambtUD5ag.text: Just go here. If you like New Orleans style food, just go here. Try any of the small plates. We never made it to the entrees. Catfish sticks, hush puppies, Jamison lamb sliders, gator gumbo, pork rinds. Holy cow. I plan to get back here for the entrees next time I'm in town.

rINlkXw20lSPT-4E9EBoXA.text: Good food, good drinks, just what was needed.  Seated at the oyster bar and watched the shucking.   Not a lot I can add with so many other reviews but the place was packed and noisy.    As to the food, the cup of Duck & Sausage gumbo was good and spicy.  A fair amount of sausage but lacking in duck.  Did get a few tiny pieces of duck and it was tender and tasty.  The gumbo is spicy with a lot of jalapeno peppers.  The Fried Shrimp Po Boy was very good.  Plenty of shrimp that was cooked well, nice and tender.  The topping of chili mayo added a lot of spiciness and some heat.  Enjoyed the pickle too.  Po Boy sandwiches can be so different and this is a pretty good rendition of a Po Boy.  Tasty Cajun Fries came with the Po Boy.

photos.caption: Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fried Shrimp Po Boy w/Cajun Fries
Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Duck &amp; Sausage gumbo

6UbYhkjBGbK1rOjJxPevIg.text: It's about time that Pittsburgh has a rockin' raw bar, and Muddy Waters does not disappoint. The ManBeast and I went to Muddy Waters for the first time last night to celebrate our first wedding anniversary. We managed to enjoy the last 30 minutes of their happy hour (which runs 4:30-6:30) -- $1 East Coast oysters (a featured oyster, presumably rotates), $2 West Coast oysters, $4 Cajun oyster shooters, $10 off bottles of bubbly, $20 off bottles of Champagne.  We happily took advantage and ordered 1/2 dozen East (James River), 1/2 dozen West (hama hama), a bottle of Prosecco, and two shooters.  OYSTERS: You either like oysters and you don't. The oysters are served with lemon and mignonette, with a trio of hot sauces if you're into that. Both the ManBeast and I preferred the James River -- large and sweet.  Neither one of us loved the mignonette, but I did enjoy the house-made bangin' pimento hot sauce. Nummy!  HAPPY HOUR: Awesome deals. Seriously. We both enjoyed the shooters, which tasted like a mini-Bloody Mary with a salty, gooey surprise in the bottom (an oyster, obvs). Made with red pepper vodka and a Cajun spiced rim.   DRINKS: We both tried a house special. I had the vieux carre, the ManBeast a Sazerac. Both drinks were delish and well-made.   STARTERS: We sampled the pork rinds (served with a delicious creole remoulade), deviled eggs, and pimento cheese.  Pork rinds?  Hard to go wrong.  The dipping sauce was particularly delish.  The deviled eggs were my favourite -- foie gras filling topped with smoked roe. Absolutely fabulous, and a terrific portion size for two people (4 whole, stuffed eggs, served with house-made pickled veggies).  My homemade Charleston pimento cheese is better than theirs, so I'd take a pass on that next time.  DINNER: The ManBeast was coming down with a cold, so we wound up getting a to-go po' boy. I opted for the gator with fried green tomatoes on the server's recommendation. Overall, I wouldn't get that again. The greens were FAR too bitter for my taste buds and turned me off from the entire sandwich, which I couldn't eat. The gator itself was quite good, though. Two of the fried green tomato slices were rock-hard in the center.   Normally, I would subtract a star for the disappointing sandwich, but the overall vibe of the place was so great, it compensates for this.  OVERALL: Awesome vibe. Can't wait to go back to hear the live music (although where the heck does the band play?! the place is tiny!) and sample some other offerings. Lively, although the PA music (heavily featuring Hendrix, which rocked) drowned out our ability to talk at a couple points.

photos.caption: Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. West Coast and East Coast happy hour oysters.
Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cajun oyster shooters!
Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. A West Coast hama hama oyster, with the house-made bangin&#39; pimento sauce.

bWRaRl2v9p110DaTPghIvw.text: We visited Muddy Waters on a rainy and slow Monday evening at 8:30pm, so the place was only about 1/5th full. They had some cool Austin City Limits type music on the sound system, but two nights a week they do have live music in house for a two hour session.  My husband ordered a Jack's hard cider to drink, while I ordered an apple flavored drink named 'Don't you lie to me.' Both drinks were light and refreshing. We started with the cornbread which came with apple flavored butterjam. The two together were a burst of flavors and were delicious.  My husband ordered the hush puppies that were perfectly cooked, light and flavorful, while I ordered the chargrilled oysters. The oysters were more flavorful as they cooled down just a bit. I ordered an iceberg wedge, but did not care for their version of it.  For entrees, my husband got red beans, sausage and rice and I had the lobster roll with Cajun fries. It was the first time I've ever had lobster so I wish there wasn't any crawfish in there to muddle the flavor. The taste was mellow and pleasant and I got practically the entire thing to go since we were both stuffed.  The server was very professional and accommodating. All the employees were very nice. I would definitely like to visit again.

yA7ZEaXrW6z3ljvobdzezA.text: Had the East / West oyster combo. It was excellent. Even my wife, who is not a big oyster fan, loved them. I've had some disappointing brunches recently but this was a very pleasant surprise. Service was quick too although it wasn't exceptionally busy when we had our visit. I can't comment on the oysters but will have to go back to give them a try.

8wGdHtZA1X3qFmBlfdjsiA.text: Loved this place and the service, but then  I got food poisoning from the lobster roll.  Not a fun weekend.

yGrnSd-Hx-ltd_rLjaD2vg.text: Enjoyable evening. While we only ate small plates and a salad, all were prepared well. Particularly enjoyed the broiled oysters. Service was very pleasant and attentive. We sat at a 2-top along the wall ... a bit cramped with people moving passed bar patrons but only a minor tweak. Will be back.

qQMvL-LYKgreW5aqsBKQeQ.text: This place is awesome & the service is great, but the best foods are the most expensive. If you do go,  you can't leave without ordering oysters. Ordering them is an experience in its own if you've never done it before. Great array of food from seafood to steak (for an oyster bar, they do steak well). Sophisticated Creole/Cajun foods that don't shock your tastebuds. Been here a couple times - great food, great drinks, great service (even on the busiest nights)!

AUQl1DeIOpIUYug1xCgV7Q.text: My friends and I went there for happy hour. Oysters very fresh and tasty (good price also!)

GkR5c2aPTmAT48EvnL1tAQ.text: Came here during the Carnegie Mellon graduation season. Oysters were (obviously) the main reason we came - but I recommend the alligator po boy! It's really good!

ACEELYLp_-U98VR_14uuqw.text: Great place for lunch today. The lobster roll was excellent. The ambience was calm and relaxed, our waiter, Rob, was perfectly attentive during our meal. The Bloody Mary bar was ingenious, as was the punch bar offering. Happy hour allowed me to splurge on some fresh oysters and they were expertly served on ice. I enjoyed each one! I would like to return here just to explore the unique menu selections.

NIBex0mdr46txj1pGcxABA.text: This place is pretty awesome but can be a tad pricy. Lobster roll was really tasty, but around $20. Drinks are fancy and pretty tasty, but it really depends on your personal preferences (I learned that whipped egg whites are not my thing). Happy hour oyster is really worth it though, $1 west coast oysters and $2 east coast oysters!

0EzeEwmDtaAFr8ShW_1hUQ.text: I am a native New Orleanian and enjoy the convenience of a taste of home.  I was very disappointed when I called into place an order because I was short on time. Was told 15-20 mins. Arrived, paid in advance while I was awaiting and finally had to ask for someone to please check on my order 40 total minutes later only to receive a bag of fries drenched in grease and my poboy sandwich completely cold with soggy shrimp. Not to mention it was a $17 sandwich. And....I had already tipped in advance 20%.  Try a little southern hospitality....it will go far.

6Enmze7VdiZ53iFaxqWMow.text: So glad I found an oyster bar here in Pittsburgh!   As of today's date, happy hour rates were $1/east, 2$/west from 4:30-6:30.   There were oyster specials as well as drink specials.   Oysters tasted fresh and delicious.    Ambience was good.   Service was pretty good.   Will likely be back!

zkP5djXkox0wDBZjgaZIEw.text: Amazing food and drinks and a great atmosphere. The oysters were phenomenal with many different varieties to choose from. The cocktails were all very unique and tasted great. Easily the best food we had while visiting Pittsburgh.

R877JLgp9s5N1AvHtKGaNg.text: To be honest, I came for the happy hour and don't remember much after the first bottle of $18 prosecco went down. I remember enjoying myself so I guess that's all that really matters.

kMB5Wv-YONgLgNjRPGZRWQ.text: my experience was great, the service was fantastic. We stared with the chargrilled oysters and a few oysters from the west coast portion of the menu, they were delicious!!! and we split the lobster roll and shrimp po boy, both were excellent. highly recommend.

_nv3iN7EHVqp3o3Tk4lJPA.text: First trip here.  Love the setup of the place.   The duck and sausage gumbo was amazing as were the beignets.  I highly recommend both.  Sitting there finishing my meal I thought "this is the kind of place I need to come to more often".

SS370KUt3h5q5J4uqw8xew.text: Great new place right around the corner. Oysters were amazing. Looking forward to many more trips in here

FXHuk3xYlbJeJTfI9P22sg.text: Amazing!!! Lived up to the hype! The west coast oyster sampler was amazing and so was the brunch- especially the truffle hush puppies! Service was excellent- thank you Bruce! We will definitely be back!

PaBHADWrnGW0js8N9lFNrQ.text: Great service, food was outstanding!  Very nice location.  Will definitely be coming here again!

I9YBBCbfgDt2-XoDN9rjXQ.text: Excellent food in a relaxed and friendly environment.  Oysters of The fall were delicious with distinct flavor.  The Shrimp and Grits was smoky, sweet and creamy all at the same time- outstanding.  The Pickled green tomatoes on the Wedge salad were a unexpected twist on a standard favorite.  LIl chunk burger was anything but lil.  Had the "Ain't no Thyme for that" to drink....WOWZA!!! Really enjoyed this place.

fjxqApNlhzInjjkgw1HS4w.text: Muddy Waters is an office favorite.  The oysters are quite good and the happy hour deals are excellent. Some of the non-oyster menu items, like the cornbread, are not quite up to par, but the seafood is wonderful.  I especially love the fried oyster po boy.

Isz4TKR9gWGb4W9ogmhOBA.text: We decided to try this place 2 weeks ago. The owner is very nice, came to our table and offered free deserts. Everything is good. Great place, the sides were good too. Worth the price and highly recommend!

fKgKMjntWEBDIrvU6FXXGA.text: The staff was friendly and knowledgeable. We had a plate of the east and a plate of the west coast oysters. Both were amazing, from creamy to briny. I had the whole fried fish for dinner. Very good. I had a couple of Bloody Mary's for cocktails. They were good but not outstanding. They needed more spiciness. Overall a very good place for oysters and dinner!

6cjnAv2JxBRpah59H9qG8Q.text: Oysters are always super fresh here. I've tried several dishes here and all of them are good and fresh! I'm not comfortable eating seafood in a city so far away from the ocean, but at Muddy Waters everything is super fresh and I've never felt sick after eating here, so I love it:D

QUoAfTcJCnZUu26s6gEUxQ.text: The grilled oysters and pickled green tomatoes(nestled under my wedge salad) redeemed Pittsburgh eating for me.

Lw51B8AZFkuGajDY2-u3MQ.text: The team at Muddy Waters did a great job taking care of me on my Sunday evening. I ate way too much cornbread, and drank about a bottle's worth of Chambongs. Overall a great atmosphere and the staff was awesome to hang out with. The alligator sandwich was great too!

w_trw5_WvVsPfUOc4ctdwA.text: This is a unique experience for this area. Let me come out up front and disclose that I am not an oyster fan. That being said the other items on the menu that I got to try were exceptional. My favorite by far is the bananas foster french toast. Not only is it delicious but it came with copious amounts of bacon! I'm pretty sure the secret is out about this place. We went for brunch on Saturday and it was packed. They have a bloody mary bar so if Friday night made a rough Saturday morning you may want to check it out just for that reason. It's in a nice area with plenty of parking close by and close to shopping if that interests you. Would have been five stars but the service was friendly but a little slow, like I said it was packed.

zYxjDd9eHvBJ1SLpF1VVYQ.text: Great narrow oyster bar.  Very fresh oysters, and great southern food.  Whole fried Snapper and Hot Chicken were very tasty.  Many choice of oysters from East and West coasts. Come for happy hour, and come early.

C4rydfEowhxDcwnoZ-MuBg.text: The lobster roll is amazing! Great service! The oysters went down sweetly! The fried green tomatoes are exceptionally tasty and great for sharing! The BBQ shrimp and grits was yummy except for the need to completely deconstruct the shrimp and it became a total mess.   The air handler also could not handle the heat when the roll up door is open. It was extremely hot inside so much so that we had to change venues to continue drinking as soon as the food was finished. I will definitely visit again when the weather is cooler!

TG8xBbRXA4RSrTRf85gEFg.text: Good drinks, good food- much needed creole/Cajun addition to the city (for those of us who NOLA didn't cut it for).  Get the gumbo- it's a beautiful things as is the creole spiced shrimp cocktail.  I love the I Mississippi you as far as drinks go.  Only reason I didn't rank this higher stars is 1. The entree sized plates get to be a bit pricey ($24 for shrimp and grits?!?!).   The biggest drawback is the parking situation- basically you aren't getting close unless you have a parking fairy. There is extremely limited street parking, a public lot 5 blocks away And no valet. Hard to convince some people to come here with those as options

o1WomdYUWoyhely9h3s0-g.text: This small venue is one of the three best places for oysters in Pittsburgh. Excellent cocktails are rendered by an attentive and dedicated staff. The brunch is highly recommended. Menu highlights include BBQ shrimp & grits, and what is easily one of the best lobster rolls (fortified with crawfish) that you'll ever eat.

Dk4cr64mzQXrMmFyJP0aNw.text: Went here for brunch and had the shrimp and grits- AMAZING! Bloody Mary was excellent! Will def return to try em for dinner.

GS7KaPPywie7E5e3_HRTdQ.text: My girlfriend and I frequent this spot at least once a month and without fail it keeps getting better and better. The food, the service, the drinks ( THE DRINKS ), the music...it's always grade a !

0XOSqjf9SH-lAqLbAFBCPA.text: Always a great time! Amazingly Fresh oysters! 99% of the time no shells. The good cocktails, backbay atmosphere provide a fun, energetic experience. This is my go too spot for oysters in pittsburgh. Been to the rest and always come back here.

AtQuU19j9HR0EJH0iEnymg.text: A solid 4 for this adventure...the lobster roll was excellent and loaded with lots of lobster!  While the sandwich may look small in the photo, I assure you it was really tasty and filling!  My only knock would be volume and music.  Music was bar loud (which I guess is ok), however it went from this down home blues vibe to hip hop rap which left me scratching my head thinking they may be bringing out a DJ and changing to a club format with dancing or something....it eventually switched back to blues....will definitely come back again!

acpIDUV-bWm8BLFXESPQAQ.text: Service was great. Atmosphere was laid back and comfortable. Awesome selection of unique drinks that were fun and yummy! We had the hush puppies, cornbread, shrimp and grits and the chicken and waffles. All so delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

GA-4BwFiuHE_ZlezsRCYRA.text: This is the first Oyster Bar we'd heard of in the Pittsburgh area after moving from Philly where we had lots of options, so my hubby and I have been really excited to try it. The reviews made use a little nervous that it might be overcrowded, over-priced, and noisy like some other place we've been recently (Yes, Industry, I'm still complaining about you!). I'm so glad we went anyway.   We went on a Friday night and had made reservations for 9pm, but ended up getting there shortly after 8:30pm. They were already rockin' but the host set us up immediately at the Oyster bar so we weren't standing around. Within minutes (and still early for our reservation), our waiter cleared off a table and seated us.   We forgot our waiter's name but he was wonderful. He was super knowledgeable about each oyster offering and the rest of the menu. We got the east-west sampler (6 of each for $38) which came quickly and was perfect. Our drinks were exactly as strong as we wanted them to be on a Friday evening and delicious. I got the "I Mississippi You" and the jalapeno off-set the blackberry perfectly. My husband loved his "Clyde May's Sour" as well.   Being hungry and the oyster lovers that we are, we then ordered the Chargrilled Oysters (another half-dozen). Buttery, garlicky, perfectly grilled, with just enough flavor that it added to the oysters without over-powering them. The hush puppies...oh my God. Perfectly fried, super flavorful, and I could have sucked down that sauce with a straw.   I chose the seafood gumbo for my entree. Now I've had the pleasure of spending time in New Orleans and have found myself disappointed by any northern recreations of food. Muddy Waters, however, did not miss the mark. Instead of giving me a bowl of rice with a little sauce and shrimp as most places do, I had a bowl full of shrimp, oysters, lobster, and okra in an amazing sauce. My husband went for the burger which he devoured before having a chance to tell me it was delicious.   Overall, the experience was fantastic and we can't wait to go back.

h5ctSwAAb7iy-ENmMFNunQ.text: Wow.  I'm almost speechless.  I've lived and worked in New Orleans, Patuxent River Maryland,  and plenty of other places that sport fresh oysters.  I swear I couldn't believe I was in Pittsburgh.  This place kicks ass, the oysters are first rate, the happy hour prices are incredible, and the beer and booze selection is ample!  I'm going back, next time with my main squeeze.  This could become a thing!

T4fyPfedAOjDXLoVnVzZIA.text: Read the reviews expecting good food but instead spent $50 on food I was forcing down. Cool atmosphere but food was deceiving.

gtCzb83mnW_hgdqwy1LUXA.text: Nice atmosphere with live jazz on Saturday evening. Got the gator bites, charcuterie plate, and deviled eggs to share amongst the table. All very good! For entree, split the lobster roll with a side of collards and the chargrilled oysters. The lobster roll was kinda small, but included crawfish too. It was tasty. The collards were too salty to eat even though they came highly recommended. The chargrilled oysters were probably the highlight of the evening. Cooked and seasoned perfectly.

mTE2mjCw0pTmpDMapbaGNQ.text: The best happy hour deal in Pittsburgh.  The oysters are very fresh, and awesomely priced during happy hour. We got a mix of the east coast ($1) and west coast ($2) oysters, and they were both great. I think I would stick with the cheaper east coast oysters during future visits because they were equally as good as the west coast oysters.  We also ordered the seafood gumbo and cajun fries, but the waiter completely forgot about both of them. I told him and he soon brought the seafood gumbo, which was delicious especially on a cold day in Pittsburgh. But, he still forgot the cajun fries... and we were quite full, so I didn't even bother mentioning it again.  Besides my poor experience with the service, the food was amazing.  --  taste / 4 aesthetics / 4 vibe / 4 service / 1 price for quality / 4 OVERALL / 3.4

Zu3IhEMOkjXrHsQdeNGcpw.text: On our quest to find all make-your-own-Bloody Mary bars, we tried brunch here! The Bloody Mary bar consisted of pre made Bloody Mary mix (which was so spicy for me who usually asks for a 1 on a 1-5 scale of spicy); a loooot or hot sauce variety; tons of olives and peppers, celery, a few meats and cheeses, and shrimp and oysters! We went with the well vodka for 8$ but they have cool house infused vodkas for 10$!  My boyfriend had the chicken and donut sandwich and destroyed it. He said it was the perfect amount of food for brunch! I had the shrimp po boy sandwich which was twice the size of the chicken and donut! I probably ate a third at brunch and the rest for post brunch meal and dinner   The atmosphere was pretty cool and the service was great! I recommend making a reservation for brunch because the seating is limited!

0Ym1sI6oaChJP2TeBf_G5Q.text: Pricey but good fresh food. The staff is usually attentive and it's always consistent.

YMM_2MVBRbf2co6-lpvVHg.text: When there during happy hours. Good deal for oysters. Mac & cheese from kid menu was really good (I'm personally not a big fan of mac & cheese). Baked oysters & seafood gumbo were very good. It was kid friendlier than I thought. My 4 years old nephew had a good time.

A6yHzbfLP6_TkcwZu8HL-w.text: Hubby and I went here for an early wedding anniversary brunch! We were both so excited to try it, and it did not disappoint.   We both started with the bloody mary bar, Titos for me, Old Bay vodka for him. We had a lot of fun building our bloody marys and we both ended up with pretty loaded glasses. So you know that is a sign of a good BM bar. I liked the pickled options, it was a nice addition to the saltiness of the drink. And their blood mary mix was sooo good!!   For an appetizer we got the fried green tomatoes that were cooked perfectly! The pimento cheese spread sealed the deal! Such a crunchy, savory bite!   I had the lobster roll because it was prepared just the way I like, with tons of butter. Lobster rolls made with mayo bases are for the birds! It was one of the best lobster rolls I've ever had. Perfect balance of everything and the lobster chunks were HUGE!!   Hubby got the fried shrimp po boy and loved it so much. The shrimp was "fried" perfectly. Not covered in a ton of breading, but still had amazing flavor.   We can't wait to go back for dinner sometime! Our only complaint and thing we'll do different is not having our waitress. She was pretty disengaged and didn't even explain the blood mary bar to us, or seem like she liked us. Can't win 'em all! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. A beautiful, beautiful lobster roll!
Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The bacon was cooked perfect!
Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

6S29Onz3YbgyqsTaykJwCQ.text: I loved my dinner at Muddy Waters. I had some of the best oysters I have ever had as a starter. The oyster platter came with 3 extra sauces to try besides the basic mignonette. For dinner I went with a nightly special that was recommended by my bartender. I am very glad I took his reco, it was my first time having grilled octopus as an entree. It came with 2 huge tentacles, dirty cheesy grits and okra. I cleaned my plate, it was incredible. The dirty cheesy grits had sausage, chicken livers and cheddar cheese. They had a nice beer selection as well as an interesting cocktail menu. I will definitely be back to try some of their Po Boys when I am back in town.

wVIWdW3Suknds6au8uGlXA.text: Everything about my experience at Muddy Waters was amazing. The service was fantastic. Our waiter (I can't remember his name unfortunately) was really laid back, made good recommendations, and was attentive. The drinks were delicious. I went with a group of six and every person liked their drinks. I ordered one of their cocktails, again I can't remember the name, but it was so good. Our group ordered a bunch of appetizers including the cornbread, hush puppies, catfish, fried oysters, brussel sprouts, etc. and nothing bad could be said. I ordered the hot chicken, sampled the shrimp po' boy, the gumbo, and the shrimp and grits. It all was delicious. The hot chicken comes with sliced white bread just how my grandmother serves it (nice touch), and the sides were mouth watering.   I can honestly say that I was skeptical about this place based on the outward appearance, but I was pleasantly surprised. If I'm ever back in Pittsburgh I'll definitely have to come back.

G-35MHJQOD0E54UEx9RwTQ.text: This place was good! Fresh oysters: amazing; like the essence of the ocean. Grilled oysters? Wish I could have had it at home so I could lick the plate! Collard greens? Wow - some of the best I have had. Even the steak was good. Will be back. Many times.

C5ZLsijbeQK6T_mFjbaLvA.text: Great selection of food and drinks.   Oysters were fantastic. Drinks were pretty cheap too. Serving staff was also really kind and welcoming.

REo6XGfO5VldiPJQf-U0HQ.text: Deeeelicious from beginning to end. Great service and food. The oysters were exactly what we were hoping for.  Not the best embiance for an oyster bar but hey it's pittsburgh

cWX9oz_E_e_5Z5MctfzPUw.text: AW SHUCKS, I could eat a whole bucket of oysters but this college student is on a budget so I might have to put that on hold till I enter the real world and start making some money to afford it all...  My friend and I came for Happy Hour on Wednesday around 4:30pm (when HH starts). We were seated right away and it didn't seem too busy yet at this time. The space seems a lot smaller than I thought but I think it's just a more narrow space than most restaurants. It's a bit dim inside but there is this one row of seating right at the back where a window of natural lighting shines in from the top so we were seated there. Also, the music can get a little bit too loud and I think if it were the weekend it'll get pretty crowded. Probably a good place to come after a work day to just chill with coworkers or friends.  For the Happy Hour Oysters, you have to order in batches of 6. The first batch of 12 that we ordered were both from the East Coast - half Delaware Bay and half Half Moon. The Delaware Bay oysters are still $1 for HH but the rest of the east coast oysters raised to $2 I believe (as well as the west coast oysters). The Delaware Bay tasted clean and a little more bland than the other types of oysters we tried. I think that you would need the mignonette or some hot sauce to give the Delaware Bay more flavor. But for the Half Moon, the bit of the saltiness that it already had didn't call for any additional toppings. We weren't satisfied with eating just 6 oysters each, so we ordered 6 more but this time from the West Coast - KUMIAI. I would say this was the best one out of the three types we tried. It had the perfect amount of flavoring and balance of taste. And it was a little more "plump," as the menu described.   In addition to the oysters, we ordered the Louisiana Lobster Roll Sandwich, which came with cajun fries. This was my first time having a lobster roll... To my surprise the sandwich was a lot more buttery than I was expecting? Like the bread seemed drenched with butter... I think it would've been better to my liking if it wasn't all overwhelming with butter but the lobster tasted yummy:) The fries that came with the sandwich were quite soggy... didn't taste freshly made. Also I don't think the cajun seasoning was on them because it just tasted like regular fries.. hmm.. we didn't bother telling them but might want to check on that the next time.   Overall, I had a good experience and would come back for the oysters!
