Photo of Muddy Waters Oyster Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. 6 Delaware Bay oysters and 6 Half Moon oysters :@euginoms

Pgg7ivlvP3ZmgBk1Z5yjtA.text: Pros: At $8, the Bloody Mary bar was a steal. There's a nice variety on the menu, although once you add raw oysters (or another appetizer) + a drink + plus an entree, the price is easily more than $30 per person, which is more than I want to spend on lunch. The grilled oysters my friend's friend had looked delicious. My partner appreciated that the fruit salad that came with his chicken sandwich had actual fresh fruit and berries rather than merely cantaloup and honeydew.  Cons: The strawberry vinaigrette on the pecan salad was an unnatural shade of washed-out pink (perhaps a personal quirk of mine). The music was too loud for easy conversation. The waitress disappeared while we eating, making drink refills difficult, and she then tried to clear my plate before I was finished with the fixings on my Bloody Mary.  Verdict: We'll come back, but only for special occasions or with guests.

Kl5m19twwH0G_IwIZDmtVg.text: Muddy waters and as great. The quality and selections of Oysters to choose from is great. I recommend getting the west coast.

SZZ7dlUB0WKIxdgeSB8i2g.text: Awesome place! Great food! Great service! Fried chicken and grits are the best. Oysters are fantastic- we prefer East Coast. Cocktails are yummy and sometimes live music. Go early if you don't have reservations. Place is always busy on weekends.

5IRvHSeW0P_AcSdVHi4MDA.text: We came in with a small group for dinner on a Friday night with a reservation. The table was ready right on time and we were seated right away. We got our drinks and appetizers almost right away.  Big props for keeping cans of Genny's Cream Ale. Our table shared the fried green tomatoes and the east coast/west coast oyster sampler.   The fried green tomatoes were well cooked but the star was the pimento cheese spread. The oysters tasted fresh, clean, and the sampler offered a great variety of flavors from sweet and delicate to more brackish and meaty. It also included 3 mignonettes. The jalapeno one was excellent.   I had the Louisiana lobster roll and fries. Unbelievably delicious. The rest of the table got po boys and were very happy.  Great food, great service, and one of the best spots I've been to in the Pittsburgh area.

je3tfGTl-WJMUXKo8MDxSA.text: Muddy waters is probably my favorite place in Pittsburgh. The food is always amazing with a great atmosphere. The employees are always friendly and willing to help you figure out what drink or food you might like. If you like oysters there is nowhere else around even close to the quality.

3I3ncpqQPanpUFxruzSsoA.text: Spectacular!!  Great service, very well decorated restaurant. I shared 2 dozen oysters with my buddy. We had 6 east coast and 6 west cost each. So delicious!! Then we tricked the kids and told them the alligator bites were chicken tenders and they loved them along with the hush puppies. Then we both had the seafood gumbo. It was so flavorful and aromatic. My 11 year old son had a 16oz sirloin.  It was so good he finished every single ounce!  We finished the dinner off with fresh made beignets.

6fi7BqiqKt5kGv2FdzBi_A.text: Food was good but pricy.  Place was packed when we went and this place will realistically show you what the life of an Oyster is with its size. Everyone was elbow to elbow with the only main walkway being wide enough for one person at a time to walk through.  The food was good.  I am by no means an Oyster critic but what I had was good.  The sever did an OK job explaining what she liked but hardly made is seem like she truly knew the differences between their offerings.  I had one of the Bloody Mary Oyster Shooters and will admit it just tasted like a $5 shot of pickle juice.   If you are not claustrophobic and seeking some Oysters in Pittsburgh it seems like a win.

jYLFZPrmSfQ3EQy-N6-5sw.text: Having enjoyed the wonderful oysters of Louisiana and the south I was underwhelmed by the size of the oysters they had. I know there is a lot of pressure on oyster beds, over harvesting but they were so small I almost left   Never have I written a bad review but just calling it as I see it. Thank god for the beers!

KDcrrAaAQffaw7eH-KtduQ.text: I love it here. Seriously. I love the place, I love the food, I love the staff, I love the drinks (except for the hurricane, too sweet). This is a great place to come for happy hour or for dinner. Parking is on the street which can be sometimes annoying but it has not ever been a huge problem. Even on the Yelp app you can make a reservation, which I would say to do just because the place is not huge. I like to sit at the booths in the back but there are spaces at the bar and high top tables. I just prefer a seat that is comfortable and a little more intimate.   I love Cajun and Creole food. Anything that has a bit of spice and seafood is good in my book. And oysters are my all time favorite. I could eat those little morsels every day of the week.  I came for a tasting party once and then for happy hour. So I am trying to write about both of my experiences with the food. Honestly, they were both great so...its hard not to like the menu, people, service, and ambiance.   Oysters: JAMES RIVER: Cherrystone Aqua Farms (Chincoteague, VA). These are my favorite of all of the oysters that I have tried. Not briny at all. Very smooth, plump, and full of flavor. I am not a fan of the briny oysters so this one was a great choice.   CHARGRILLED OYSTERS: Garlic Butter, Parmesan, Chili Flakes. Yum. A little bit of spice and a little bit of cheese. These went down really well. I thought that maybe the cheese made the oyster a little salty, but overall delish.   OYSTERS ROCKEFELLER:Greens, Bacon, Parmesan, Absinthe. Really good dish too. The bacon was cut into bigger chunks than I would have liked and because of that it was extra crunchy and more noticeable. I would have liked to have it mix a bit more with the dish, but it was still really good.   Appetizers:  BLACK TRUFFLE HUSH PUPPIES:Mushroom Duexelle, Black Truffle, Fresh Herbs, Black Garlic Remoulade. These are AMAZING. Seriously. I cannot talk about how great these were. The taste was so unlike any other hush puppy I had ever had. I would get these all day long. The black garlic remoulade was also something interesting and delicious.   Main Course:  SEAFOOD GUMBO: Lobster, Shrimp, Crawfish, Oysters,Rice, Andouille Sausage, Okra. Just get this. It was delicious. I loved the mixture of the seafood with the taste of the gumbo. I have never had that much seafood in my gumbo and I am a changed person because of it! Yummy!  PO BOY: Your choice of Fried Shrimp or Oysters, Iceberg, Tomato, Pickle,Chili Mayo. I tried both the fried shrimp and the fried oyster po boy. Both were great. I enjoyed the Oyster one a bit more but that is only because I love oysters. I thought it was fried to perfection and the oysters were still plump and juicy on the inside.   LOUISIANA LOBSTER ROLL: Maine Lobster & Crawfish, Garlic Butter, Lemon, Split Top Roll. This was awesome. Really, really good. Not a lot of filler in this. I would say that I did add a little bit of the hot sauce to give it more of a kick. But other than that I would get this again for sure.   Drinks:  DON'T YOU LIE TO ME: Vodka, Green Apple, Lemon, Vanilla Beans. Go straight to this drink. Do not pass it up. I would bathe in this drink if appropriate! It is just so refreshing and great!  Go to Muddy Waters!! Take your family and friends. It is totally worth it! Splurge and go have some fun!

yQNUrYvsgqDhyKC-AVIYrQ.text: This is a very nice place to eat and comparable to other oyster restaurants for pricing. We literally just went to The Pearl in Columbus, Oh. that had a similar oyster theme. The fried green tomatoes were delicious and the dessert was the best. My son enjoyed the chunky burger and fries, while I had the shrimp and grits. I love shrimp n grits...the flavor wasn't bad, I just did not like the gritty chunky texture. I prefer smooth cheesy grits. The bbq added a nice touch. My mom is an oyster connoisseur, so to speak, lol. She said they were fresh, but didn't like the different flavors. The service was good and the ambiance was nice.

The quality was fantastic and we were told the oysters are shipped in directly from the source (opposed to a third party or middle man). You can sit outside at the bar top which is nice on a hot summer day. Louisiana po boy with gator was off the hook, also recommended by our server. Very non pretentious, laid back place.

m35bwePEaSaPsdcQYG2CtQ.text: Part of me says "don't write this review! it'll get even harder to grab a table" *sigh* I still want to show my appreciation for my fav. restaurant in Pittsburgh. (But again at 7pm on a random Tuesday, they have 30 min wait for four people...*sobs*) Hands down the freshest oysters around. I don't go to Mitchell's anymore. Oyster Rockefeller and chargrilled oysters are super good as well. Their happy oyster adds even greater value. My children devour their whole grilled fish. I like the vibe and friendly staff. The only reason I gave 4 star is because the food was very salty for both me and my friend.

bejte0T2K5CC5pwsEISsTw.text: Being a native New Englander, I am not one to mess around with my seafood.  If it ain't fresh, I won't eat it.  Sadly that means I don't eat much seafood in the Steel City.    Then I heard about Muddy Waters and how their oysters are brought in fresh from East and West Coasts.  I was intrigued.  I figured these were either going to be delicious or they're going to be a fishy tasting mess... Thank goodness for delicious!  When you arrive, the staff will educate you about the difference between East Coast (briny) and West Coast (silky) oysters.  You can have them raw (YES) or char-grilled.  As they say - they're "bad ass mother shuckers" - and they're not kidding!  Slurp down some oysters plain, with hot sauce, or with their pickling liquid they serve with it (it's incredible).  Looking for something more than oysters?  Try their Hot Chicken with creamy collard greens and cheese grits or the BBQ shrimp and grits (yes, whole shrimp).  For an app try the cornbread with apple butter (you'll thank me later).  Whatever fills your belly, wash it down with a DELICIOUS adult beverage.  Try all of their specialty drinks - I am working my way down the list (responsively) and they are tasty.  Whether it's freshly muddled berries or shaken with egg whites (it sounds weird, but trust me it's good), they don't mess around with their beverage!  Next time I'm craving a killer cocktail or the taste of home, I'll be heading to Muddy Waters.  Oysters here I come!

ODnukNeS7rySOjRrWxae7A.text: Small crowded place but comfortable area in the back for seating. We had ressies, so seating was not an issue. Great happy hour and daily specials. We started with some appetizers and chose the deviled eggs the were accompanied by some spicy pickles and green beans. They were amazing and one of our favorite items if the night. We also ordered the pimento cheese appetizer which was a bit spicy but uniquely delicious.  For our entrees we chose the lobster roll with Cajun fries and the whole snapper with veggie hash. The lobster roll had not only lobster, but also shrimp and crawfish. The seafood was very tasty, but the roll was hard and chewy and got tossed to the side. The whole snapper was presented beautifully on the plate with the veggie hash. The hash was very good but I felt the fish needed a bit more flavor. After carefully removing the inedible parts and bones, I mixed the fish with the hash and some Crystal hot sauce and it was quite enjoyable. However, I probably wouldn't order it again as it was a bit of work and there are too many other items I would want to try first.   Our server was very friendly and we chatted throughout the evening about good food locations all over the country. Our server was helpful and efficient from beginning to end.  In summary, this was a good meal but not quite the level of New Orleans cuisine we are accustomed to. But this is probably as close as we can get right now in the Burg, so we will take it!

dAoFyBhdtw_mxbGjGVd7pg.text: Out for the night and decided to grab a quick bite at muddy waters. If you've ever been to New Orleans, Lake Charles or even Shreveport Louisiana for that matter you won't like the food you will love the food at Muddy Waters.  The chef has a very good take on the coastal influence of Louisiana cuisine. Fresh oysters, po boys, gumbo and lots yummy strong drinks.  We had the pork rind appetizer that was a good blend of salty zesty and just plain guilty fun. We also enjoyed a shrimp Po boy in Cajun fries just enough heat to let it linger and makes you want to drink all the water in your glass. Do not miss the Two ton Feather so smooth it could be dangerous. Will be returning for that awesome looking gumbo and steak.

9ltuQBrNxaAkVrwxfS3UNQ.text: Food here was amazing. Love the steak and lobster benedict in the brunch menu. The French toast was also a go-to dish.  For the second time (we went back for brunch because my wife and I both think it was amazing), I ordered medium-rare steak but the server brought me a rare one. My wife order lobster benedict and we got lobster roll in stead. The waitress (a girl with brown hair and tattoo) did not apologize at all. She just simply took away the food with a cold face and said she will ask the kitchen to fix it. When she brought the food back out, it was correct even though my steak became medium-cooked.  Still recommend to go here but avoid that waitress!

rjczVOrNNeQhIZVTVgGjgQ.text: Intimate space, very welcoming, warm and friendly staff, with Great New Orleans inspired food!   The shrimp po'boy reminded me of one I had back in N.O., plumped well seasoned full of flavor shrimp on toasted bread; wonderful.   Tip: remember to make a reservation.

B4a908Pk7MR0zdaOBDI2ow.text: It has pissed me off since moving here 3 years ago that we didn't have a True oyster bar. A casual joint with fresh raw oysters from both coasts. My dreams have finally been made a reality!  I love this place. Love it. From the awesome happy hour prices on oysters to the fabulous selection of champagne to the bomb ass hot sauce and southern cuisine. The staff was dope too; the guy shocking oysters was smiling the entire time I was there. I plan to basically live here from now on.

MxmbbxSSDrlycDTH87S_Vg.text: This place is awesome! It's a small place with tables, booths, high tops and indoor/outdoor bar seating. My spouse and I went for Saturday brunch. We started with fried green tomatoes which were hot and crunchy. Then we got hush puppies, which the spouse said her and a friend finished three baskets once. The spouse got a gigantic wedge salad which she finished. I got shrimp and grits. It was BBQ style so it was a bit spicy, especially with the andouille sausages in it. It can also be a bit messy since it was head on shrimp. I looked like I dug in BBQ sauce once I was done but it was worth it for all the awesome flavor.

wcSfao7O3sXiBZ5PLN5cGQ.text: My dining experience at Muddy Waters was just what the doctor ordered. I had a wonderful relaxing time slowly going through an approximately 3 course meal with my boyfriend. We went here on a Friday night at 5:45pm (we had a reservation). When we arrived it wasn't packed; however, I believe most of the people dining throughout the night had reservations. I could not wait to dine here, because I had experienced a taste of the place at a yelp event in 2016.   We explored the happy hour by ordering two Don Waynes (a happy hour cocktail) which has ginger and was very delicious. We started with Oyster's Rockefeller which remind me of an escargot dish. They are cooked oysters with tons of fixings and a slight kick. Then we had the raw oysters. First we tried the James River oysters which were a dollar a piece. Then we tried the Emerald Cove oysters which were 2 bucks a piece. I preferred the James River; however, the Emerald Cove are very creamy.   My boyfriend had the Gator Sausage Gumbo. This had a pretty nice kick and the gator was melt away tender!. He also had the Oyster PO-boy which was a very large sandwich that came with fries. My man raved about the fries and claims they are the best he has ever tried.   I had the Shrimp and grits which was spicier than my ideal preference but delicious nonetheless. The grits were very creamy and helped cut the cajun flavors of the sauce. The shrimp were really jumbo jumbo full prawns. This meal is super messy and definitely not good for a first date. The prawns are not cleaned, they have a face and everything, so most of your time is spent trying to get to the meat.   This whole dining experience plus tip was around $116. So I would consider this place pretty pricey but definitely a good treat on occasions.

HDJU8zEKk5inObOLwYrJKg.text: This oyster bar was bomb as fuck! No lieeee if you craving oysters, this is the spot.. Great service as well..

QICuKYl86mYTV802HSVKsw.text: Wow! First time here and I will be coming back. Great cocktails--I had a Sazerac, very tasty. I sat at the bar and was intrigued, watching the bartenders making a bunch of interesting-looking cocktails. I had the seafood gumbo, which was unique. Flavorful roux, tasty tender shrimp, tender barely cooked fresh oysters, and half a soft shell crab with okra accompanied by soft on the side, toasty on the outside hunk of French bread. Topped off by my choice from a big selection of bourbons, rye and scotch. Pretty great!

O9JOHMR6M7Kr-zjGKZS8Nw.text: We celebrated a friends birthday at Muddy Waters on a Thursday night.  We started at the bar and ate a few dozen of the $1 oysters and a few craft IPAs.  We then transitioned to our table where I ordered the shrimp and grits along with the fried green tomatoes.  The portion size was larger than I expected and the flavored were equally great.  Would definitely come back to MWOB

Nf4_lLARiHRNy6UkaWHq0w.text: This place is awesome!  They have an oyster menu, broken in to west and east coast, we got a sampler of both east and west oysters. They tasted super fresh to me, they say they get them delivered daily.  If oysters aren't your thing they have another menu with appetizers, sandwiches and main dishes that are Creole.  Everyone loved the hush puppies we ordered.  We also got chargrilled oysters with butter and garlic but I actually liked the fresh oysters better, I thought the grill taste over powered them.  For dinner I had fried chicken, it was unlike any chicken I've ever had. They dip it in hot sauce and then batter and fry it, it had so much flavor.  It came with cheddar grits, collard greens and a biscuit.  It was all really good.  My friend had the gator bites, I wouldn't get those, nothing special.  The other 2 people got lobster rolls and they had a ton of meat in them, they both said they were really good.  Got beignets for dessert, how could fried dough not be good.  I didn't love the chocolate sauce it came with, too bitter.  Would definitely go again!

6g-LDGYlhc8NlBzQPq_J2g.text: This place has a great atmosphere. The servers and the cooks were extremely nice. We took advantage of the bloody Mary bar even though we got there a little after two and it was supposed to close at two. We thought this was pretty nice of the bartender for letting us try it out.   We ordered oysters and lobster, and both were so tasty and fresh. I ordered some type of lobster that came in a jar and there is a remoulade sauce that was out-of-this-world-to-die-for. Honestly, I could have just eaten it with a spoon. My husband particularly enjoyed one type of oyster from Maine, which I think was called the Bayloon oyster(? that's probably wrong, though),  which are only available one month out of the year. They were enormous and extremely fresh. My husband thought they were the best tasting oysters he ever had. We also met the owners at one point, who were very friendly.   The most challenging part about eating here was, (besides knowing when to stop eating), was finding parking. In fact, this is the main reason we missed out on brunch (it ended at 2pm). However, now we just have another reason to come back!

kmtBlInsW2KOw9wt38b-3Q.text: Fantastic food and great service. The whole fish and lobster was excellent. Collard greens delicious. Cocktails great as well. Would definitely come again

lhEnVAYFr0yfRYud5DRxZg.text: Fantastic! A gem!  When we walked in, we notice a nice bourbon selection. Upon further review, they had Pappy Van Winkle 20 year at $75 for an ounce. A great price especially compared to Butcher and the Rye at about $250 an ounce.  Our waiter, Kieran, was awesome as was the bartender behind the bar. We ordered the East and West Coast oysters which were excellent and described perfectly on the menu. We also had the Jambalaya for 2 which was awesome and had perfect heat to the dish. The Jambalaya was also a perfect portion for the both of us. We had beignets for dessert. 5 pieces and delicious. After our shots of Pappy and excellent Manhattans made by Kieran plus a special extra, we had an excellent evening of food, drink, service and atmosphere. I have been to New Orleans on numerous occasions and Muddy Waters  is the best New Orleans style restaurant in Pittsburgh hands down. Great prices! Fantastic!  Thank you Muddy Waters for making a birthday celebration so special. (They didn't know it was my birthday)  We will definitely be back!!

5Eu6LFjvkGm74YB44ebFAw.text: "Oyster of the fall" is great. I also recommend chargrilled oyster. The alligator po boy gave me memory of Florida.

JmNP5ANVdVYus_GW0IVcgw.text: Came here on a Sunday for Brunch twice, and I am a fan!  If you like oysters, this is the place for you.  My first time I came I ordered a nice spread of oysters from the East and West coast... I'm a fan of the oysters with more brine (keepin' it salty).  I personally felt the more expensive the oyster the better it tasted.  The cheaper oysters didn't taste bad though!  I've also had the chargrilled oysters and they have a nice garlic and butter taste.... Mmmmm Mmmm!  The first reason I gave it a 4/5 was because my bread wasn't toasted/chargrilled with butter for the chargrilled oysters like the photos on Yelp.  I think that would have actually added value because we just had a chunk of French bread.  The oysters were delicious though.  I ordered the country breakfast (traditional style): Eggs (your way), Grits, Meat (Bacon/Sausage/etc), Bread (biscuits/toast/etc).  It was tasty.  Their grits are super cheesy and buttery - yes, yes, yes!  They were almost like my mom used to make them back in the day.  My husband ordered the fried chicken and biscuits, and that was pretty tasty too.   If you like a good Bloody Mary Bar I believe that is their signature cocktail for brunch. They even have a mix of infusions to change up the base vodka flavor (and you can try it with tequila).  I am not a fan of them unless I have a hangover (don't judge! I've been good lately).  I noticed a lot of other tables ordered them so it must be decent.  The second reason I gave it a 4/5 is their mimosas are just "ok".  I'd give the mimosa a 3 out of 5. I prefer my mimosa to have a glass of champagne and a splash of orange juice to still be able to taste the fizz of the champagne. It shouldn't be opaque dark orange.  They're personally put too much orange juice for me (the ratio of orange juice to champagne just didn't hit the spot) and I don't believe the orange juice was fresh squeezed.  Just to make sure I wasn't crazy I went down the street to another bar and had a fresh squeeze orange juice mimosa and almost squealed with delight.  Anywho... Back to Muddy Waters Oyster Bar... They measure the champagne in a beaker first and then put the orange juice in.  Next time, I'm going to ask for a glass of champagne and ask for a shot of OJ instead.  I hope they improve the process because I love brunch and a good mimosa is a part of it.  The venue is a bit small, so definitely make reservations... Since you can do it online, why wouldn't you?  We made reservations in route just to make sure we were going to get a seat, but we ended up eating at the bar to get a view of the TV to watch football.  I'm going to have to come back for Happy Hour!

bpHyCy6XrTbKE6R2_rCDtw.text: Stopped here with my happy hour group. We were lucky enough to to get 8 seats surrounding the oyster bar. Others who for oysters (some are $1 ea during happy hour!) said they were awesome. I got the burger... Oh my god. It had 2 parties, bacon, a fried green tomato, a fried egg, pickles, spicy mayo, and who knows what else on some kind of bangin bun (challah maybe?). SO GOOD. Cocktails were also good. No beers on tap and no happy hour drink specials were not so good. It was obvious that the staff was new- getting a drink was a major challenge at times.  We'll be back, hopefully to report equally delicious food and better service.

u2evuPtb4pUqi6-JJMKxqA.text: Great service!  Food was excellent as well. We sat at the bar. Ordered drinks, apps and split an entree. Was around $100. Parking was the only downside... but not the restaurants fault.

i5jO2EROe1MlT0_WaLnvWw.text: This place was excellent! Oysters were great both from the east and west coasts! Staff were very friendly and efficient. I loved the make your own Bloody Mary bar especially with bacon vodka. I was nonplussed to not see any horseradish or Worcestershire at the bar. We'll be back!

V6crmAmj4oPuEAsIDNIKKQ.text: The oysters and seafood were great! We ordered the seafood tower that had 15 different oysters, shrimp and lobster and I would definitely order it again! We wanted to try other things on the menu but couldn't fit anymore so we will definitely be going back!

0MnTA62FiMAR-Dmk6AQNqg.text: Came for Sunday brunch-amazing food, still need to work out some kinks in service...  Upon arriving around 1pm the host asked us if we had reservations. Caught off guard (who requires brunch reservations in Pittsburgh?) my sister and I replied no. The host informed us that they were booked but we could try to get a seat at the bar. Holding out hope, my sister and I only had to wait about 10 minutes for a couple to leave the bar to grab seats. So glad we were not swayed by the host's pessimistic outlook and decided to wait it out.   Everything on the menu looked great but I chose the shrimp and grits and my sister chose the bananas foster French toast. The shrimp and grits was delicious-3 huge whole prawns in a delicious BBQ sauce with rich grits and andouille. I tried my sisters French toast which was great-not overly sweet.   I will definitely be back to try the dinner menu but perhaps give them some time to work out the service kinks. The kitchen was on point with turning out great food in a timely fashion-the servers and hosts just need to catch up.

I also had a lobster roll that was phenomenal. I went here with 6 close friends and everyone was impressed. I will definitely be back!

_qUnlPm6auTOpKnhK9Na5A.text: The food is quite good but the lousy service brings the rating down by at least one star.  Folksy is fine but our waiter's attention to our table was dismal.  Appetizer plates sat on table and I think the only reason the wait staff removed them was that there was no room for our main course.  And then we had to ask to have those plates removed after they sat on the table for 20 minutes.  Not sure I would return.

lY0sEnlkhTaEtCyxuNiYWQ.text: Very good! I ordered the Blackened Salmon and it was amazing! Every bite was pure heaven. My husband ordered the Crawfish boil, which they do every Sunday while they are in season. He enjoyed his too. Didn't try the oysters, and wish I had! If you love New Orleans food, then you will not be disappointed. Super casual inside, make a reservation if you can, it is small and I am sure they get packed quick for dinner time.

PmiYfe47ScqQts8rBLyUlA.text: Great place! Their raw oysters were delicious as well as their cocktails. The servers were all friendly and nice. It was a happening place tonight.

Y0Q_GCEzjYGevfSQR08A9w.text: Really love the oysters, but haven't been blown away from anything else on the menu.... service was great and the atmosphere is warm and cozy.

ldd1vTGDsQbwzcUmpPe3rg.text: Drinks and oysters were tops. Service was good  The food on the menu was hit and miss. So don't worry too much with the plates. The oysters are the star.

fte5CdntX2vvUSmG2PmMYw.text: This place has a great atmosphere! All of our food was delicious, we shared several small plates. Definitely recommend the hush puppies, corn bread, pierogies & fried green tomatoes! Great happy hour!

2YfCfa1gydsZi2nb9d9cDQ.text: Really only decent. The service is pretty good but prepare to be disappointed in the food if you've ever been to New Orleans. The oysters I assume tasted how oysters should we had some of the east coast varieties on the happy hour menu and they tasted like "ocean" but since it was my first time having oysters I won't make that my key critique. I was however quite disappointed in the seafood gumbo. The price met the size of the plate but the taste hardly touched the Cajun experience I was looking for and I suspect, if you're looking for spice, you'll be sorely disappointed. I will say, however, that there is a pretty good amount of meat and all of it was pretty tasty. My friend had the BBQ shrimp and grits which were also "okay" but be prepared for what "head on shell on" really means, unless you're ready to eat it that way, some prep comes with the meal. Wait staff was reasonably attentive and did a nice job describing the oyster varieties but the overall service experience was nothing special. Depending on your expectations this place really might not be worth the price.

J9WwMCjoC54kmT24tC86Kg.text: Excellent food and drinks! We ordered an east and west coast oyster platter, grilled oysters, Cajun shrimp, fried green tomatoes and as entrees I got the lobster roll and my husband got the Po' boy. Everything was amazing. The grilled oysters (oysters Rockefeller) were my favorites.

zotJLYTBYC2WO5QxVu6Vpg.text: The place is awesome, had the peacemaker po boy with fries and the oysters were delicious and that was my first time ever having them.  Will totally be back to try the menu..

82-xYOMNUDAJ-8-MexKrdA.text: Can an oyster bar in Pittsburgh really be that good? Yes, yes it is! Muddy Waters Oyster Bar is one of the best new places in Pittsburgh. The drink menu is well executed and the Ramos gin fizz was prepared well by the bartender, with lots of delicious foam, just as it should be. But those oysters, oh so tasty! I tried the east coast selection of belon and james river. Looking forward to trying the rest of the east coast and west coast offerings. The mignonette for the oysters added just the right accompaniment. The owner and staff were absolutely the nicest people to talk with! I'm already ready for another visit to try more of their dishes and drinks!

4jAe6dNFEPiYt9cxaZ4baw.text: I was in Pittsburg for three weeks, the first week I spent on visiting all the most popular restaurants and I can definitely say that the best place to eat, to drink, watch the game and communicate with nice people is Muddy Waters Oyster Bar, so the rest two weeks I went only there, as every time when I made a decision " where to go " I realized that I didn't want to go anywhere else.  My favorites : west coast oysters, shrimp cocktail , lobster roll, shargrilled oysters , BBQ shrimp and grits  and of course pecan pie as a dessert ( it's awesome!) and Rye Marple Fizz cocktail ( best ever!)
